I think the bar at ROVI provided a bit of privacy and acoustic kindness. I'd probably sit there again.
Staff were great. Helpful without being overbearing. Food was delicious and surprising, living up to expectations All four of us were delighted by the experience of eating here

I‚Äôve always appreciated this restaurant for its warmth and knowledgeable staff. Lately, though, the experience has become more transactional‚Äîfocusing on upselling rather than guiding with care. The wine pairings feel less thoughtful, and the ambiance has grown robotic rather than inviting. It‚Äôs disappointing to see what it has become, and we won‚Äôt be back. I hope they rediscover the hospitality that once made it special.

Fabulous tasty and different food. The service is fantastic, you can try a sample of wines before buying a bottle and the team were very patient with us when we stayed much longer at our table than most. Highly recommended.

I really wanted to love Rovi and went on our anniversary! I‚Äôm a fan of Otto‚Äôs recipes and chose the restaurant myself as I love vegetarian food. BUT‚Ä¶as one who has a coriander allergy it was impossible to eat at the restaurant. The waitress took the menu from me, and after speaking with the chef, she came back with the menu with everything crossed out except one meat dish (I don‚Äôt eat meat!) , burrata and hummus with pita. Rather than leaving as it was a weekend (and our anniversary), we stayed. I was disheartened and surprised that the chef couldn‚Äôt prepare one fish or chicken dish without a sauce/marinade as a solution. Seems to me at such a high end restaurant a chef should be able to accommodate allergies with some sort of creative solution. After looking so forward to this meal, I was beyond disappointed.
Fabulous food and so very creative. A bit on the high side in terms of price. Drinks were delicious and service was good..

Great experience! Discovering Ottolenghi‚Äôs cuisine was a revelation, an extraordinary and natural taste, a meticulous attention and respectful of flavors and textures, this is how dishes are born composed of simple ingredients but treated with extreme care and with great intelligence. Absolutely worth trying!

As always the food was different and absolutely delicious. Excellent service too.
It is a real pleasure to have a meal at Rovi. Thank you very much.

We went to Yotam Ottolenghi's restaurant NOPI and loved it. We promptly asked them to make a reservation for us at one of the others nearby, ROVI. Ottolenghi is known in the USA through his cookbooks. Although we aren't vegetarians, we wanted to try his vegetable dishes, which have lots of texture and flavor. It didn't disappoint... there was a roasted celeriac root dish that was magnificent--we will be roasting celeraic for the rest of our lives! The staff was very attentive and friendly at both restaurants. The cocktails at ROVI and NOPI were imaginative and fun. The vibe at both restaurants was hip and lively, not stodgy.

The food is overpriced. The service changed several times during the evening. Waiters were overwhelmed. We waited over an hour for dinner. Just a little apology after we made the complaint. We expected more from one of Yotam Ottolenghi. Quality has declined since the last visit in winter 2024. Too bad

Everything is right, interior, staff, food provided a lunch ‚Äòto remember‚Äôb Atmospheric, friendly and great tastes. 

Ottolenghi et al.'s cuisine is the best!

We had a lovely evening at Rovi. The wait staff, the food and ambience was fantastic. We enjoyed sitting at the bar and saw the action and engaged with the staff. We selected the Chef‚Äôs menu which gave us an array of amazing dishes. The crispy aubergine tops, pesto pasta was flavorful, grilled shrimp and their signature dish, celeriac shawarma were delicious. Every dish came with a unique and flavorful taste.

We were invited by friends to lunch to celebrate my husbands birthday. What great friends we have! delicious food, excellent service by exceptional people and lovely ambiance. I‚Äôve always been a huge fan of Ottolenghi, the restaurants and cafes never disappoint.

Wow wow wow!!!! An unbelievable experience! If you visit London this is a must!!! Yotam Ottolenghi has left Rovi in the more than capable hands of head chef Andy Frantzeskos and boy what a food journey this was!! Andy is sooooo passionate about the food he is serving ! My taste buds were pinging all over the place! Normally meat is top of my list but Andy‚Äôs vegetarian and fish dishes were exquisite! I can hand on heart say this was my favourite lunch ever!!!!!üòãüòãüòãüòã it did help that I had my best friend with me my son Joe!‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è hats off to you Andy! What a chef what a host. We will be back!!!!

We dined as a couple in what we understand to be not long reopened Rovi further to a refurb & were very impressed with the atmosphere, decor, the very tasty dishes we chose and all the staff, who couldn't have been more welcoming and helpful - nothing was too much trouble, even accommodating us when we turned up earlier than planned. Alex & Jacob, in particular, were great from start to finish, with Alex guiding us through the menu and sharing his recommendations & helping us pick the right number of dishes, as we wanted to try them all! The dishes were a taste sensation and definitely celebrate vegetables from root to tip. If all vegetables tasted like this, I don't think I would miss eating meat. Particular favourites were the crispy aubergine tops, celeriac shawarma & the burrata.

Loved the vibe of this restaurant. We booked it as we were looking for an exclusively gluten-free meal and they were very accomodating. Everything we had was absolutely delicious. Would definitely recommend.

This sophisticated and sociable slice of Central London is a shopper‚Äôs paradise, offering the latest fashions, gadgets, and souvenirs. Fitzrovia is conveniently located between the major retail thoroughfares of Regent Street to the west and Tottenham Court Road to the east, with a handful of well connected Tube stations dotted around the area for easy transport. This neighborhood is a favorite among foodies as well, with an impressive number of quality restaurants, pubs, cafes and food shops vying for your patronage ‚Äì especially along Charlotte Street and near Goodge Street Station.

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija:
Fantastic place. We went there for a beer so we didn't eat anything. The bartender, Anselmo, stra helpful: he made us try the different beers of the house before making us order then recommended places not to be missed in the city. What about: the right man at the right time! 

If you have just arrived in London, want a beer and need to settle in a little, this is the place for you!

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija:
Hi there,

Thank you for the fantastic review and feedback. Our bartender Anselmo will be pleased to hear of such complements. 
We hope to welcome you when back in the city. Ciao

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija: Superb, we were served by Anselmo, at the top. The bar is superb good atmosphere, very friendly and lively

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija:

Thank you for the review and feedback. We hope to welcome you back soon in the future. Merci!

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija:
Eaten two salads and a simple burger, exaggerated cost even if you are in London.....89 pounds a steal.
Good food but overpriced and location in the basement.

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija:
Hi Laura,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We‚Äôre pleased to hear that you enjoyed the food, though we‚Äôre sorry to learn that you felt the prices did not meet your expectations.

As a centrally located venue in London and part of an international brand, our pricing reflects our location, operating costs, and the overall experience we aim to offer, all of which are clearly displayed on our menu before ordering. While we understand that value is subjective, we strive to deliver quality ingredients, generous portions, and a unique atmosphere alongside our food.

We appreciate your comments and will be sure to share them with the team. Thank you again for visiting and for sharing your perspective.

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija: Great food, slight issue with one dish but the service was absolutely fantastic and more than resolved the issue and went above and beyond.

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija:

Thank you for the review, and glad to hear we turned things around. Hope to welcome you back soon!

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija: The location is gorgeous, the menu is Hard Rock Cafe style and the service is smooth and quick (multilanguage Abselmo is a pro!)

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija:

Thank you for taking the time to review, and your amazing feedback. Will pass on the complements to Anselmo.

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija: I love this branch of the Hard Rock Cafe. I love eating here and we always have a good time when we are here. Today we went to the shop. The shop is so cool, it is the biggest Rock Shop in Europe. The clothes are so cool and have great designs. There is a wide variety of things to buy here. The decor of the shop area is so cool. What‚Äôs really brilliant is that there is a facility available to book an Uber, Theatre Tickets and London Attractions. The shop is worth checking out. Hard Rock Cafe Piccadilly is close to Piccadilly Circus station.

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija:

Thank you for the lovely review and cool feedback. Glad to hear that the kiosk to book an Uber and various attraction in London area made it simple and easy to navigate.

very busy but service was excellent

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija: I happened to this Hard Rock by chance and I was served Marco and Anselmo, they were kind and professional right away, and very nice! I had a good afternoon for my birthday here! Thank you, I'll be back soon!

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus

What a wonderful review! I am so pleased to hear that you had a great time with us. This is just what we want to hear. I will be delighted to pass on your feedback and share your great experience with Anselmo and Marco. It will be great to see you again and we look forward to welcoming you back very soon!

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija: Great location right in the centre of London. Excellent environment and good food. An animated and fast team. Decoration on the walls with the Beatles and other artists. Do not forget to make the reservation on time online. We love that unforgettable night. Thank you

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus

Recenzija:
My girlfriend and I sat at the bar at Hard Rock and had an amazing time. The service was excellent‚Äîfriendly, attentive, and fast, and the atmosphere made our night even better.

A special thank you to Anselmno and Shah for taking such great care of us and making the whole experience truly enjoyable. We‚Äôll definitely be back.

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus

Great experience here in London at 'Hard Rock Cafe here in Piccadilly. Courteous staff, great environment, we spent a good time, to be repeated üí™ highly recommend to everyone, TOP staff !!!!!

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija: This Hard Rock is practically close to the tube station, in the heart of London's nightlife. The upper floor is used as a merchandising while the lower floor is the restaurant. Very good food quality and impeccable service and extremely available. In my case, after spilling a glass of coke, still not even tasted, they immediately cleaned everything up and even offered the new coke. Clean and well organized. Highly recommended

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija:
Hi there,

Thank you for taking the time to review and the amazing feedback to both our Retail Shop and Restaurant. We hope to welcome you back in the future

Ciao!

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija: Terrible experience we ordered a few starters to share and a cocktail, only to be told once food arrived we couldn't order any more cocktails due to it not being a main meal. Due licensing! Should have been mentioned at the start, complete waste of money! Such a shame too as all other hard rocks have been fab! Wouldn't return as we had high hopes üëé

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija:
Hi there,

Thank you for the review and feedback. I do understand your frustration but as our liquor license from Westminster Council specifically dictates that there is a substantial meal associated with an alcoholic beverage hence the team has mentioned it to your table and offered to be moved into the bar area where licensing restriction doesn't require such. We do ask our guest if they are for dining or just drink and a snack which you will be directed to the bar area if available at that time.

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija: it was a beautiful evening, our server Anselmo was exceptional and very kind, there was a great atmosphere. totally recommend!

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija:
Hi Monica,

Thank you for the review and feedback. Will definitely pass on the complements to our server Anselmo for the great experience at our Piccadilly location. We hope to welcome you back soon!

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija:
We had two great smash burgers, the service was quick and helpful.
Anselmo was not only a great waiter, but offered us some great suggestions on some nice places to visit during our stay here in
London! Highly recommended place also for those with food intolerances, you will be advised by the well-informed staff.

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija:

Thank you for the review and feedback. Glad to hear that you had an amazing time at our location and hope to welcome you back soon in the future.

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija: Perennially fashionable since the days of Henry VIII, the aristocratic ‚ÄúClubland‚Äù of St James's is a premier destination for high end craft and bespoke design. Here you‚Äôll lose count of the Royal Warrants (which indicate that the Royal Family patronizes the establishment) seen in shop front windows, even during a short stroll to bordering Green Park or St James‚Äôs Park. With the brightly lit and constantly buzzing junction of Piccadilly Circus at its northeast corner and none of Central London too far away, this is an surprisingly central and accessible part of town, especially given its prosperous demeanor.

A very nice place, with traditional Lebanese cuisine. Naan bred and black falafel are delicious; had never tried hummus tatbila before, and I found it absolutely tasty . You sit close together around one long shared table

We had an amazing experience at The Barbary! Sitting at the bar was perfect, you could watch the chefs at work and see their attention to detail and skill up close. The food was flavorful, creative, and beautifully presented. Definitely a spot I‚Äôd recommend to anyone who loves good food and a lively atmosphere.

Excellent restaurant! If you can get a reservation, do it. We came for lunch and had a wonderful experience. Probably the best food we ate during our trip to London. It‚Äôs a small 24 seat counter restaurant. The staff walks you through the menu and gives advice . Everything is meant to be shared. Most dishes are cooked on an open fire grill in the center of counter for all to see. The vibe is cool and the food is delicious. I Highly recommend.

Off the Chart! The Barbary did not disappoint. Food, service and ambience all amazing. Intimate, fun, great staff. A perfect date venue. And the food? Wow. The spinach, feta and yoghurt dip with nan is a must. The lamb is mouth watering. Octopus and pumpkin seeds? Can I have some more please. Nothing disappointed. Everything excelled. We were left scratching our heads if we had actually ever had a better meal anywhere (and that includes London, Paris, NY and we like to dine). The Barbary is a must. Thanks team. You are talented, welcoming and have created something very very special. We will be back very soon.

We came here to celebrate our 40th anniversary ( our son recommended the restaurant). Everyone sits at the bar which is kind of a horseshoe shape with the kitchen in the middle. Seating is a bit tight- we were greeted enthusiastically and began the process of ordering eating etc. the food was very delicious and the atmosphere was very fun. Book a table- highly recommended.

This is my personal beat meal I have had for 2025, where do I start, the atmosphere is amazing, then the service followed by the food 

Jane was truly so fabulous with helping us choose this amazing food

Been to many London Restaurants and for me is the best

What a fantastic find! We stumbled upon The Barbary while exploring the area and thought it looked interesting, so booked for lunch a few days later. An awesome experience! The restaurant is small, and tight! But.. that almost added to the experience! We were sat at the counter and watched the amazing team create their magic. Service was perfect, professional, enthusiastic and could not be faulted. The menu consists of a typical ‚Äúsharing‚Äù concept. We stared with incredible naan cooked as we watched. Humous and labneh were so fresh and bright. Their signature ‚Äúcigar‚Äù starter was hot, fresh and so flavorful with a yogurt/mint sauce. We then had the salmon and lamb, both were outstanding‚Ä¶ the salmon was pink and perfect, as was the lamb! Again incredible flavors and presentation. We added the chili cauliflower and that also was a nice combo, adding another texture to the meal. Bottle of Tempranillo, house wine but certainly decent, and we live in Spain! All in all a fantastic lunch, we cant wait to return on our next London visit.

The food was outstanding - imaginative, well prepared and well presented, if frankly expensive. The staff behind the counter were equally welcoming, attentive and interested in providing excellence in dining.

The maitre d‚Äô however made it clear that the sole purpose of the restaurant was to extract as much money as possible in as short a period of time as possible.

We were 10 minutes over our allotted 1:30 booking, with three free seats at the bar, when we were told that either we preferred something else or we should leave - this after having requested the bill from another team member.

I get it, they need to make money. It just won‚Äôt be from me in future.

Thanks, but I won‚Äôt be tricking you again.

How wonderful, everything perfect, the concept, the place. The food and the music. A mix of flavors and cultures in the dishes and in the team on this side and beyond the counter around which you eat. A group of young and very talented boys who put their different origins in the inspiration and flavors of dishes with Israeli, Arab, Lebanese influences and so on. Every dish with a tapas concept to share is a journey and a discovery. You guys deserve the success you're getting and all the best. Thank you for the wonderful experience it will be an honor and a pleasure to return to visit you

Wonderful experience! Friendly and professional staff. Blackened salmon was perfectly prepared, coffee rubbed chicken was moist and crunchy, ‚Äúcigars‚Äù great with the dip and the man was perfect. Wonderful atmosphere with the open kitchen and great music selections. Just great.

Lovely relaxed atmosphere with soft music in background. Tables are a bit too close . Service is fast yet not pushy or business like. Food I tried was perfectly cooked, right balance of flavours. Portions on the smallish sides

North African / Middle Eastern food made in front of you with live fire. This fun little gem in Neal's Yard is mainly all bar, so you can watch the food being made in front of you. It was hard to pick what I wanted to eat, as everything on the menu looked amazing. It did not disappoint. The Bavette Steak with Chermoula had me craving for more!

From the moment we walked into The Barbary we knew we would have an amazing night. The music was such fun, staff were so friendly and the restaurant was so chic. Alex looked after us and talked through the menu, making sure my intolerances were catered for. Merci Alex! 
The counter tables are fantastic and so cool to watch the chefs at work. Really recommend everything we ate; the naan, cods roe, hummus, cigars, sea bream and pork. The wine list was so unique too! Really fantastic evening, thank you!

A chance last day delight - the best meal with the best service in our entire 3 week UK visit. The food was fantastic and what could be better than sitting looking into the kitchen, literally right in front of us, where the delightful chefs shared their expertise. Every dish was richly flavored, beautifully presented and absolutely delicious. I wish it was not our very last day - I‚Äôd be back in a shot.

We went for lunch here and were really impressed, the food was incredible. We started with a selection of dips with the hummus being a particular favourite and then moved onto the mains with our favourites being the lamb and the octopus though everything was delicious. Finally desserts to finish with the hashcake (sort of a pistachio tart) being the standout. Service was friendly and helpful too, talking through the dishes and giving recommendations and we never felt rushed at all. My only tip though is booking as it can be hard to get a table (and having eaten there, I see why!).

Whether you're headed here to check out the multitude of shops, theaters, cafes, pubs, and restaurants, or simply to be among the multitude of people who pass through this pretty part of town, you'll love soaking up the festive and historic atmosphere in and around Covent Garden. Even if you don't have tickets to the opera or a show at one of the many famous theaters here, don't be surprised if find yourself captivated by some impromptu act of a street performer wowing the crowds in Covent Garden's Piazza. If you do have tickets, you'll be pleased to note that many of the local eateries accommodate theatergoers with prix fixe menus, early dinners, and later than usual opening hours.

2nd time I‚Äôve been to this cafe. Amazing breakfast good size highly recommend. 

Reasonably priced and friendly staff. A*
Affordable, good portion size and friendly service. We had the set breakfast and a side of chips. The cafe was busy but service was quick. Would return if we were in the area again.

This breakfast restaurant offers a warm, welcoming atmosphere with freshly prepared meals that feel both comforting and satisfying. The menu has a great variety, from classic breakfasts to lighter options, and the food is served hot and well presented. The staff are friendly and attentive, making the overall experience enjoyable and worth returning for.
Great cafe, very friendly staff. Tez was a lovely server! Would throughly recommend to anyone visiting for a proper old school breakfast.
Food was good! We really had a great time, the atmosphere was good, the environment was nice and the food was great so overall a good time

10/10 breakfast and best service ever from Tez! 

Great customer service and I would highly recommend the Mediterranean breakfast
Very good food, proper greasy spoon cafe. Service was great, loved the vibe of the place. Would recommend if you‚Äôre in the area

Cosy, simple caf√© with a really authentic, family vibe. Small dining area, but it just feels nice and welcoming. Halil, the host, was a fantastic guy‚Äîchatty, friendly, and cracking jokes while serving. Had the mixed d√∂ner platter; massive portion and super fresh and tasty.

Halil was amazing he really took care of us and made us laugh. The food was amazing he recommended for me to put cheese into my omelette and it made the world of a difference. Very lovely cafe with reasonable prices. Would definitely come here again.
Great jacket pot - massive tasty and cheap - nice atmosphere nice waiters - visited in lunch break with basement orchestra
Nice food, cheap price, VERY friendly staff who took the time to speak to us and make us welcome. It‚Äôs located not far from Vauxhall and Kennington and is just opposite a nice park.

Excellent local greasy spoon that I regularly visit. Great food, quickly served & very friendly service. Couldn't recommend enough

Fantastic genuine London Caf. Quick service from a delightful server. Sausages are to die for, REAL rashers (not the processed type). Fried bread which unfortunately you don‚Äôt readily get anymore.

Well done !!!!!!!!!

Such a lovely pub to have a delicious Sunday roast, i came with here with my family and i must say service was 10/10 shout out to sheila the barmaid she was so sweet and always on her toes. 
Definitely returning for more!
A good place for drinking and eating something. The decor is beautiful and the food is very good. The people are good too.
Ro the waitress is amazing and Sunday roast is best in town, the roast lamb is fabulous.Always come back!!!!!! Love the Prince of wales.
Ro was fantastic, great energy, lovely good food, very happy customer. Can't recommend enough
Excellent service from Ro who was lovely üåπüåπ friendly and chatty.Beautiful experience.

The Sunday roast dinner was amazing! We had the chicken roast and everything was delicious. We also had the crumble with custard for dessert and it was great too. We weren‚Äôt sure we had the right place when we walked in as it seems like a spot for locals but everyone was nice and the service and food was great!

The Prince of Wales is conveniently located near my hotel. After a long day of travel, I was looking f forward to a pint and a nice lunch. The BLT is fresh and the onion rings are on par with any American restaurant. A good selection of beers too. The bartender was attentive and friendly. Great location too right off of High Street Kensington

Great food, good value and service by Ro excellent. Guinness at a good temperature and the Merlot and Shiraz was great 
GRL

We went to Prince of Wales for the Sunday roast after a day of museum hopping. What a pleasure to sit in the bar and eat such a delicious beef roast with all the trimmings. The owner, we think... Tom? Welcomed us. There was a birthday going on in the corner table and two couples in a banquette. Such a charming atmosphere. By the time we left we had shared our sticky toffee pudding and were offered a sluce of birthday cake. 
We went back for lunch another say and the fish and chips were delicious and Sheila a lovely, attentive server. 
We will be back! A call out to the nice lady in the kitchen. Thank you from Southern California.
Ro was brilliant - amazing service - great food too - a lovely local London pub. Tom is a brilliant landlord. We‚Äôll be back üëå

We booked here for our son‚Äôs suprise 21st Birthday party and couldn‚Äôt recommend it enough - Tom, Margaret and the team helped with everything from putting up all of the decorations for us to ordering the DJ in (Smokey was great) and the food was absolutely delicious. The place is in a great location and is spotless, everyone was warm and welcoming and 100% recommend you use this place THANK YOU!
Bar staff especially the male member with basic skill, food on the other hand was lovely compliments to the chef please.
Food was excellent, staff was very friendly. Ro was our server and she was lovely, very helpful. We had a great evening!!

It‚Äôs been a great experience and the food was delicious. The atmosphere is really lovely and warm. Our waitress Ro has been super friendly and gives us some tips for Karaoke. We will definitely be back .

Restoran: OXO Tower Restaurant, Bar and Brasserie
Recenzija: Tripadvisor is not responsible for this summary or the opinions in it. For more information, please read the traveler reviews and learn more about how the site works.

Restoran: OXO Tower Restaurant, Bar and Brasserie
Recenzija: This is a classy restaurant with great service, great food and great views. The team are really attentive and unobstructive and take great care with special requirements.

Restoran: OXO Tower Restaurant, Bar and Brasserie
Recenzija:
We haven‚Äôt been here for a while, but it is still being exactly what you want from a good restaurant.
We came for lunch and the menu was delightfully short, but with plenty of choice. The crab on a potato waffle was delicious, and the stracciatella with poached pears was a really wonderful surprise. One of us had a most tender and nicely cooked fillet of beef with mushrooms and the Shetland halibut was amazing. 
Paired with an excellent wine and a small digestif, we left comfortably full and very relaxed.
Service was kind and friendly. This isn‚Äôt a place to come to if you‚Äôre on a budget, but if you want to splash out, it is worth the money in our view.

Restoran: OXO Tower Restaurant, Bar and Brasserie
Recenzija:
A simply extraordinary dining experience at London‚Äôs OXO Restaurant, where elegance, technique and sensitivity coexist in perfect balance.
Each dish tells a story made of excellent raw materials, great aesthetic care and impeccable room service: attentive, discreet and always smiling.

Special applause goes to the Scottish Langoustine dish, carrot, ginger, shellfish aioli, which literally left me speechless. I only tasted a few bites off my girlfriend's plate, and I was astonished.

A dish of great style and precision, where the following coexist harmoniously:

Elegant carrot sweetness

Spicy aromatic ginger, never intrusive

Intense and clean sea depth of langoustine

Controlled and enveloping fatness of shellfish aioli

A rare, refined, memorable balance.

Precisely because of the emotion that this dish gave me, I allow myself a curiosity as a great enthusiast:
I would love to be able to recreate it for my girlfriend one day. Would it be possible to know, even if only in outline, the recipe or philosophy of the dish?
In particular, I would like to know if inside the zucchini cannolo there are only scampi or even other fish or crustaceans, and what is the meaning and technique of the yellow lines on the zucchini, which are very intriguing both from an aesthetic and taste point of view. A more in-depth description would really be a gift.

Definitely I will be back, and will definitely recommend this restaurant to all my friends who will come to London: OXO is a must for those who love great cuisine.

Sincere congratulations to the kitchen and the service of the room.
Thank you very much for this beautiful dining experience, which I will carry with me for a long time.

Restoran: OXO Tower Restaurant, Bar and Brasserie
Recenzija: Great atmosphere , good food and friendly staff. Easy location to find with a great view‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.amazing cocktails.

Restoran: OXO Tower Restaurant, Bar and Brasserie
Recenzija:
Lovely pre theatre dinner. Took advantage of the 3 courses and glass of prosecco for ¬£35. Excellent value even with the dishes and wine we added on. Lovely attentive service, didn't feel at all rushed.
Having read negative reviews about the temperature of the space we were slightly concerned but needn't have been, in fact was on the very warm side.
Food excellent üòÅ and portions large (couldn't finish dessert).
Great.

Restoran: OXO Tower Restaurant, Bar and Brasserie
Recenzija: If you're going to eat here, you should definitely bring blankets. With an outside temperature of 1 degree, it is not more than 15 degrees inside. In addition, a fresh wind blows from the air conditioning, which quickly makes the good food cold. At a price of ¬£560 for four people, the explanation of the service doesn't help either that there's a lot of glass around and that's why it's so cold.... Well, we're not coming back... maybe in the summer

Restoran: OXO Tower Restaurant, Bar and Brasserie
Recenzija:
I was with my family for dinner, unrefined environment with New Year's Eve arrangements from paese.Personale unkind and a menu with prices absolutely out of the norm compared to what is proposed on the plate.
To ask for certain prices you have to have a chef in the kitchen who is able to cook in a certain way and in the room of kind people.
I absolutely do not recommend this place, the view is beautiful but not enough.
I felt fooled.

Restoran: OXO Tower Restaurant, Bar and Brasserie
Recenzija:
Lovely food, great service, relaxed. Reassuringly excellent comms beforehand. 

Everything about our visit was excellent and hit just the right note for a post-graduation celebration meal. 

We were asked beforehand if it was a special occasion and my daughter felt very special that she was greeted with congratulations at reception. The dessert option with a message piped on rounded things off perfectly.

Every single person we encountered, from outside the lift arriving to when we left, was friendly, courteous and really excellent at what they were doing. A super standard of food. We were really grateful for the window seating, which we had not requested and was a real bonus in making our daughter‚Äôs day memorable. As the Principal at her graduation said to them all, ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt know your whole stories and what it took for you to make it through to now, but we see you.‚Äù Our daughter deserved her day, and our time in the brasserie added perfectly to it.

Restoran: OXO Tower Restaurant, Bar and Brasserie
Recenzija:
Lovely view, friendly vibe, attentive helpful staff and gorgeous food!!
Fish and sea food tasty and fresh.
Will definitely revisit!

Restoran: OXO Tower Restaurant, Bar and Brasserie
Recenzija:
The service was great, well catered for and checked upon frequently but not often enough to be annoying.
We went for Afternoon Tea. The menu was as expected and the Salmon (my weakness) was perfect.
The tea selection was large but the options were very similar.
Scenery was ideal as we watched the contrast from a bright day to night views (3pm to 5pm).
A bit pricey and would have rather been asked to donate to charity rather than it be included on the bill without any forewarning. 
The Xmas crackers at ¬£3.75ea (inc a donation) were VERY basic, not something I would associate with Harvey Nichols, more Poundland.
Overall, a nice experience for me and my partner.

Restoran: OXO Tower Restaurant, Bar and Brasserie
Recenzija: One of our favourite restaurants in London and we booked for our Christmas meal with close friends. Unfortunately we were surprised at the greatly increased prices compared with our last visit a few months ago. Seems they were exploiting Christmas time. The service was excellent as usual but our meals were only average For example, my friend and I chose halibut which came with a few vegetables was ¬£49 excluding sides. The piece of fish was very small and virtually tasteless. A great disappointment. Perhaps the word had got around because for a Friday night close to Christmas the restaurant was less than half full

Restoran: OXO Tower Restaurant, Bar and Brasserie
Recenzija:
Probably the best view of St Paul's Cathedral from anywhere, but it isn't worth the price. Starters all cost more than ¬£20 - for two scallops? - and ¬£46 for a piece of under-seasoned halibut not much bigger than my thumb, sitting in an insipid green sauce. 

All this is probably reflected in the place being half empty on the Friday before Christmas. It's a pity because we've eaten well there previously and the location is great. Service was good. The room was cold, I'm not sure whether this was due to aircon too high or heating too low.

Restoran: OXO Tower Restaurant, Bar and Brasserie
Recenzija: It‚Äôs been a few years since I was here and I had been many times before that. The crab starter on a potato waffle was dire. The waffle was more like a stale reheated spongecake. The main dish of Pork was lukewarm as if it had been cooked on a radiator. The crushed potatoes were unremarkable and also cold, the cauliflower arrived 5 mins after we started eating and guess what? Was stone cold but it was taken off the bill. Staff are super lovely, but the service was far too quick, I think we‚Äôd had both courses in 45 mins.

Restoran: OXO Tower Restaurant, Bar and Brasserie
Recenzija:
Just wanted to say thank you for yesterday ‚Äì really appreciate all the support and everyone being so accommodating.

The dinner was lovely and the team really enjoyed it!

Restoran: OXO Tower Restaurant, Bar and Brasserie
Recenzija:
Our afternoon tea was superb, including the offer of a glass of champagne. We tried hard to resist but two seconds later we said ‚ÄúYes!‚Äù
The service was excellent and the staff very helpful in terms of our onward journey.

Restoran: OXO Tower Restaurant, Bar and Brasserie
Recenzija:

Great fresh pasta restaurant
It‚Äôs delicious 
The staff is very friendly
Only downside is the noise with the world and the music

We asked what dishes were vegetarian on arriving and the waiter was very helpful and ticked all that applied, as it isn‚Äôt listed on the menu. When we came to ordering, he asked us if we wanted extra parmesan. 

With parmesan generally not vegetarian, we were surprised by the question so enquired. His response was ‚Äúwell, it‚Äôs personal preference as to whether you consider it vegetarian or not. But it contains animal rennet. We don‚Äôt consider it non-vegetarian here‚Äù. 

Seems so strange to me that a restaurant like this is passing off parmesan with animal rennet in it as vegetarian, but this is really poor and an exceptional lack of awareness and training. And then turned out that some of the dishes that had been indicated to us on the menu as vegetarian, such as the pumpkin ravioli, had parmesan within it. 

Having changed our order, the food we did get to me was overrated compared to what I expected. The pasta dishes are small and the only standout was the chilli pasta - the cacio e pepe was disappointing, as was the cavolo nero dish which was bland. Wouldn‚Äôt return.

Ciao sbrady123, I hope you are doing well.
Thanks for taking time to give us your feedback, and I‚Äôm sorry you didn‚Äôt find your experience as good as your expectations.
This is definitely not the way we like to take care of our customers, giving the ‚Äúwrong‚Äù information or not being specific when it comes to food requirement.
I would like to investigate better about your visit to our restaurant and having a proper chat with my staff.
Please reach out to my email for that: francesco.c@padella.co
I wish you a good weekend.
Francesco.

Net of the discomfort resulting from the fact that they do not accept reservations and then you have to mark yourself at the entrance and wait (for a good hour) for the table to clear, anyone who was catapulted by Pan blindfolded, would think they were in Italy... Italian cuisine is of a very high level, fresh pasta that resembles those made by mom, tasty sauces, but delicate. The top is value for money, well above the London average. In our living room, we had such a good time, that we had dinner twice. For Italians in London who are abstinent from flour and eggs, this is the place!
Lunch at borough market restaurant. Very good homemade pasta and very friendly staff. I recommend for a quick lunch

padella was an experience by self . 

great pastas, freshly made from scratch in front of you, a must visit restaurant in london

My friend and I had a pre-Christmas lunch in the Shoreditch Padella. The staff were so lovely and attentive with ordering and bringing water. The food was delicious we both had the Dorset crab pasta with a glass of wine and then shared a lemon tart which was amazing and so velvety. The portion sizes were perfect. The restaurant had a great vibe and was busy, I was glad I booked. Would definitely recommend.
I loved every bit of my food at padella. Freshly made in front of you with fresh ingredients. A experience unique from rest . A must visit in london
A very tiny restaurant and you use a QR code to get a table. It‚Äôs worth the effort as the food and service is amazing. Highly recommended

Beautiful Food - 100% worth a visit!

We came across this place while we were in London trying to find somewhere near to where we are staying. There is a virtual queue to go in which to me is a good sign. We got a text when our table was ready and were served by a really lovely waitress who was friendly and informative. We had gorgeous starters and pasta mains which were both very very good and just the right amount.

I would say this place is a must when you are in the area and not expensive either! We shall return!!

Another tuck-your-elbows-in spot and we loved it. It‚Äôs a lively and tight space serving some great food. The menu offers a great selection of handmade pastas, with as well antipasti, puddings and digestivi to choose from. We kicked things off with the Nocellara olives and radicchio salad then moved onto Pici cacio e pepe and the Pappardelle with 8-hour Dexter beef shin rag√π. Everything was wonderful!

Anticipate a queue, we did not and waited a while outside with others.

Never disappoints- service always great, food is vv good and prices have remained impressively reasonable. Waiters are super friendly and accommodating, atmosphere is always buzzing. Portions are good and the pasta is excellent quality. Also a big fan of the reservation system which allows turning up an hour before eating and strolling along southbank until your table is ready. Will always keep coming back here. Recommend the rag√∫ and the tagliolini, do not skip the tiramisu.

Great food, friendly service, just a really nice little place for a good catch up with a friend. They don't take bookings but have a virtual queuing system you can join, so you don't have to stand for a long time waiting outside.
Great food, great staff, wasntt so keen on my wine choice..but restaurant all in all great
Got a table last minute and it was worth it. Food was delish, 10 out of 10. Spend money on the food because its teally good. Went for the cheapest wine, thought it was pricey and it was ok

Nice and informal location near Borough Market, very convenient because we did not wait in line but they recorded us and called us with a text message when the table was freed! 
The pasta is excellent as in Italy, special cheese and pepper! We were greeted by Francesco super nice and sympathetic who advised us and even offered coffee!

Book in and join a virtual queue. It said 60 mins but it was only about 30 to 40 before we were messaged, and seated. There are very few tables. Most seating is on stools either around the kitchen, or the window. We were seated looking into the kitchen. It was fascinating watching the food being prepared. Everyone doing their job so quickly and proficiently. We all had different pasta dishes, and everyone thoroughly enjoyed what they had. The food was well presented and delicious. The staff were very friendly and helpful, explaining patiently when we were unsure what a dish contained.

Even before the arrival of the instantly iconic Shard, the riverside scene in Southwark had moved well beyond any up-and-coming phase of development. For quite some time, locals and out-of-towners alike have loved browsing the boutiques of Bermondsey High Street, foraging through the bounteous stalls at centuries old foodie haven Borough Market, and flocking to the banks of the Thames to enjoy some of Britain's biggest attractions such as Tate Modern and Shakespeare's Globe. Despite Southwark's many popular draws, instant calm can be achieved easily by turning down almost any side street. For more urban buzz, a quick stroll across famed bridges like the pedestrianized Millennium Bridge or the ever photogenic Tower Bridge yields access to the very core of Central London. And with London Bridge Station as this neighborhood's main transportation hub, getting across town (or to anywhere in England for that matter) is a relative breeze.

If you only had an afternoon to experience London on a grand scale, Westminster would be a wise place to start. The ornate Houses of Parliament and Westminster Abbey sit adjacent at a corner of Parliament Square, and a short stroll along The Mall leads to Buckingham Palace. Trafalgar Square and Nelson's Column are just up the road as well. As captivating as the architecture is, the wonders of Mother Nature are highlights of the area too. St James's Park (arguably London's loveliest), the expansive Green Park, and pedestrian friendly tree lined paths along the river showcase the exquisite manicure provided by English gardeners. Just beyond the landmarks and the gorgeous outdoor spaces, quiet residential squares and age old local pubs offer a more subdued take on this global seat of power in the heart of London.

Have to say this place has up the levels since i last came with new dishes on the menu which unfortunately i dodnt get a chance to try.

 I brought my friend to try out the breakfast OMG dish and the other dish with the french toast it was absolutely amazing, the decor, the atmosphere was very relaxing a good place to chill and catch up whilst indulging in great food. 

The pictures on their website match exactly as you see it in reality. There's a free parking area 5 mins down the road for 2 hrs or right opposite manor house station. 

 Zena was a great hostess and was very helpful telling is about the history of the shop and what are the go too dishes. Would definitely recommend to try it out, big upgrade on your normal cafe would be very silly not to try this place out.
The food, drinks, service & atmosphere were all 12/10. Easily one of the best breakfasts in London, such attention to detail. zena served us and was so friendly and kind. We will def be back

This is my third time going to Dobar when I travel England London with my family. This time we went on Sunday at 12.00 midday. There was a little bit of a queue but I know from previous visits that it was worth the wait ( which wasn't more than 5/10 mins). The staff are so happy and friendly and apologized for the wait but sat us and served us very speedily. The service is fast, not rushed although they know more people are waiting outside. The food is amazing and I mean it when I say that it is the best brunch I have ever had anywhere, for that reason I go back even though this time we was in a hotel on the other side of London. It will always be my go to place on my visits to London if they keep up with this quality and service. Thanks. I will dream of your brunches until next time I can visit.

First time at Dobar and I would definitely return. The staff are warm and courteous. The food came moments after ordering, so no long wait. The environment is cosy. Not loud. You can have a good conversation while you're there. An added plus is that it is literally a step from the Manor House Station.
Excellent service and food of superb quality with great presentation. The staff is super attentive and concerned about the customer's well-being.

Friendly and welcoming staff and the the food was very tasty and fresh. This place has not change from the last time I visited and cannot recommend it enough. Even though it is not my local, I make the trip over to enjoy the experience of a great breakfast

food was the best
service on point
served by Memet - great guy
got the french toast - fuit was fresh aswell, 
overall great experience

Stopped in for a late lunch and was pleasantly surprised. The service was fast and friendly, and the food was fresh and delicious. I had the chicken sandwichand it was perfect. Great atmosphere for a casual meal. Will definitely be back next time I'm in the area
Lovely service, very attentive. Food is good. Hot drinks are lovely, warm and heartfelt. Food decor well! Fruits are fresh. The waitress Zeynep was great and welcoming.

We then ate at Dobar! Food was very good, menu selection was good and the staff of the restaurant was very friendly particularly Danilo. The service by Danilo added all the more to our enjoyment of the visit. We can not wait to come back with our next visit to Liverpool!
The food was great and it came pretty quick. Zeynep was a amazing server. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.
Great service by the waitress Zeynep and amazing food and drinks. Everything came very quickly. Very friendly atmosphere :)

Famous for its sprawling cluster of markets and shops as well as for an embrace of all things counter culture, Camden offers a concentrated version of London street life. From bargain shopping and people watching to rubbing elbows in its abundance of pubs and bars, Camden is the place to be for many a Londoner. It is also home to some of the hottest live music venues in Europe. As packed as Camden High Street and its tributaries can get during the weekends, this neighborhood is right next to some of the city's most beloved outdoor spaces, namely Regent's Park and Primrose Hill.

If you have just arrived in London, want a beer and need to settle in a little, this is the place for you!

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija:
Hi Laura,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We‚Äôre pleased to hear that you enjoyed the food, though we‚Äôre sorry to learn that you felt the prices did not meet your expectations.

As a centrally located venue in London and part of an international brand, our pricing reflects our location, operating costs, and the overall experience we aim to offer, all of which are clearly displayed on our menu before ordering. While we understand that value is subjective, we strive to deliver quality ingredients, generous portions, and a unique atmosphere alongside our food.

We appreciate your comments and will be sure to share them with the team. Thank you again for visiting and for sharing your perspective.

Restoran: Hard Rock Cafe London Piccadilly Circus
Recenzija: Perennially fashionable since the days of Henry VIII, the aristocratic ‚ÄúClubland‚Äù of St James's is a premier destination for high end craft and bespoke design. Here you‚Äôll lose count of the Royal Warrants (which indicate that the Royal Family patronizes the establishment) seen in shop front windows, even during a short stroll to bordering Green Park or St James‚Äôs Park. With the brightly lit and constantly buzzing junction of Piccadilly Circus at its northeast corner and none of Central London too far away, this is an surprisingly central and accessible part of town, especially given its prosperous demeanor.

Maroto is billed as a Brazilian-European fusion restaurant and is a lively spot just off Oxford Street.
The menu is mainly meat based, the lamb rack was excellent, but there are vegetarian and fish options and the cod/white feijao dish was perfect. The dessert list is short with the bomboca/coffee/baileys ice cream our favourite.
Although the cocktail list is strong the wine list could do with beefing up with a limited choice and it was a pity the Brazilian sparkling wine was no longer available.
Service was friendly and it is well worth a visit. At ¬£65 for two courses and ¬£75 for three as well as a ¬£95 tasting menu be prepared to pay for the experience.
The food was absolutely delicious, and the service was excellent everything was perfectly prepared and served with great care. A wonderful dining experience overall!
Amazing restaurant, very good service and food, warm atmosphere and a lovely setting. Perfect spot highly recommend it!!! We‚Äôll definitely be coming back!
Its location is very convenient as you are in the center of London. The atmosphere and the staff are excellent! Very comfortable and beautiful! The food also had very special flavors!
I had an amazing time with my friends in Maroto! Great atmosphere, very intimate environment amazing for a catch up with friends

Maroto is honestly one of the nicest spots I‚Äôve been to. The atmosphere is so cozy and welcoming, and it instantly makes you feel relaxed. The food is amazing‚Äîfull of flavor, fresh, and really well cooked. There‚Äôs a good variety on the menu too, so there‚Äôs something for everyone. The staff are super friendly and helpful, which makes the whole experience even better. I love how everything feels easy and comfortable, whether you‚Äôre going with friends, family, or just grabbing a nice meal out. Overall, Maroto is the kind of place you‚Äôll want to keep coming back to.

I had an incredible experience dining at Maroto in Mayfair. From the moment I walked in, I was struck by the stylish yet welcoming atmosphere. The staff were attentive and made me feel genuinely cared for throughout the evening. The food was outstanding ‚Äì beautifully presented and bursting with flavour. I loved how each main came with a variety of sauces, offering a perfect balance of tastes. My personal highlight was the tender pork belly, though the prawns and desserts were equally impressive. Everything felt refined without being pretentious. Maroto is truly a memorable restaurant that I can‚Äôt wait to revisit.
Moroto Restaurant offers a wonderful dining experience with delicious food, warm service, and a welcoming atmosphere‚Äîhighly recommend!" Very nice location

Even before the arrival of the instantly iconic Shard, the riverside scene in Southwark had moved well beyond any up-and-coming phase of development. For quite some time, locals and out-of-towners alike have loved browsing the boutiques of Bermondsey High Street, foraging through the bounteous stalls at centuries old foodie haven Borough Market, and flocking to the banks of the Thames to enjoy some of Britain's biggest attractions such as Tate Modern and Shakespeare's Globe. Despite Southwark's many popular draws, instant calm can be achieved easily by turning down almost any side street. For more urban buzz, a quick stroll across famed bridges like the pedestrianized Millennium Bridge or the ever photogenic Tower Bridge yields access to the very core of Central London. And with London Bridge Station as this neighborhood's main transportation hub, getting across town (or to anywhere in England for that matter) is a relative breeze.

Shanghai Family (Â§ßÊª¨‰ªÅÂÆ∂) is one of the few places in London where you can taste truly authentic Shanghainese cuisine

Shanghai Family (Â§ßÊª¨‰ªÅÂÆ∂) is one of the few places in London where you can taste truly authentic Shanghainese cuisine, and I‚Äôve already gone back several times. The braised pork belly is rich but not greasy and literally melts in your mouth; the pan-fried soup dumplings have thin skins, crispy bottoms and plenty of broth; and the new claypot dishes come with a flavorful, comforting broth and generous ingredients (including egg dumplings, which instantly reminded me of home). The Mao Xue Wang has a well-balanced spicy and numbing kick without being overly oily, and pairs perfectly with rice. The restaurant is clean, dishes come out quickly, the average price is around ¬£30 per person, and the location next to the British Museum is very convenient. If you‚Äôre craving genuine Shanghainese food in London, this place is absolutely worth trying.

Shanghai Family is a restaurant in London where you can get an authentic taste of Shanghai. I've had it many times. Red roast meat fat but not greasy, mouth instant, raw fried buns thin, crisp bottom, ample juice; new casserole series soup head fresh, rich ingredients (actually there are dumplings, people feel instantly home)

This restaurant is definitely going on my list of Chinese places I‚Äôd happily return to. We ordered the sizzling spicy pork intestines, xiaolongbao, and scallion oil noodles, and every dish was spot on. The spicy intestines arrived in a fragrant pool of chili oil with a bold, layered numbing-spicy kick that wasn‚Äôt just harsh heat; the intestines were cleaned really well with virtually no off smell, and the texture was pleasantly chewy yet tender and incredibly flavorful. The xiaolongbao had thin skins that held up nicely, with plenty of savory broth and juicy, fresh filling that wasn‚Äôt greasy; a little vinegar made them even better, and we immediately wanted another basket. The scallion oil noodles looked simple but were deeply aromatic, with a balanced savory sauce and springy noodles that coated evenly in every bite. Overall, the flavors were authentic and the quality was consistent, satisfying, comforting, and highly recommended.

I like Family Feast Hot Pot best
The moment this pot arrived at the table, you just knew it was something special.
The prawns were incredibly fresh.
The handmade egg dumplings were a real highlight ‚Äî one bite and it instantly brought back familiar, comforting flavors from home.
The meatballs were a pleasant surprise: fragrant, tender, and absolutely delicious.
Add to that the glass noodles and pork tripe, each soaked up the broth beautifully.
The soup base was rich yet not greasy, clean and deeply savory.
For a moment, it truly felt like being home again.

A lovely Chinese restaurant with authentic flavours and generous portions. The dishes were well-seasoned and clearly freshly prepared, especially the mains, which stood out for their depth of flavour. Service was friendly and attentive without being intrusive, and the atmosphere was relaxed and welcoming. A great spot for both casual meals and small gatherings. Would happily return.

Solid Shanghainese food and very satisfying overall. The dishes were tasty, comforting, and felt quite authentic ‚Äî especially the braised pork and dumplings. Portions were decent and everything came out hot and fresh. Service was quick and friendly. Would happily come back when craving Shanghai-style food.

Come over with a friend to try this Shanghainese food and the experience is very good. The service is warm and the food is fast. We ordered the signature little cage bag and raw frying bag, which tasted amazing and had a rich soup. To go with it, a refreshing little stir-fry of lotus pond (with lotus flakes and murine ears) was also ordered, and the ingredients were fresh. It's really nice to eat such an authentic home flavor here, and will come often!

Spectacular staffs. Very patient with providing recommendations. 

Food arrived very swiftly, and the food was absolutely on point. Great representation of shanghai food. 

Cannot praise enough of the braised pork belly which was served on a plate with candle below to keep it warm. Absolutely on point

Overall, great service nice environment with a fair price.

Really enjoyed the very authentic Shanghai cuisine. I would say it's a rare find in the heart of London and it's just too perfect place to dine before watching devil wears prada !!! The braised pork belly is so tender and flavourful and all the traditional dishes just brings me back to China ‚ú®
London's authentic Shanghai flavor, raw frying buns small cage buns must order

As someone who has an attachment to Shanghai snacks, this store really gives me so much satisfaction. It's near the UCL and the location is great. Their raw frying buns were deliberately ordered, with a thin, crisp bottom, and a bite to go down juicy, very authentic! Small cage buns are also excellent, with thin skins and fresh soup. It also ordered a Dongpo meat with rice, stewed soft and sticky, fat and not greasy. Definitely a five-star recommended treasure restaurant!
Beer duck is delicious ÔºåCrab meat soup dumplings are also delicious; they burst with juice in every bite. The environment is nice, and they play good songs. The waiters were very warm and patient.
I went there with my family and all of us enjoyed the dinner there. Every dish was very delicious. It‚Äôs definitely my top 3 Chinese restaurant in London.
As a Chinese grew up near Shanghai, their dishes are authentic. I like the xiaolongbao a lot, reminded me of home ! The service is quite good.

For Winter Solstice and Christmas, we wanted a place where friends could gather and celebrate together.
We felt warm and welcoming here‚ù§Ô∏è
Super delicious food. I like the noodle with the yellow fish the best. The pan fried bun is authentic as well. And the price is sensible. Just gonna put the restaurant on my take-out list.

superb table, friendly and professional service
I highly recommend
Philippe

We were looking for a Lebanese restaurant with my girlfriend and we did not regret our choice. Nestled in a quiet little street in the Marais, this restaurant is already our heart! An impeccable service despite the high attendance, and the waiters are good advisors. I recommend 100%!!
Best Lebanese restaurant we have tasted and I can tell you that we have tasted quite a lot in Paris! Special mention at Tabuleh reminds me of my grandmother's!

The best lunch in Paris! 
Thanks to Martin, the waiter who followed us and advised us in a perfect way both on the quantity and on the dishes to try. 
Well-kept and welcoming place, prepared and very kind staff, delicious food: the quality of the products is excellent and the dishes delicious. 
We had a mixed appetizer and chicken with rice. The portions are generous. 
A special mention also for the dessert, a memorable MOUHALABIA. 
An experience we will remember for a long time!
Fine, authentic dinner in friendly surroundings. A great, good choice for both meat eaters and vegetarians. The service was very nice and helpful, although the restaurant was fully booked.

What a nice place! On a rainy chilly December evening we ended up in this warm and cozy restaurant. Pleasant, go-free and smooth service, with room for a chat despite being busy. 

Then the dishes. We chose a selection of the chef which turned out to be a real party. Tons round and even mentally satisfied we rolled out two hours later, onto the drizzly streets of Paris

A welcome from the aging locals. Not very fine cuisine even if the quantity is there.
In addition we were 2 adults and 2 children and wanted to take 2 formulas at 41 e including mezzes and skewers with accompaniment and mezzes at 31 e to share all this among us. And there the waiter served us a convoluted story that if we took 2 formulas the second formula would not include skewers....in short we felt he wanted us to spend bcp more. 
In the end, everything disappointed us.
Excellent Lebanese dishes, both in quality and quantity, very warm welcome, pleasant environment, more than satisfactory value for money. Excellent service.

Very nice atmosphere. Something hidden in a side street.
Nice service and great Lebanese food. Fully recommended.

Lovely dishes with good tastes

Dessert we got spanded on by the house. 
I highly recommend this restaurant. Lots of food.
Very friendly service, very good food, fine ambience. Table at the door a bit cool, but I was helped with a small electric oven. Generous hospitality

Quality of food and top service.
We enjoyed it.
Ideal for vegetarians also thanks to the wide choice of Lebanese cuisine.
Staff and boss attentive.
Excellent restaurant, deserves to be among the best by Trip Advisor! From the reception by what I think is the owner, the delicious food and the impeccable care of the friendly Saja!!!!!
The food is delicious, the service is very attentive. All this in a cozy decor. Everything is perfect. Excellent restaurant, to discover

The most amazing and welcome experience from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. We realised we had been to the other branch a year ago and Zak was looking after us then and he made such a fuss of us. Sasha was amazing with her recommendations and taking care of us at the table felt like our new happy place a home in Paris

A winter in Paris, with scalpel: iodine, truffle and smoke noble au Pur‚Äô

In Pur‚Äô, winter is not a scenery: it is a scripture. A large table kitchen that prefers precision to emphasis, depth to sloppiness. Your journey, thought out with a real intelligence of chords, tells a cold and bright Paris: sharp iodine, mastered bitters, noble smoke, and this delicate obsession with relief that makes great houses.

The appetizers give the measure right away. Pike cromesqui is a school departure: crisp without heaviness, impeccable gold, fat just what it takes to whet the appetite. The cheese‚Äìradishes‚Äìpoutargue tartlet has this very Parisian chic: sliced radish, caresses cheese, poutargue sign in marine ink. Then comes the wink ‚Äî chocolate & foie gras ‚Äî and we understand that the chef loves adult contrasts: if cocoa remains bitter, we touch this rare delicacy, the one that does not seek to please but to impose.

The oysters then arrive like a reset, a clear passage: the sea without theater. Sylvaner vintages 2022 is a choice of aesthetic, dry, straight, silent ‚Äî a wine that adds nothing and, for that very reason, enlarges the taste.

The ‚ÄúHarmony‚Äù dish is one of the most beautiful ideas on the menu: squash could pour in comfort, but pickles, endive and tangerine come to cut edges. Winter is not sweet: it is structured. The Saumur blanc 2022 ‚ÄúThe Unusual‚Äù does a sewing job here: tension, straightness, and what it takes to dress the velvet.

Santiago, escorted by farofa, chorizo and lime, is played on a thread. It is the most exposed plate: mother-of-pearl versus smoky, sweetness versus spice, lime as final blade. The Chassagne-Montrachet 2023 is a big table bet: superb if it is chiseled and served with freshness, more fragile if it widens. But we like a house to take on a risk zone ‚Äî it‚Äôs a sign that it‚Äôs looking for rightness, not ease.

Then comes the moment when the room drops in a tone: Alba‚Äôs white truffle flax. White truffles are not an ingredient, they are a presence. Poultry and foie gras bring roundness, sage and burnt onion draw a shadow. The Rosso Bacher, served with restraint, has the intelligence to stay in its place: accompany the flesh, respect the perfume, never become the subject. On the white truffle, a wine that ‚Äúshines‚Äù is often a wine that destroys; here, the wine serves the kitchen, and that is what makes great.

The linen bar with vadouvan artichoke, black garlic and flame shells is a high aerobatic exercise ‚Äî the artichoke is a notorious saboteur. And it is here that the sommelier signs one of the beautiful gestures of the evening: Domaine des Ardoisi√®res 2021. Mineral, tense, salty, almost mountainous: it stabilizes the artichoke, encases the umami of black garlic, prolongs the iodine without crushing it. School agreement, rare, memorable.

The buccaneered Wagyu encloses the salt like a dark cathedral: noble smoke, controlled fermentation, luxurious fat. You needed a wine that was ripe, serious, without hardness: Ch√¢teau Meyney 2011 responds present, melted tannins, earth depth, impeccable hold on the umami. A finale that does not shout ‚Äúpower‚Äù, but ‚Äúmastery‚Äù.

And the sweet outing is a model of good taste: the buckwheat & Boskoop puffed pancake, black beer and cider, does not seek sugar but adult delicacy. The concluding umeshu ‚Äì tangy sweetness, stone/almond, freshness ‚Äì finishes the meal in elegance, without heaviness, as a last sentence pronounced in a low voice.

Verdict: a great table that can write winter. Constructed dishes, intelligent pairings, a progression that gains depth without ever becoming heavier. If we had to summarize: au Pur‚Äô, gastronomy is not fireworks ‚Äî it is architecture

To C√©dric G.,

Nous vous remercions infiniment pour ce retour d‚Äôexception !

We loved our table, where we were seated, but also noted that the restaurant gives ample space and privacy regarding every table within. And, the restaurant in its entirety is really a lovely setting. One of the most memorable dining experiences ever! Our thanks to all at Pur'. Bravo!

UNFORGETTABLE!
I would like to sincerely thank all the teams of the pure epicure for this moment spent with them.
A romantic birthday meal that will remain engraved.
The welcome, the service, the kitchens... exceptional!

A huge thank you to the team for allowing us to meet and visit the kitchens
An unforgettable moment for me. THANK YOU

I tip my hat to the chef obviously but also to the second for the realization of this menu.
New chef, new map and new wonder!

I can only recommend the discovery of the establishment.
This establishment, recognized for more than twenty years for its elegant setting, has preserved its pleasant atmosphere and

Recognized for more than twenty years for its elegant setting, this establishment has preserved its pleasant atmosphere and offers a very attentive, professional and warm service. The team is welcoming and some dishes stand out, including blue lobster and pigeon, well executed and beautifully presented. However, the overall culinary experience falls short of what a three-star restaurant expects: the overall quality of the dishes is correct without being remarkable, the prices are excessive compared to the level proposed, the desserts lack creativity and appeal, and the bread selection is disappointing. If this kitchen wants to be modern, it still needs real improvements to achieve the expected excellence in this area.

We selected this restaurant for our 40th anniversary wedding.
Suffice to say that the score of 5/5 is deserved in every respect.
During the reservation, telephone reception and then exchange by email the warmest of Madame Charline. On the day of the meal, the Benjamin Room Manager came to us with a broad smile and made us feel comfortable. The other interveners, both the butlers and the sommelier and his assistants, showed a discreet service, courteous but unobtrusive. (I really enjoyed my discussions on wine).
A perfect meal, of course, both in terms of dishes that are so tasty and cooked to perfection (white truffle, lobster, poularde in 2 courses...) and Burgundy wine that is decanted and served at the right temperature.
When we left, Benjamin took us back to the valets, no less kind, who made it their duty to send us a taxi.
The succession of Eric Fr√©chon was a challenge that Arnaud Faye took up brilliantly.
Thanks to him and thanks to Benjamin with all his team: the past 4 hours were a privileged trip out of time.
It was an experience that we all want to have at least once.
MarcelG

Know A. Faye since the Golden Horse. Were very happy for Epicure of this choice having seen the evolution of this cook. Superb meal this week with lobster and ivy with a particularly well thought-out recipe. Fineness, balance and complexity, everything we seek has this level. I hope it lasts. It is difficult to pass after the EF team in desserts, and they would benefit from being more complex in my humble opinion. A note for desserts in 2* or 3*: Where are the pies, mille-feuilles, Paris-Brest etc? A nice technical dessert is good and we want it because only in these establishments you can taste them. But there should also be a large apple pie, a large clafoutis etc... (in season of course!). It's also the great restaurant. A suggestion! Conclusion: big meal. Very good room service and good sommelier friendly and enthusiastic and not pretentious for a penny. It changes! The room is superb, lunch and evening. Very nice French table.

Impeccable service. Michele, Mateo and the entire team went out of their way to make sure we had an incredible experience. Food was 10/10, so many surprises brought to the table throughout the night. It was probably the best dining experience we‚Äôve ever had. And we‚Äôve been all over the world and not easily impressed. Not stuffy at all but everyone was dressed up. All men had jackets on. Ladies were in dresses or nice pants suit. Highly recommend- worth the price tag.
At Bristol, it feels so good, to consume if possible without moderation.

As usual the welcome of all since arrival with the indispensable valet is so pleasant and professional. We immediately feel very well and pampered.
Before dinner, stay at the bar always perfect. Then a few steps to the Epicurus. Installation in a table overlooking the Bristol garden with Christmas trees. It's beautiful.
The entrance to the Bristol is also magical. On the huge "table" where I had been able to enjoy a fabulous spring decor with its flowering onions, a very beautiful manger. And yes, you can enjoy the cr√®ches, without religious feelings.
Let's get to the delicious meal. The amuses mouth, Special mention for the oyster. The bread baked on site with special flours and a slightly chilled butter, extraordinary. Starters, mackerel like maki; ravioli with white truffle... Very good.
Dishes, rolled sole stuffed, what a good idea; scallops, perfect cooking. All this is embellished with small "middlemen". Then dessert over vanilla. A well deserved three-star. 
But dare I say it? I am more adept at 114, less sophisticated and more affordable cuisine.Question of personal taste.
Departure, and what a pleasure at the reception, the majestic feline Socrates agreed to be fondled. 
In short, an evening worthy of a Christmas fairy. See you soon.

When the great three-star chef was gone we feared for the maintenance of these three stars; now, the new chef has kept them and after our passage to the Epicury I can say that it is justified. We spent a memorable evening in this beautiful restaurant. Welcoming, Service and food were perfect. During dinner we were spoiled and surprised by a multitude of small entrees of surprising originality and taste, served by an exemplary brigade. This restaurant fits perfectly into the magnificent setting of the Bristol Hotel. Perfection in Paris!

Dinner to celebrate our 50th anniversary of marriage! What a magic! Everything was exceptional: tasty dishes , culinary explosions , exceptional Service in both professionalism and relationship , really no words to say how much we appreciated and were won over by all the attention offered on this occasion .. we have already frequented other Michelin-starred restaurants but this one is above the lot .
Bravo and thank you to the chef and his whole team!

Georgeous room, Super attentive service. Overall a wonderful experience. Over the top pricing was inline with expectation at a 3 star restaurant. The little extras before and after the meal made it feel very special and worthwhile.

This establishment have been famous for over two decades for its beauty atmosphere and outstanding quality of food 
I admit that it might be difficult to visit it under new chef and stuff but i did, the place did not change luckily the service was very good but i was not impressed from the quality of the dishes .yes it was good but far from three stars standards .from the menu we have chosen lets not speak on the exaggerate price 
Two dishes were out standing the Homard blue and the pigeon.the deserts need to be improved far from being attractive .
The luck of bread selection is noticed 
If one can describe this a modern cuisine ? Than it‚Äôs definite need improvement to qualify for three stars

Dear Mr. Yosefl,

We were delighted to welcome you among us and we are grateful that you took the time to write us this message, which always mean a lot to us and enable us to improve our relationship with you.

We are delighted to read that you enjoyed the service and we were thrilled to share your compliments with our team members, who were all very moved.

However, we are sorry to see your disappointment with the quality of our cuisine. We attach great importance to your remarks, which we have already forwarded to our team and which we are studying with great attention.

Our Chef Arnaud Faye is always open to possible areas for improvement, to better understand and adapt his art to the evolution of tastes and changes in preferences of his clients.

Your feeling is not up to this requirement and does not reflect our constant search for perfection.

We fully realize that you were looking forward to this experience and we take good note of your advice, as it is never our intention to make you feel this way, and we therefore hope that you accept our sincerest and deepest apologies for this discomfort.

Please feel free to revert to us for any of your future inquiries, we would love to have a chance to provide you with a better experience and a better memory during your next visit in Paris.

You can contact me on following email adress: benjamin.form√©@oetkerhotels.com

We stay at your full disposal for any assistance you may need and look forward to the great pleasure of exchanging with you again soon.

Best Regards, 

Benjamin Form√©

We had an unforgettable evening. 
Everything was perfect: a warm Welcoming, Service both elegant and humorous, delicate and emotional cuisine. Thank you to all the teams for this exceptional evening!

An excellent experience! The team is really attentive and very pleasant, which makes the moment even warmer. The dishes are delicious, well presented and carefully prepared. A real pleasure from start to finish. I highly recommend! Thanks to the 2/8/25 brigade for lunch

Fantastic 3-star Michelin restaurant at Le Bristol. We had the 8-course set menu, and it was one of the best meals and experiences I've ever had. It certainly isn't cheap, but the quality of the food, service, and atmosphere is unmatched.

Epicure at 112 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Honor√© is a pinnacle of French gastronomy. Under Chef Eric Frechon‚Äôs masterful hand, each dish ‚Äî from the legendary truffle-stuffed macaroni to exquisite seasonal creations ‚Äî showcases extraordinary precision and artistry. The serene, elegant setting, impeccable service, and a world-class wine list create an unforgettable dining experience. Every moment at Epicure feels like a celebration of French culinary excellence, making it a must-visit for anyone seeking the finest Paris has to offer.

Possibly the best place to experience the best of high-end French cuisine. The food is wonderful, the setting is marvelous, the service is outstanding. Not a flaw. Quite expensive, but worth it all. There is a great tasting menu, with many more bites than the noted number of courses. All of the staff are pleasant and friendly, trying to relate to the guests. Just a wonderful experience.
