very nice friendly moment thanks to impeccable service and extremely smiling + delicate, fine, fragrant, original food... elegant and simple

It had been (too) long since we had gone back to Biscotte. Years pass but Maximilien‚Äôs cooking and Pauline‚Äôs desserts remain essential. Very professional service and very kind. Spaced tables, which is rare in this type of restaurant. A real joy.

Small restaurant in the 15th district of Paris. Bib gourmand Michelin. 8 tables, small menu: 3 or 5 courses, meat, fish or vegetarian. Bright light, but also very atmospheric. Personal and friendly service. Excellent food, everything is mentioned the origin. Nice affordable wine list.
We followed the good review on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. Fantastic food (6 course menu), great service and very nice atmosphere. I can only recommend the restaurant.
Absolutely perfect, everything is excellent, from Welcoming to Service to Menu and Wine List. A real little jewel!
Fantastic food, great atmosphere and friendly staff. Nothing negative to say. We had a great night and would love to come back

Small restaurant. 
Reservation required paced so that each table enjoys the moment.
Professional welcome and endorsement.
Open kitchen that hides nothing.
A menu of the moment, two possible options in number of dishes, fish, meat, one, the other, both: it is up to you to choose.
Fine cuisine in flavors and presentation.
A considerate service.
Smart wine list.
Relevant price.
A nugget.
We had a wonderful dinner with excellent service. Our server went out of her way to ensure my partner had an excellent birthday experience.

A really warm welcome with a cosy contemporary vibe. The food was faultless. Delicious, varied and so beautifully presented. A good wine list - we thought the selection was well thought out and great value. The waitress was excellent - so friendly and helpful (especially putting up with our very mediocre French) whilst the chef was hard at work in the open kitchen. I‚Äôm lucky enough to eat regularly in restaurants but rarely feel compelled to review. Would 100% recommend and will definitely return here on my next visit to Paris. Book now. You will not regret it

This was my 3rd time here and it was as good as the two others. Quality food, quality drinks, and quality service. We really enjoyed ourselves. Forgot to take a picture of the veloute. A little background music would be nice though.
A lovely please! If you are in Paris this is a must. Very high quality of all the served products, fine dishises, a wide list of beverage and an authentic bistrot atmosphere!

We chose Biscotte based on its proximity to our accommodation, but were extremely impressed by the quality of the food in this small and stylish restaurant. The service is professional, friendly but not intrusive. We simply couldn‚Äôt remember when we had last eaten such lovely, beautifully presented food, so booked again for the following night. We couldn‚Äôt recommend more highly.
Very friendly reception. Small cozy restaurant with super tasty food and matching wines! An excellent address in Paris for a decent price.

A real treat for the palate and the eyes. Very good table to recommend.
Lots of finesse and elegance.
Very pleasant atmosphere.
A beautiful nugget.

pleasure of discovering another cuisine with seasonal products.
very friendly welcome
a real pleasure around a beautiful table, quite intimate restaurant

I keep booking a reservation online and I keep getting an email saying my reservation is canceled. What is the best way to make a reservation at this restaurant?
Is it easy to turn up and get a table here or is it better to make a reservation?

My family and I dined here on New Years Eve and had such a great time! The setting is intimate and cozy. The food was delicious (especially the beef bourguignon). The staff were amazing‚Ä¶ they were funny and attentive and really made our new years dinner feel festive. We especially enjoyed when the disco music came on around 11 and the patrons were all singing and drinking bubbly. It was exactly the right vibe for a new years meal! I was so glad I chose it and my family was thrilled. Super fun! Highly recommend when in Montemartre!

Very good foie gras and duck with cherries and beuf bourgingnon. Very professional kitchen with dishes coming out when they should. Very very friendly owner Sufian who also did happily all of the serving. Highly recommended.
This is absolutely my favourite restaurant. The wait staff are so lovely, the food is exquisite,

This is absolutely my favourite restaurant. The wait staff are so lovely, the food is exquisite, the ambiance is second to none. If you are looking for the perfect French dining experience whilst in Paris I recommend this cute little place. The escargot is delicious, the veal melts in your mouth and the profiteroles are naughty but very nice, and the French liqueur coffee is the best I‚Äôve ever tasted. So worth the visit, I know I will return again again. To the chef and staff thank you so much for such an amazing dining experience again!
Very good experience! I advise! Homemade foie gras: a delight! Crayfish salad, idem. Magret and grilled bar: like a delight! Super friendly staff!

A real Parisian brasserie at the foot of the sacred heart with a nice view of Paris. 
friendly, commercial and friendly staff. simple but effective traditional cuisine! the dishes are tasty and well served. special mention for the Burgundy sauce.

We had a lovely lunch here following a wet and windy visit to Sacre Coeur. The restaurant is just around the corner and it was a warm and delightful welcome! We had the steak, boeuf bourguignon and the duck which was all excellent. The window tables offered a stunning view over Paris. The whole experience was a real highlight and we look forward to visiting again when we return to Paris.

The b≈ìuf bourguignon) delicious, presented as in the photos ü§åüèª... well accompanied with a glass of Cote du Rhone. 10/10!
Rating: please note they do not receive Amex ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
Only happiness, we had a great time there. Hearty and quality meals with a personalized and welcoming Service.

On the butte montmartre, overlooking the roofs, small local French cuisine, snails, bourguignon ,os a moelle,tarte aux pommes.Gestione courteous and simpatica.Un good address outside the tourism of place du tertre.

Visited for dinner to end our trip, just stumbled upon it. Such a lovely way to end our trip, our favourite meal we had. Beef bourguignon and snails were both cooked to perfection as well as the duck! 
Service was also really great, lovely restaurant.

Absolutely outstanding. Sure, the view was lovely but the food and the service were outstanding. Sofien, I hope I have spelt his name correctly, made the evening extra special with his attentiveness, humour and his ultimately delicious suggestions of what to eat. This restaurant was the hit of our 6 day Paris food tour. We experienced the most incredibly delicious Beef Bourguignon. If we're ever back in Paris, you'll find us at the window table enjoying a nice glass of wine and a tasty meal.

Stumbled across this amazing little restaurant after visiting Sacre Ceour. What a fabulous find. Food was beautiful and exceptionally good value for money. Great service and staff were friendly. Would definitely recommend
Authentic French restaurant, just outside the crowds with stunning views
With our 2 children delicious food. Real French cuisine, pure and good meat. Delicious steps the red wine received.
We stopped here for wine and appetizers after visiting Sacre Couer. Service was wonderful, food was great, and would highly recommend this experience.

Great night!

Great time at the Appotre de Pigalle! The restaurant is cozy and the atmosphere is top!

literally incredible. best meal i‚Äôve ever had and wonderful service. highly recommend. atmosphere is fun yet intimate. great value

We booked my birthday meal here as we were going to the Moulin Rouge, which is only a 5 minute walk from the restaurant and we were really impressed with the previous reviews.

We had a wonderful experience; the owner is so welcoming as soon as you walk through the door and we were offered a free shot and he took the time to explain the menu to us in detail. 
The food was exceptional and we would highly recommend the salmon ceviche, duck breast, beef tataki and the mixed sharing platter. 

Champagne and red wine were excellent and reasonably priced and the free chocolate birthday dessert at the end of the evening was very much appreciated. 

Overall, a wonderful restaurant and an ideal spot for a meal before the Moulin Rouge.

Paris' 16th Arr. - Passy neighborhood is a sophisticated enclave, rich in history and cultural allure. This upscale neighborhood is home to iconic attractions like the Palais de Tokyo and the Maison de Balzac, perfect for those interested in art and literature. For a delightful stroll, the nearby Bois de Boulogne offers serene paths and the enchanting Jardin d'Acclimatation. Gourmet dining can be found around every corner, with a variety of Michelin-starred restaurants to choose from. With easy access to both the RER C and Metro Line 9, exploring the rest of the City of Light is a breeze.

A fusion of Parisian elegance and sophistication, the 8th Arr. - √âlys√©e neighborhood in Paris is a testament to the city's opulent past. Home to the illustrious Champs-√âlys√©es, the neighborhood offers a plethora of high-end shopping experiences, from iconic brands like Louis Vuitton and Chanel to the iconic Galeries Lafayette. The grand Arc de Triomphe stands majestically at one end of the avenue, a must-visit for any traveler. Dining options range from Michelin-starred restaurants to quaint cafes offering a taste of authentic French cuisine. With multiple metro stations and bus stops, the neighborhood is well-connected, making it easy for travelers to explore the rest of the city. The tranquility of Parc Monceau provides a welcome respite from the neighborhood's metropolitan buzz, making the 8th Arr. - √âlys√©e an ideal base for those seeking a blend of cultural immersion and high-end leisure.

The place has no sophistication of a star but the food speaks for itself!!! Gentle service and delicious dishes. I ordered a chicken q was juicy and soft that came accompanied by a well made mto rice x simple and delicious. My husband and daughter ordered meat dishes that were equally tasty and in very generous portions!!! Dessert also liked !!!

We found this very nice, comfortable and typically French, non-touristy place a stone's throw from Notre Dame. Good food, average prices. The gentleman who greeted us (perhaps the owner) very kind and refined manners (spoken Italian!) the girl who served us, little attention and not cute ways! Too bad, the place loses a point for its service!

The restaurant was very warm and inviting just as advertised on a cold Christmas night. It was recommended by our friends who accompanied us and did not disappoint. All four of us were there enjoying the Christmas markets, wonderful food and great service. We had a wonderful time.

We had a really great dinner: the fois gras was delicious and the grilled meat superb (I was born and raised in Tuscany: I know what I‚Äôm saying when we talk about grilling).
The staff is super nice (they kindly waited for us, even if we were more than an hour late due to airport delays) and the atmosphere lovely.
The location is stunning: only few steps from Notre Dame ü§©
Good restaurant next to Shakespeare and Company. Wonderful atmosphere, but the fireplace in June was a bit much. Excellent food, good value but indifferent service.
the duck legs were above expectations i liked so much the atmosphere was so warm feels like my grandma's house im coming again foe sure
Absolutely loved this restaurant. The food was outstanding and the staff was amazing. We ordered crepe Suzette for dessert and it was flamb√©ed to perfection.
We had a very delicious dinner in this cozy restaurant. The dishes were confit de canard and the other was rabbit, with very tasty potato sides. The artichoke entree was exceptionally good!

We always go to eat at Le Petit Ch√¢telet when we are in Paris and the food is delicious! It has great atmosphere like an old fashioned French restaurant. Our steak was delicious this evening cooked on the open fire. And my favourite dessert is always the poached pears in red wine with lavender ice cream. It is all so tasty and melts in your mouth. Also the servers are always lovely. We always recommend le Petit Ch√¢telet to friends visiting Paris. And I‚Äôm always happy when we come back and this little gem right in the middle of the touristy Quartier Latin is still there and serving top quality food. Bravo.

The restaurant is very small. The tables are glued together, which is extremely uncomfortable. We're sitting side by side with our neighbor. The person sitting against the wall is trapped. To get up, the one sitting across the street has to get up and the waiter has to pull the table so she can get out. There is no privacy and it is very easy to hear conversations from neighbours. I think it's an abuse by the restaurant and a lack of respect for the customer. It's not worth being so uncomfortable.
Friendly Mood and friendly service. Unfortunately not suitable for vegetarians. The dish the chef improvised was very basic. The rest of the food was correct.

We pass it every time we stop in Paris.
The setting and location are top, the menu is very affordable, and the slate very varied.
Great ambiance and excellent food. You can‚Äôt book online and it‚Äôs not easy to book by phone. So I took my chances and turned up when they opened.Glad I did!

I think this is the third time here. Much better than it had any right to be, considering it is dead centre in the heart of tourist Paris. Reasonably priced, delicious simple French cooking. It is small and fills up fast so get there before it opens

This restaurant is one of the reasons to go to Paris. Small, warm, convivial, great menu and wine list. There were many locals. We showed up early without a reservation and were promptly seated, although the restaurant filled up shortly. I had an excellent pate de foie gras, tender lamb brochette, and creme brulee. My wife had the steak au poivre and profiteroles for dessert. Everything was excellent, and we left feeling as if we had dined at a fine French country home. Highly recommended.

Highly recommended! Restaurant with typical Provencal cuisine, really very good! Try the ravioli du dauphin√© and also excellent stew with potatoes! Being a very popular place there is confusion, I suggest to book otherwise you risk the wait! We would stay there again

Trying to book for a party of 8 was a challenge , I ended up booking 2 tables of 4 and they put them together. We had to wait outside for about 15 mins which I think is the norm on a busy night. We then had to wait again once inside . That said it was worth the wait . Fantastic atmosphere, superb food and service was very good once we were sat at our table. I will definitely be going back here ! A wonderful night !

It was my birthday and the service turned it into a really nice evening. The atmosphere was pleasant, we had a great table for five and a wonderful evening. The tips of the service for food and drinks fit very well, for our vegetarian an extra plate was created from the kitchen.

Lovely restaurant with great staff who do what they do really well.

The food is absolutely fantastic, we ordered one main and four starters - prawns, mussels, whitebait, ravioli and cray fish and avacado

Between two of us, it was a bit too much, but we loved every mouthful and would definitely go back the next time we are in Paris

Just don't fill up on the bread before the good comes out!

I arrived for my lunch reservation and immediately was struck by the noisy, evocative atmosphere of this very crowded space. The tables were crowded, as were the walls with old posters and Parisian advertisements, all redolent with charm and authentic French culture. Unfortunately there was no lunch formula that used the regular menu, so I ordered a main and a dessert a la carte. My main was Sea bass fillet with tapenade, and let me tell you it was DELICIOUS. My best meal in Paris this trip, considerably better than the Michelin-tagged place I had tried the day before, Baca'v. The grilled fillet was garnished with (I think) diced onions, scallions and tomatoes, plus there was a green sauce and a lemon to employ. Also sharing the plate was a small spinach frittata. Truly an outstanding dish for 24 euros. For dessert I had ordered the chocolate mousse (12 euros) ‚Äì but first the friendly waitress asked whether I preferred melon or chestnut. Not knowing what I was in for, I chose chestnut, and it turned out to be a chestnut liqueur to accompany the mousse. Finally a young lad arrived with a large silver tureen filled with mousse, and a large ladle. He asked ‚Äúhow hungry are you‚Äù and started dishing out the mousse. He didn‚Äôt stop until I said ‚Äúassez!‚Äù and I was now faced with a large mountain of mousse and a small glass of chestnut liqueur. A fabulous end to a fabulous meal!
Typical Provencal, welcome and good service, delicious food! Chocolate mousse not to be missed as well as the rib. The only problem is noise nuisance...

This restaurant came highly recommended by friends who had been before. The atmosphere is amazing and food is very good. However, the menu is pretty limited. The duck and chocolate mousse are must gets!

The Marais is a winding maze of multi-faceted streets that beg to be explored. It bursts with small boutiques, historic buildings, cozy traditional restaurants, and hidden parks. Around each corner, you'll come across little gems of architecture spanning the centuries, from understated medieval towers to classical libraries and 17th century splendor. This neighborhood unites a rich mix of people of all ages, but it's best known for the gay scene mostly in the south and the Jewish community around Rue des Rosiers.

Beautiful experience in 4 steps, allowing you to discover the entire map by sharing with your partner!

Bust, much too small portions and preselected courses in the 4-course menu are declared a concept, if you reserve 2 menus you get e.g. 2 different starters, which you then have to divide by plate exchange. Some courses can't be appetizingly divided. Much is prepared and is not freshly cooked.

Heeelt amazing experience for 2 newlywed couples from Norway. Victor was the perfect waiter who really put his soul into making our experience perfect. We are set menu which consisted of 4 fantastic dishes. We will definitely come back when we celebrate our anniversary.

This was one of the most incredible food experiences of my life. These guys are doing gods work. 

Firstly I gotta say the host is absolutely incredible. And the food even better. So it‚Äôs a tasting menu. Recommend the full course (8 dishes) if you‚Äôre quite hungry. If not they have a half course too (4 dishes) that‚Äôs also a good bit of food. Everything just tasted so amazing. The beef entree I had was 35 day aged beef from the French mountains. It was I think the best I‚Äôve ever had. The second best being some A5 wagyu beef I had in Japan. I had to literally slow down and chew very slowly so that I could savor the taste. I had several moments like these. My wife had the fish, which was also absolutely beautiful incredible. The appetizer and amuse bouche were very tasty too. The chef did some stuff with watermelon in an appetizer that I didn‚Äôt think was possible. There was also this chicken appetizer with some pine nut sauce and as a South Asian I was so shocked at how much flavor this chef was able to pack into the chicken without any spices. One of the apps was also a salmon thing with very innovative application of fried seaweed and radish. Everything this chef did was mind blowing. The desert was also fantastic and used very innovative Korean and South American ingredients. Food aside, i gotta shout out the host. This dude was hands down, the best host, I‚Äôve ever had at any restaurant. What an incredible knowledgeable guy. But also so polite and such a delight to talk to. I wish this dude worked at every single restaurant i will eat at for the rest of my life. He comes and explains each dish in detail and how to best enjoy it. We also left something and he made an international call i assume (from french to us phone number) to let us know. And gave us great recs for other places to eat in Paris. I am still living in the high of the experience I had the pleasure of experiencing. 

Eating here this was the best part of our trip. 10/10 for sure coming here again next time we visit Paris.

My husband and I visited this restaurant while on our honeymoon, and it was truly an unforgettable experience. From the moment we arrived, the host/server made us feel so welcome. He was warm, kind, and patient, taking the time to explain the menu in detail, recommend a sake pairing, and describe each course beautifully as it arrived at our table.

We both chose the tasting menu, and every course was absolutely delicious‚Äîeach one somehow better than the last. The flavors, presentation, and overall balance were exceptional.

The restaurant itself is small, cozy, and tastefully decorated, which made the evening feel even more special. It‚Äôs no surprise that it‚Äôs Michelin recommended. Reservations are required, but it‚Äôs absolutely worth planning ahead.

I can‚Äôt recommend this place highly enough‚Äîan incredible dining experience that made our honeymoon in France even more memorable.

Unbelievable experience. 
We arrived as a family and we were immediately put at ease by the boss (despite a little booking concern on our part üòÅ). 
With his few notes of humor and a smile that did not leave him all evening, he took the time to explain the different formulas and the composition of the dishes. 
Let‚Äôs talk in dishes... simply Exceptional... a mixture of Franco-Asian flavors (Korean) that delighted us all. A little attention during dessert (for a birthday) delighted us again. We highly recommend this address, you can go there with your eyes closed. Mr Dimitri üòâ

The food is outstanding, both in presentation and flavour. Victor has an incredible way of making everyone feel like they are the only people in the room - explaining every dish, the composition, the layering, which share plate to try first. His wine knowledge is exemplary and the wine list extensive. Closed Monday and Tues and getting a booking in this small, intimate restaurant is not easy, but well worth it if you can!

I live here on the hill and this is one of the top three places to visit, probably #1 before Seb‚Äôon and Ose. You will get the gastronomic experience of a Michelin starred restaurant and the wine list of a 5-star palace. I cannot recommend it enough. Hard to get a table given the small size so worth booking in advance or trying your luck last minute if they have a cancellation.

My wife and I absolutely loved this gem of a restaurant. Everything in the tasting menu was creative and delicious, and the service felt like dinner at a friend's house. It's not a big menu, but everything is made with care and precision, and curated in a thoughtful way that makes it feel like a special experience. We had never had some of the ingredients before, and even the things we had tried before were imaginatively designed in unique, memorable dishes. While not cheap, the quality felt like a Michelin-starred restaurant, and therefore a value.

An extraordinary birthday dinner, worthy of a star!
Great starter to dessert! 
With a lovely team.

Thanks to the warm service provided by Victor and the inventiveness of his wife in the kitchen (but also in room), we had a great birthday party yesterday. 
The 5-course menu is a delicious gastronomic walk. 
To be tested without delay!

Charming, intimate spot with a host who embodies hospitatlity. Made us feel welcome and shared his vast wine knowledge graciously. The dinner was clever and delicious while avoiding being twee. It was the perfect way to spend our 25ht anniversary.

Frankly disappointed by this restaurant and this rating in Tripadvisor. Not consistent with photos and comments. We took the tasting menus for 89‚Ç¨ and frankly for me it is not worth them! It‚Äôs not bad but not enough sought after, not well presented and it is sorely lacking in originality. The restaurant is very small, the tables are very simple, at 89‚Ç¨ there is no tablecloth, etc...
In short very disappointed with the experience.

Celebrating Valentine‚Äôs Day in Paris I wanted to eat somewhere special but not too posh. And Signature Montmartre delivered. We had the 8 course tasting menu. Of course every dish can‚Äôt get full score with 8 courses. But all over very good, beautiful presentation and extra credit for the tuna fish. So now it‚Äôs about 4 dots. The full score is because of the owners. They fill this place with such a good wibe and the knowledge and recommendation in what to drink was top notch.

We had dinner here to celebrate a special occasion and it was a real experience. The place is small but very intimate and welcoming. 
We chose the 8-course course and it was an escalation of crazy tastes and combinations, fish, meat, vegetables and many particular ingredients and spices that together created unique and extremely tasty dishes. 
The cuisine is a fusion of French and Asian and the owner Victoire accompanied us on this culinary journey with great sympathy and professionalism also suggesting an excellent French white wine, fruity as we liked and telling us each dish.
Excellent desserts and liquors.
Congratulations!!!! ü•Çü•Ç

A lovely intimate dining experience. The cocktails are inventive and interesting. We really liked the Bolatus which is like porcini old fashion. We had the Apis 5 courses dinner. The bread is excellent. We really enjoyed the trumpet ravioli and the duck. Everything else is a little forgettable. Everyone has been incredibly nice.

While staying at Hotel Maison M√®re, I treated myself to dinner at Nectar, the onsite restaurant, and it turned out to be one of the most memorable meals of my life. Guests can choose between an √† la carte menu or a prix fixe tasting menu‚Äîpoetically described as ‚Äúfive major acts.‚Äù I chose the prix fixe, and honestly, I lost count of the courses. What I can say is that every dish was exquisite in both presentation and flavor‚Äîmoody, creative, and adventurous without ever feeling stuffy or pretentious.
The journey began with three delicate bites‚Äîa playful mix of caviar, citrus, and a jewel-like jelly on a shell‚Äîsetting the stage for what was to come. A standout was the semi-dried tomatoes in chilled lavender and shiso water, which tasted as if they had been cultivated with daily devotion. The tuna crudo with melon, marigold, and smoked tuna belly was the essence of summer, while a sun-dried tomato puff pastry simply melted in my mouth.

Then came a perfectly warm, personal loaf of bread‚Äîso thoughtful it felt like a gift I wished I could bring home to family. The brown mushroom ravioli with sage butter and summer truffle could have been my daily comfort meal forever. A dramatic presentation arrived in the form of a crab shell filled with spider crab, jelly, artichoke, kumquat, and basil‚Äîevoking the foamy bubbles of ocean waves. My main course, steamed meagre fish with peas, lava beans, candied citron, and verbena kefir, was fresh, delicate, and balanced‚Äîa dance of flavors.

The cheese plate offered four perfectly curated selections with a touch of sweetness, followed by raisin bread so comforting I found myself seeking it out at bakeries for the rest of my stay. Dessert, however, was the showstopper: a Nica Brown chocolate tart with pear, cumin, and warm peanut emulsion. Words cannot do it justice‚ÄîI found myself texting photos to my husband with pure delight. It was edible art, a masterclass in flavor. A refreshing lemon ice cream, a crisp topped with salted caramel, and a pair of petits fours‚Äîa handmade truffle and cranberry jelly‚Äîwere the perfect finale.
Cocktails deserve their own mention: inventive, playful, and just as beautifully crafted as the food. The space itself is stunning, with stylish art deco design that feels both relaxed and elevated. On Thursdays, live music adds to the atmosphere, and on quieter evenings, it‚Äôs an ideal place to linger in conversation.

Chef Aur√©lien Lasjuilliarias is not only a chef but a true artist. What makes Nectar extraordinary is how it marries high culinary creativity with a genuine sense of warmth. Dining here feels like being welcomed into the home of friends who happen to be exceptionally talented at hospitality and cuisine. I cannot wait to return.

Dear 792glorias,

Reading your words has left us truly moved ‚Äî thank you for taking the time to capture your experience with such vivid detail and generosity. üíõ
We‚Äôre honoured to know that your evening at Nectar became one of the most memorable meals of your life.

Your descriptions of the journey ‚Äî from the delicate first bites to the playful cocktails, from the bread (our little gift of comfort) to the final petits fours ‚Äî reflect exactly the spirit we wish to share: creativity, warmth, and a sense of wonder. Chef Aur√©lien Lasjuilliarias and our entire team will be deeply touched to see how their passion resonated with you.

It means so much that you felt both inspired by the artistry of the cuisine and welcomed as if among friends ‚Äî this balance is at the heart of what Nectar strives to be.

We can‚Äôt wait to welcome you back whenever your path brings you to Paris again. Until then, please accept our most heartfelt gratitude for this unforgettable review.

The Latin Quarter bursts with intellectual life, architectural splendor and ongoing merriment. The small streets are filled with classical buildings, student bars and lively eateries while the squares are dominated by historic monuments. The area is defined by the 800-year-old Sorbonne University, where Latin once prevailed, and is famous for the Pantheon which celebrates the great men and women of France. During the day students rush from classes to the library and intellectuals people watch from the terraced caf√©s. As night time falls the surrounding establishments fill up and the merriment really begins. The liveliest parts are around Rue Mouffetard, lined with cr√™peries and international street food eateries, and Place de la Contrescarpe characterised by terraced brasseries, this neighborhood provides real nourishment for the mind, belly, and soul.

San Giovanni, Rome's oldest neighborhood, is steeped in history and teems with culture and authenticity. This district, a hub for timeless Roman architecture, is home to the Basilica di San Giovanni in Laterano, a magnificent cathedral that draws the admiration of locals and tourists alike. The area's culinary scene offers an array of trattorias serving traditional Roman cuisine, along with a variety of street food options. Well-connected by the metro and bus systems, San Giovanni is a convenient base for travelers looking to explore the Eternal City. A stroll down the Via Appia Antica, a historic Roman road, offers an enchanting journey into the city's past.

The Humble Wonder of the Tuber: A Celebration of the Potato
It is hard to find an ingredient that can boast such a firm and versatile place in kitchens around the world as the potato. It is no exaggeration to say that this humble tuber is a true masterpiece of culinary nature, capable of turning into a myriad of dishes that warm the heart and delight the palate.
Its strength lies precisely in its chameleonic nature. The potato has the extraordinary ability to adapt to any cooking technique:
 * Boiled or steamed, with a pinch of salt and a drizzle of oil, it offers a simple, clean and surprisingly comforting base. It is the perfect canvas for bold toppings or a light and genuine side dish.
 * Roasted or baked, its rind becomes crisp and golden, almost caramelized, while the inside remains soft and floury. They are the ideal companions to any meat or fish, with that rustic and unmistakable taste.
 * Made into puree, it reaches the peak of creaminess, a velvety cloud that, enriched with butter or cream, is the very definition of comfort food.
 * And let's not forget the unparalleled French fries: the contrast between the crispy exterior and soft interior is a joy for the senses, a pleasure that is almost impossible to resist.
Beyond preparation, the potato brings with it an inherent satisfaction. It is nourishing, fulfilling and has that earthy, slightly sweet taste that brings us back to simple, authentic things. It is the democratic ingredient par excellence, loved by everyone and present on every table, from haute cuisine to the most homely meal.
In conclusion, the potato is not just a side dish, it is a silent protagonist who deserves all the honors. It's a complete dining experience in itself, proving that sometimes the simplest things are even the most extraordinary.
Vote: 5 stars out of 5 (For infinite versatility and guaranteed pleasure.)
Local recommended, lots of variety of food and helpful staff very fast in preparing the order, recommended for those who are open to new experiences.
Mi'Ndujo is a real celebration of the most genuine flavors of Calabria! If you are looking for high-quality street food that does not compromise on authenticity, this is the place.

I tried Mi 'ndujo during a day of shopping with friends at Aura Mall and I must say it was a pleasant discovery. We opted for a mix of classic panzerotti and some specials, and each bite was a real explosion of flavor. They were all fried to perfection, dry and stuffed with top quality ingredients. The mozzarella, in particular, spun that was a wonder! It's not your usual fast food. Service at the counter was quick and the staff very friendly and smiling, despite the crowds. Great Price quality ratio for a quick but tasty lunch, which brings a piece of Puglia to Rome. Highly recommended to all lovers of authentic Italian street food!
Every Thursday with 15 euros unlimited sandwiches and beer at 2 euros.

We had a 3‚Äëday visit to Rome, staying at Il Monastero Collection Hotel on the south side of the Roman Forum. We usually base ourselves in the Monti district, but thought we‚Äôd try something new. Our only concern was whether we‚Äôd have a good choice of nearby eateries ‚Äî thankfully, those concerns disappeared immediately, as we discovered a fantastic option right next door.

Ad Hoc is a wonderfully atmospheric restaurant set in a 16th‚Äëcentury building built onto the ancient foundations of the Circus Maximus, within the Colosseum‚ÄìPalatine archaeological park. As with all our trips to Rome, I did my homework ‚Äî and even before tasting the food, you get a real sense of being in a historic and special setting.

The dining room is beautifully ambient, softly lit, and blissfully free of excess noise, making conversation easy.

I don‚Äôt usually go for the full sequence of Italian courses these days, preferring to jump straight to pasta or a meat/fish dish, but the menu here was so tempting that I ended up having all four courses. We were welcomed with complimentary starters and a glass of ros√©, which was a thoughtful touch. My meal included lobster tail antipasti, fillet beef ravioli with white truffle as the primi, a sea bass fillet for the secondi, and ‚Äî somehow ‚Äî an excellent dessert to finish. Every dish was fine‚Äëdining quality. Truly outstanding.

The wine list is extensive in the best possible way, with options across all budgets. I can‚Äôt recall the exact sauvignon blanc we chose, but it was a lovely dry bottle at around ‚Ç¨50. There are both cheaper and far more premium choices available. The waiting staff were extremely knowledgeable and gave excellent advice on pairing wine with each course.

I can‚Äôt remember the exact total of the bill ‚Äî I believe it was around ‚Ç¨250 ‚Äî which I felt was very reasonable for a fine‚Äëdining experience in such a unique location.

We‚Äôll definitely be returning to this part of the city, and to this wonderful restaurant. Thank you.

The highlight of our holiday, the service is one of the best i ever experienced, food is very good and the wine selection is on point. One of the main reasons for going back to Rome ! Prices are very reasonable the area is on the outskirts so no crazy touristic, everything was perfect and they provided gluten free options too.

The derive we received was superb, attentive without being overbearing, knowledgeable, attention to detail, food was absolutely outstanding, really looked after us and as it was our anniversary and my wife‚Äôs birthday they also went above & beyond with a small cake. Barbara has a fantastic restaurant here and when we are next in Rome we will try thier other place. Thank you again for such a wonderful meal experience.

Ad Hoc by the Circus Maximus was the best dining surprise we had when we were in Rome celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. We should have reserved but didn‚Äôt and we‚Äôre fortunate to get a table in the outdoor seating overlooking the Circus Maximus. The restaurant staff were so welcoming and explained the menus so well. The choice of wines to accompany our meal were excellent and we enjoyed the tasters that arrived during our meal too. Highly recommend this gorgeous restaurant. Do book. And prepare for a real treat. We will come back when next in No Rome. Thank you!

Trastevere ("beyond the Tiber") is like a faded postcard, a little worn around the edges but still charming. With its wide-open piazzas, meandering streets, weathered Renaissance buildings, and overgrown personality, it's become an irresistible mecca for visitors. Trastevere is an enclave of entertainment - a rotating set of street performers entertains almost every night, and unforgettable eateries and bars pepper its piazzas and side streets. For a trip to the past, visit the southern and western flanks of Trastevere for pockets of yesteryear, less traversed areas with a residual 1960s and 70s Roman vibe.

Bufalotta, a resplendent Roman neighborhood, captures the essence of modern Italy blended seamlessly with ancient charm. From the striking architectural prowess of Porta di Roma, one of Europe's largest shopping centers, to the verdant tranquility of the Nature Reserve of Nomentum, there's always something to marvel at. A culinary journey awaits, with a plethora of restaurants serving everything from traditional Roman fare to exotic international cuisines. With easy access to public transportation and proximity to Rome's city center, Bufalotta serves as an ideal starting point to explore the Eternal City's endless wonders. The neighborhood's character, rich in history and modern amenities, makes for an unforgettable Roman holiday.

Trastevere ("beyond the Tiber") is like a faded postcard, a little worn around the edges but still charming. With its wide-open piazzas, meandering streets, weathered Renaissance buildings, and overgrown personality, it's become an irresistible mecca for visitors. Trastevere is an enclave of entertainment - a rotating set of street performers entertains almost every night, and unforgettable eateries and bars pepper its piazzas and side streets. For a trip to the past, visit the southern and western flanks of Trastevere for pockets of yesteryear, less traversed areas with a residual 1960s and 70s Roman vibe.

Centro neighborhood in Rome, with its historical allure, beckons to the culturally curious. The neighborhood is home to the iconic Pantheon, a testament to Rome's ancient grandeur, and the picturesque Piazza Navona, a lively square filled with Baroque masterpieces. The narrow cobblestone streets are lined with an array of trattorias offering traditional Roman dishes, charming gelaterias, and artisan boutiques. With easy access to multiple bus lines and the Metro, Centro makes traversing the Eternal City a breeze. A stay in Centro offers an authentic immersion into Rome's rich tapestry of history, art, and gastronomy.

Portuense, a charming neighborhood in Rome, is a time capsule of authentic Roman life. The Mercato di Porta Portese, a sprawling flea market, is a weekend staple where locals and tourists alike hunt for treasures among a dizzying array of stalls. The area is also rich with culinary delights, from the mouthwatering pastries at Pasticceria De Bellis to the rustic Roman dishes at Trattoria Perilli. The neighborhood is easily accessible, with Trastevere Station offering direct trains to Fiumicino Airport, and plenty of bus and tram lines connecting to Rome's city center. Those with a desire to explore the less-trodden path will find Portuense's quiet streets and hidden gems truly enchanting.

Frocked priests, colorful Swiss Guards, insistent souvenir shop owners, flag-waving tour guides, and pilgrims from around the world. This is the Vatican and Borgo, Rome's most recognized neighborhood which acts as Vatican City's front yard. Aside from the souvenir boutiques and a few food spots, the only business conducted here is papal. In the daytime, the tiny medieval sector bustles with holy activity, as visitors vie for elbow room, or stand in line for a visit. Once the sun sets, the neighborhood is transformed into a quiet and picturesque hamlet.

Is it a fixed menu? Do you cater for vegetarian and vegan options. My wife does not eat fish meat or eggs

We had the 'Error' set menu and it was amazing. I have several food allergies and the staff were very diligent, so all I had to do was enjoy the food. Every course we had was delicious, but special mention to the turnip tops with caviar, lamb and potatoes, lobster, duck and the autumnal citrus fruits. We requested wine pairings and the choices were excellent. The service is wonderful, all are friendly and knowledgable and prepared to spend time discussing the food and wine with you. To dine here is not just about the food (with is excellent) but also about the service and hospitality, which makes it an occasion.

I have been in this paradise, one of the most beautiful places in Rome, impeccable service and local, great dinner, many courses but tiny, I would have preferred a few less courses but portions a little 'more abundant to better savor them.

Best restaurant we went to in Rome! And with an amazing view. The restaurant is at the top of the Hassler hotel. The tasting menu was impeccable, as well as service! There were several amazing dishes! We recommend it to everyone who goes there!

I'll be synthetic. Best dinner of the year, On over 120 tables of the year 2025, the best dinner. A confirmation. Andrea Antonini Undisputed king of the capital's cuisine (with hand and internal grip). The hall, the best in Rome. Michelin continues its utopian assessment. Here you should reverse the stars with the other one emblazoned, very very disappointing. Here, at Imago, the kitchen goes to a thousand. ‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®

A crescendo of flavors and emotions in a truly suggestive location, capable of conquering from the first glance. 
The chef‚Äôs kitchen is the true beating heart of the experience: carefully studied dishes, selected ingredients and original combinations that enhance the taste without ever being excessive. Each course is a surprise, a discovery of balance and creativity that satisfies the senses.

Service completes the picture impeccably: professional, friendly and attentive staff, always present but never intrusive. The rhythm of the dinner is perfect, leaving room for conversation and full enjoyment of every moment.

After mediocre dinners at Moma and Il
convivio, Imago is a winner

At the only privately owned 5 star hotel Hassler, Imago is both traditional and modern at the same time. Even the menu is split as such - classic and creative

We had the former and most dishes are very good to excellent. The best - sea urchin spaghetti, pine forest dessert, fast pace. Not the best - lamb tartare, sea bass, beef main (too fatty). The portions are tiny, but we were full after the meal. The ice cream cart at the end was a nice surprise 

9/10

GOOD EVENING AND, I THINK, THAT THERE ARE NO WORDS TO JUDGE THE DELIGHT, THE PLEASURE OF EATING, THE QUALITY OF THE FOOD INDICATED ON THE MENU, THE FLAVORS THAT LITERALLY APPROPRIATE OUR MOUTH GIVING YOU THE PLEASURE OF TASTING IN ADDITION TO THE NEWS. I'M NOT EXAGGERATING, BUT I JUST TELL THE TRUTH. WE DO NOT FORGET THE FRIENDLY, POLITE AND VERY KIND STAFF IN GETTING COMFORTABLE. IT'S THE PURE AND SIMPLE TRUTH.

This is a most marvelous restaurant offering a wonderful view over the city but it's not the view that excels it's the food. We had the Creative Lab tasting menu which throughout all the courses provided delightful and exceptional taste sensations, with flavours and textures full of surprises and joy, all perfectly cooked and presented. A truly wonderful gourmet experience. I should also mention the staff were excellent, attentive and discreet, a rarity amongst many restaurants where the staff are constantly filling your wine glasses etc. Here the staff too seem to be enjoying the occasion. The sommelier was very knowledgeable with advice as to which wine to choose and introduced me to a sparkling Italian wine, Giulio Ferrari Riserva del Fondatore, which for my money can compete with some of the best champagne houses. All in all it was a most memorable experience which will stay with me for a long time to come. I cannot recommend Imago more highly.

Excellent. Place that would undoubtedly deserve two stars!
Friendly and knowledgeable staff
Great tasting menu ERROR

I often don't bother to write reviews but looking at the last two poor reviews, I felt impelled to do so. The view is exquisite and they could be lazy about the food but the food rivals the exceptional food. It has a Roman heart but is highly inventive cooking, with a touch of humour in execution and presentation. Truly wonderly flavours, beautifully presented. The service was excellent and the waiters - unusally - seemed to genuinely enjoy serving and love food. A totally joyful gastronomic evening. We ate at another Michelin restaurant in Rome the following evening, that was quite disappointing. Reccommended with no reservations.
Disappointing execution for a starred restaurant ‚Äî lacks the soul of Michelin quality

As someone who regularly dines at Michelin-starred establishments, I approached Im√†go with balanced expectations: not just for the cuisine, but for the full experience that a Michelin star should guarantee ‚Äî excellence in hospitality, atmosphere, and emotional resonance through food.

The result was sadly underwhelming.

While the food presentation met technical standards, the flavors lacked depth and originality. Courses were well-executed but uninspired, and left little emotional imprint ‚Äî a key element in any truly memorable dining experience.

More concerning was the service. Despite booking well in advance, we were not informed that panoramic-view seats required special request. Upon arrival, we asked politely to switch and were met with a rigid and indifferent refusal. No attempt was made to accommodate or empathize. This kind of cold service undermines what Michelin cuisine is supposed to represent ‚Äî not just precision, but warmth, care, and thoughtfulness.

In essence, Im√†go offers a beautiful setting, but relies too heavily on its view and reputation. The soul ‚Äî the human touch, the storytelling, the hospitality ‚Äî is missing.

I say this with no hostility, only with genuine disappointment. Im√†go feels like a restaurant that once earned a star, but has since settled into complacency. A Michelin star is not just a badge ‚Äî it‚Äôs a promise, and that promise was not kept.

We had high expectations when booking Im√†go, a Michelin-starred restaurant in Rome. Sadly, our experience was far from what you would expect at this level.

Despite booking well in advance, we were never informed that the "vista panoramica" seats required a special request. When we politely asked to change to those seats upon arrival, the staff refused with a surprisingly cold and dismissive attitude‚Äîno flexibility, no courtesy, no explanation.

For a restaurant of this prestige and price range, service should be impeccable. Instead, we felt like we were being processed, not welcomed. The food was decent, but not enough to make up for the poor hospitality.

Overall, very disappointing. We won‚Äôt be returning, and we wouldn‚Äôt recommend it to others either.

We had a lovely experience and enjoyed the beautiful views. We very much enjoyed the creative tasting menu and small portions. We have been to other Michelin restaurants and tried other tasting menus and agree that the size and amount of courses were excellent at Imago. The staff was attentive and courteous. We would come here again and recommend to couples that enjoy a tasting menu and lovely city views. It is a great spot at the top of the Spanish Steps.

The location and food were good, but nothing stood out as exceptional for a one-star Michelin restaurant. Unfortunately, the service left much to be desired, they came across as arrogant and inattentive. The staff made the dining experience feel rushed and uncomfortable, as if we were constantly being watched. Shockingly, my plate was cleared before I had even finished eating, which is completely unacceptable at this level of dining. While the view was beautiful and the food enjoyable, this was one of the most disappointing experiences I‚Äôve had at a Michelin-rated establishment.

Im√†go is a true gem in the culinary scene of Rome. The food is exquisite, the service is impeccable, and the views of the city are breathtaking. The menu is a perfect blend of traditional Italian flavors with a modern twist. A must-visit for anyone looking for a memorable dining experience in Rome.

Centro neighborhood in Rome, with its historical allure, beckons to the culturally curious. The neighborhood is home to the iconic Pantheon, a testament to Rome's ancient grandeur, and the picturesque Piazza Navona, a lively square filled with Baroque masterpieces. The narrow cobblestone streets are lined with an array of trattorias offering traditional Roman dishes, charming gelaterias, and artisan boutiques. With easy access to multiple bus lines and the Metro, Centro makes traversing the Eternal City a breeze. A stay in Centro offers an authentic immersion into Rome's rich tapestry of history, art, and gastronomy.

A beautiful discovery in the center (and it is not obvious). You eat well and go out in a good mood üòÑ especially Wael and his colleague are great, we joked all night and they made us feel at home. Great, we will definitely see you again!

Young and well-to-do families are the street flavor of Parioli. A new kind of Rome, this area is centuries away from the Renaissance with its pockets of 1930s palaces, tony boutiques, open-air markets and plenty of coffee shops. Parioli was built as an enclave for last century‚Äôs haute bourgeois and still represents as such in 21st century Rome. Need a break? The area has several great sporting clubs known for tennis and riding, a wonderful modern art museum, easy access to the zoo (Europe‚Äôs oldest), and is nestled around Rome‚Äôs very best parks including Villa Borghese, Villa Ada and Villa Glori.

Do not sit inside because you will feel like you are in a sarcophagus. And it‚Äôs in a dark kind of cramped alley with no view.

I had been to this place maybe 10 years ago and tonight I went back.
It retains the excellent characteristics of that time.
Great food, qualified staff, prepared and welcoming, as well as polite and kind.
Of course I will return.
I highly recommend it!

On our last visit in Rome we arrived to this hidden gem to have romantic dinner and again the experience exceeded our expectations. Located in the heart of Rome, but quiet and intimate. Inside and outside tables. Perfect personal servise, Englishspeaking staff. So tasty food, good choice for vegetarian. Good wine and coctails list. So happy it still has its class. Very recommended. Food was okay. Ambience was not great - was raining so no outside tables and the room inside was very cramped and there were gnats flying around all over. The waitress was nice.
Discreet, quiet, nice suipo and excellent food! Lasagne, risotto, sea barbecue, excellent chop
Excellent moment!!! We are looking for something simple and real, away from the tumult of tourism! With pleasure to Italy and not to break our purse!

After reading several very positive reviews about this restaurant, we went there as a family. What a disappointment...
Nothing Italian on the plate: bland cuisine, without taste or flavor. We really had the impression that this restaurant is only for foreign tourists, which was the case that night.
It is not worth a visit or a reservation.
The only good thing was the service, which was still pleasant.
Go your way.

Walking through the alleys of the center we found ourselves in front of this restaurant with outdoor tables, very cute and inviting
We sat down and ordered

Second time visiting,will not be the last. Love this small restaurant - great food,nice staff! You will not regret a visit here!
Nice and small restaurant away from tourists crowds. Both services and foods were great. Value was reasonable. We were able to enjoy meals finally away from loud and crowded tourists places.

Wonderful restaurant, sensational service and the food of the Gods... I recommend a thousand times!

We were very satisfied with the dinner tasted at the Osteria del Cavaliere. Environment, service, food, price, everything at the top.
Very good restaurant close to Piazza Re di Roma. Perfect service and very friendly staff.Very good value for money.

We stayed at Incanto Chic, a B&B in the center of Sacrofano. The owners are the same as the restaurant Il Cavaliere and we had a great time both in the structure and in the restaurant.
We appreciated the attention to customers, the welcome, the quality of food and the live music that accompanied us throughout the evening.
We took the tasting menu where we could taste the typical specialties of the place and it was all very good.
The great price, 35 ‚Ç¨ per person!
The location is central in the village and the place is in typical medieval style very nice and 'Inside there is also a very nice cave to see.
If we happen again in Sacrofano we will definitely return! Highly recommended!

I was at the Osteria del Cavaliere on a Wednesday evening in November. The room is small but for this very familiar and warm, as well as all the staff members!
We started with the appetizers, all delicious (the fried polentines with amazing cream cheese and pepper), except for the tartare but only because the truffle sauce almost completely covered the flavor of the meat.
The first all fantastic, my favorite pumpkin cream goodies. The main courses of meat are their must: the fantastic shin, but the rib of suckling pig already melted only when cut!
I will gladly come back whenever I find myself in the vicinity!

I had the pleasure of dining in this restaurant for two nights during my holiday in Rome and I was thrilled. 
The food is authentic and genuine, just like what Grandma cooked: simple flavors, but rich in tradition and care. 
The atmosphere is warm and intimate, perfect for feeling at home from the first moment. 
Price quality ratio is great, hard to find better. 
A beautiful discovery that I highly recommend and will gladly return to.

Food was excellent and well priced. Service was really good. Servers recommendation were spot on and honestly might be the best food we had so far on this trip! A must visit. We didn't have a reservation but they still accommodated us. Overall, lovely little place.
Very welcoming and wonderful staff and nice eat delicious and great value for money.... highly recommended

You need to go to this restaurant! The food was absolutely amazing and the staff and ambiance only add to this amazing experience. My husband and I ordered the pork ribs and the pesto gnocchi and we couldn‚Äôt get enough of each bite. Make sure to make a reservation in advance as tables fill up quickly. Definitely one of the best meals we‚Äôve ever had.

This is the best meal we had of the whole trip! Off the beaten path but SO worth it! Our family is of Italian descent and thought that one of best meal ever!

I had dinner yesterday at this restaurant with my father and a friend. Cosy and welcoming environment, tavern furniture that I love. Girls who serve very nice and efficient. Special dishes, well cooked, well served and tasty. I'll be back soon.

It is not easy to tame ingredients with a strong flavor, in this restaurant, they know how to do it. Matriciana a bomb, tasty meatballs with sauce demanding shoe..... honest prices, and it is not a detail. Highly recommended.

This table delighted us for this first dinner of our stay in Rome.
Impeccable service with great cordiality.
Very pleasant menu, with uncomplicated inventiveness.
Cozy atmosphere and a beautiful clientele.
Good food, it's small so it fills up quickly, I'd make a reservation. The service was nice with handwritten bill. Food was very, very good.
Very nice restaurant , the two girls in the room splendid, delicious food with dishes from Abruzzo, we were very good. Super recommended

San Giovanni, Rome's oldest neighborhood, is steeped in history and teems with culture and authenticity. This district, a hub for timeless Roman architecture, is home to the Basilica di San Giovanni in Laterano, a magnificent cathedral that draws the admiration of locals and tourists alike. The area's culinary scene offers an array of trattorias serving traditional Roman cuisine, along with a variety of street food options. Well-connected by the metro and bus systems, San Giovanni is a convenient base for travelers looking to explore the Eternal City. A stroll down the Via Appia Antica, a historic Roman road, offers an enchanting journey into the city's past.

On the side of Via Appia is this unforgettable gem. It offers a varied menu that includes dishes typical of ancient Rome. The atmosphere and service are excellent. Highly recommended

The best thing is the cozy and well heated place that makes you relax and enjoy the atmosphere.
Good polenta with sprouts and sausages and cherry pie. Excellent Shirah from Marconi winery.

Together with colleagues (a group of 28 people) we decided to spend a day in Rome. We stayed at the Vatican and then had lunch at the Hostaria Antica Roma. We were welcomed in the beautiful fireplace room, a warm and comfortable environment, in line with the whole room... The place thrilled everyone! But even more we appreciated the friendliness, helpfulness and sympathy of Paul, who, an expert and scholar of ancient Roman cuisine, brightened the lunch with anecdotes and stories about the place and the menu that offers. The lunch really great. Delicious porchetta and pecorino cheese (the latter exclusive recipe of the restaurant), excellent first courses (which were supposed to be tastings, but which were actually served in abundance) and delicious sausage and arrosticini. Perfect value for money. I will also return with friends and family. I highly recommend it.

I had heard about it and we decided to try the re-enactment of the cuisine of ancient Rome. It was a very pleasant experience both for the dishes tasted that take you back in time but also for the hospitality of Chef Paolo who tirelessly illustrated the processes for the reconstruction of this cuisine so ancient and the history of his family and this truly welcoming and magical place.
Also a reading environment with a library with historical texts and art from the classical world.
Abbiamo trascorso l'inizio del Nuovo Anno in una location incantevole, accolti dal calore del camino e coccolati da uno staff che ci ha fatto gustare i sapori di una cucina prelibata. Super
Restaurant with family atmosphere, very tasty food. Located on the old Via Appia (charming walk). Paolo and his family are very nice hosts.
We ate excellently in nice stylish place. It does not hurt the great sympathy of the owner. The dishes of ancient Rome are also original and very well cooked.
Un grazie sincero dalla nostra famiglia: siete sempre i benvenuti all‚ÄôHostaria, come a casa.
Beauty, hospitality and traditional cuisine: the perfect mix for a wonderful celebration

I chose the Hostaria to celebrate an important birthday of a member of our family. We wanted to live a unique experience, which would remain as an indelible memory... and so it was. The dazzling beauty of the view of Cecilia Metella's tomb in the welcome drink, the welcome of the rooms, the warmth of the room with the fireplace, the friendliness of the owners, the great food... we were pleased in everything and everything was perfect. Thank you! Francesca

Even if you have no intention of walking along Appian Way, this restaurant is a reason to do it. This was my second visit this year and will certainly return. The food is delicious and the cozy setting could not be more inviting. A good number of the dishes are made according to exact recipes of Ancient Rome and they knew how to eat well back then as well. This is a family run restaurant and the owner/chef takes the time needed to explain the dishes in an entertaining fashion.

Put the Sunday before Christmas, warm as if it were almost spring, a tasting of dishes inspired by ancient Rome, the real one, plus the sympathy, experience and historical-archaeological but also comic tales of Paul who is truly one of a kind! If you want to eat superbly and get passionate, this is the place for you, the word of a new loyal customer!

Fantastic restaurant, went there at night and it was all lit up like a fairyland playground. Was personally greeted by the owner who chatted with me and helped me order. Delicious food was followed by an enticing dessert, The restaurant was surrounded by park like grounds containing beautiful statuary . While there, as I was coming up the long, winding path, I felt the presence of someone right behind me, then they came up on my right side and as they were passing me, I glanced to my right and nobody was there! Right before that a black cat ran hissing, spitting and growling along my left side and passed me with a small roar of a major hiss. It was running as fast as it could and passed me right before my otherworldly visitor came up on my right. I think I felt the presence of a ghost that dark night at the Osteria! What a strange experience...

Dear Mary Ellen,
thank you very much for your wonderful and vividly written review. It truly made us smile.

The Via Appia Antica has been welcoming travelers, soldiers, poets, pilgrims‚Äîand the occasional mysterious presence‚Äîfor more than 2,000 years. So yes, it is quite possible that you were greeted by one of our very benevolent resident ghosts, who still enjoy strolling the paths at night and making sure guests feel‚Ä¶ properly welcomed.

As for the black cat, we can confirm he is very much alive, officially in charge of night patrols, and occasionally a little dramatic‚Äîespecially when surprised by unseen colleagues from the past.

We are delighted that you enjoyed the atmosphere, the food, the dessert, and the conversation. The magic you felt is part of what makes this place special: history, nature, good food, and a touch of mystery‚Äîall living peacefully together.

We hope to welcome you again soon. Who knows‚Ä¶ perhaps next time the ghosts will join you at the table‚Äîquietly and politely, of course.

Warm regards,

Paolo Magnanimi

In a beautiful villa facing the mausoleum of Cecilia Metella is located this distinguished restaurant. Excellent cuisine and convivial environment, the owner provides nice anecdotes of ancient Roman recipes and guests of the local.
La ringraziamo di cuore per le sue parole: siamo felici che la sua esperienza sia stata piacevole.

A long anticipated Anniversary Dinner disappointment. The location is quite special, the interior quite charming. My husband arranged for a little flower arrangement
for our table next to an impressive fireplace adorned with everything autumn. There was a large table of dinners, apparently a gourmet group next to us. The host showered his attention on this group and when it came to us we were pretty much ignored. Dinner was fine, nothing remarkable. I ordered dessert and it was awful. overly sweet and I couldn't eat it. No offer for something else, or an offer for coffee. The dessert was deducted from our bill but just being ignored ruined our Anniversary Celebration for me.

Dear Madam,
thank you sincerely for sharing your experience, and I am truly sorry that your anniversary dinner did not meet your expectations. Such an important occasion deserves care and attention, and it saddens me to know that it did not feel that way for you.

Allow me, with the utmost respect, to offer some clarification.

The dessert you tasted is the Cassata of Oplontis, a recipe that is more than 2,000 years old, reconstructed from archaeological and historical sources. It is an ancient Roman dessert, intentionally rich in honey, and I completely understand that its original flavor may not suit all modern palates. For this reason, as soon as I learned that you did not enjoy it, I removed it from your bill and asked whether you would prefer something else, hoping to make up for the inconvenience.

Regarding the attention in the dining room, I always try to be present for all guests without being intrusive‚Äîespecially on a private and intimate occasion such as a wedding anniversary. To make your evening more special, I had prepared our most romantic table by the fireplace, along with the flower arrangement your husband requested.

I am truly sorry that, despite these gestures, you felt overlooked in any way. It was never my intention, and it pains me that this impression affected your celebration.

I would be pleased to welcome you again and offer you an experience that reflects the care, hospitality, and warmth we strive to provide every day. It is my duty‚Äîand my genuine wish‚Äîto make things right.

With respect and sincere regret,
Paolo Magnanimi

To celebrate the confirmation of our son with family members we chose this restaurant that we already knew.
The place is obviously very nice is characteristic for the location next to the Cecilia Metella Mausoleum. 
The atmosphere is very warm and welcoming.
We ate in the Goethe Room in front of the burning fireplace. 
Paolo is very helpful and friendly, and at the same time very professional, the dad Massimo very kind. 
All our guests were very satisfied with both the menu and the place. 
We couldn't have made a better choice.
Very welcoming and particular place. Roman cuisine menu with dishes also different from the usual. The owner is a real star.
√à ‚Äôna gioia leggere che ve siete trovati bene. L‚ÄôHostaria ve aspetta a braccia aperte.

On a recent business trip to Serbia, my colleague unearthed this fantastic hidden gem of a restaurant‚Äîtucked away in a spot that feels like a total secret. The entrance might throw you off at first glance, but push through the doors and treat yourself to some incredible Mediterranean-inspired cuisine! The starters and mains were all absolutely delicious, and with a few beers each to round things out, the total came to just ¬£24 per head. If you're ever in Belgrade, don't skip this place‚Äîit's a must!
Good food, easy locar, nice service. The place with the Mediterranean menu is probably more intended for summer dining with friends, but it worked in the cold fall too.
Not delicious, not worth that money. The food is not delicious.. and there's nothing to write... I don't know how they gave the restaurant a star.. the portions are beautiful and that's it.

Really Good food and atmosphere 
The concept of order is making it easy and interactive. 
The food was delicious for respecting prices, service was really nice. 
Recommend it 100%

The Mezestoran is an outstanding restaurant located centrally in Belgrade. We had a fabulous family meal at a very reasonable price. The staff were excellent. They were warm welcoming and very helpful. The food was West first class and the Greek wine delightful. Many thanks to all the staff for offering us such a lovely evening.

We dined twice in this restaurant during our stay. It is a warm and typical local place. The starters and dishes are excellent. The ingredients are quality and the cuisine offered original and tasty. The atmosphere is friendly and relaxed. 
The value for money is quite reasonable.
We recommend

We had an amazing dinner at Mezestoron in Belgrade. From the moment we walked in, we were warmly welcomed by the host and staff, who were all incredibly kind, professional, and attentive. Our waiter was exceptional and made sure everything was perfect throughout the evening. The food was absolutely delicious ‚Äî every dish was full of flavor and beautifully presented.

Thank you for a truly wonderful evening ‚Äî we‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

Visited this cozy restaurant with nice and warm interior. Staff is very polite and friendly, helpful with dishes and the food is really tasty and homemade.
Keep doing in that way.

The food is really nice and the atmosphere is beautiful.

On the negative side, we waited too long to have the meals served and they were not served at the same time.
Additionally, the portion of the main dish, filled aubergine, was delicious but really too small for the main dish. Should be at least double the size.

House wine is nice, we can recommend it.

This is not the first time we came here, usually we enjoy nice atmosphere friendly and professional staff, and delicious food.
Lovely hidden spot. Great outdoor seating area. Perfext for summer nights. The food was good and the service was quick. If you are looking for a greek restaurant in Belgrade-check this out.

The people of the Mediterranean should fill the faces of the owners of the place and the kitchen team. The serving is terribly delayed, the dishes are undercooked, oversalted and over-dressed with vinegar. The team is slow.

This restaurant has a sophisticated causal atmosphere with the spirit of Greece. 

 The food was extraordinary; very tasty and delicious . The service was impeccable !

 I highly recommend this establishment

I wish I could give this place 4.5 stars (their average rating‚Ä¶) but I can‚Äôt so I gave them 5 stars because the food was great. The service was lacking - staff were friendly but it took a long time e to get anyone to acknowledge us or bring us a menu or come to take our order‚Ä¶ so come for the food but expect the service might not be as good as one would expect from a really good restaurant.
Everything was perfect. The staff, the atmosphere, everything was so relaxed. And the was delicious, as always. Tnank you and bravo!

The croutons in the Cretan salad were very hard, and the cucumbers were not peeled, resulting in an unpleasant taste. The shrimp pasta was also underwhelming, as both the shrimp and the sauce lacked flavor. Additionally, the squid was rubbery, making the overall meal less enjoyable.

This restaurant is exellent, perfect for couples, food is autentic mexican. Great expirience. Stuff are hospotable, food is fresh and restaurant is very clean. Nice ambient.

This Mexican restaurant is a true gem, especially when it comes to their margaritas. The vibrant and authentic flavors transport you to a fiesta with every sip. The extensive margarita menu offers something for every taste preference. The ambiance complements the experience perfectly, creating a lively and enjoyable atmosphere. A definite recommendation for margarita enthusiasts seeking an authentic and flavorful dining experience.

We decided to celebrate the New Year in this restaurant. From the first minute the impressions began to deteriorate! I had to wait outside for more than 30 minutes to get in, considering that all the tables were paid for, since outerwear was accepted for a fee. For more than an hour, there was nothing on the table except alcohol and water, not even a chair for the children to sit separately. The menu has changed dramatically, which was agreed in advance and did not correspond to reality. We constantly asked and waited for appetizers/main courses, everyone ended up hungry. It felt like we ended up getting cold leftovers from the kitchen. The impression was that the attitude towards foreigners was disdainful, and the local population was indifferent to the quality of service and food. We paid ‚Ç¨92 per person and, in my opinion, I have never seen worse service.

Paid ‚Ç¨460 for new years (5 people/ 6 tickets and here is what we got:
 ‚ÅÉ Menu completely changed last minute without any notice
 ‚ÅÉ We never got what we ordered and we got what we didn‚Äôt order. Also waited for that food for a really long time
 ‚ÅÉ We had to keep asking so many times for food, drinks, chair etc 
 ‚ÅÉ We never got sea bass and mushrooms that was pre-ordered from fast menu. Also never got dessert, which was included, but our waitress said that we need to pay extra for that
 ‚ÅÉ We got three main dishes to share for 5 of us and it was cold, it felt like we just got the leftovers from kitchen or whatever they had available.
 ‚ÅÉ Huge line outside the door
Amazing place with awesome atmosphere. Very well recommended. Food, drinks and staff are perfect. Authentic Mexican place in the city
Wont serve you if youre a foreigner (maybe just specifically americans) see picture for example of food/drink to expect

Amazing atmosphere and very nice cocktails. Our host Jowan was very polite and recommended us the best cocktails. I personally liked the Solarita a lot. The love music made our evening complete, thanks! 10/10 would recommend.

Based on the great reviews, my daughter and I walked from the city center to this restaurant (about 45 minutes). The food was pretty good - although huge portions! I was surprised the fajitas didn‚Äôt include the flour wraps, but they can be ordered separately. Service was good and it has a very nice atmosphere. 

What really detracted from the experience was trying to enjoy a dinner with my 11 year old daughter and being completely surrounded by smokers who lit up one cigarette after another. Yes, it‚Äôs allowed in Belgrade but I‚Äôll never understand why restaurants in 2023 - in ANY country- don‚Äôt have a non-smoking section so non-smokers and children aren‚Äôt forced to inhale second hand smoke when eating. Yuck. We left having barely finished our meals.

This is likely a bigger issue than this restaurant, but I will gladly take my business somewhere that can offer a more pleasant atmosphere for everyone- not just smokers.. there are a few options in Belgrade!
Amazing food, been here 5 times and cannot be happier. One of Belgrade‚Äôs best restaurants. Everyone loved the food and the service. Deserves a michelin star!

We had a family lunch , and it was perfect. They were very polite and because we had a lot of the kids who don‚Äôt like spicy food they created Mexican dishes suitable for them. We had a lot of different meals and everything was really tasty especially the prawns.

We will surely add this place on the list for our lunch/dinners.
Great food, terrible, incompetent service. Waiters were painfully slow, they served starters together with half of the main, without bringing cutlery.

We thought of it as an average restaurant until we entered and started serving, but our mindsets completely changed as the chef‚Äôs top segment signature plates came in. We wanted to photograph every detail on the plates. It was a true art. The menu was created based on the number of products. The plates in line were delightful. Enso deserves it‚Äôs Michelin recommendation, but our experience was very mixed. 

The restaurant itself is fairly small with a modern, trendy interior. We decided to order from the a la carte menu so we could try as many items as possible between the two of us and not be limited by the tasting menu. 

I will start by saying the food is absolutely fantastic. Between the two of us, we ordered a large portion of the menu and every course seemed to be better than the last, and all of them were excellent. The food quality, inventiveness and presentation are deserving of at least one Michelin star in our opinion. I would fly back to Belgrade just to eat here. 

Enso has one major issue they need to solve. Serbia still allows smoking in restaurants and we had smokers next to us and behind us. The tables are very close together so you will be affected by the smoke from other diners. The restaurant was full of smoke and the staff attempted to open the door to allow in some fresh air; only to be scolded by some diners who complained about the draft. 
They then turned up the air conditioning to try and remove some of the smoke, but it remained an issue. Enso needs to at least try to seat all the smokers together. I‚Äôm sure the food would have tested even better if it didn‚Äôt have the extra ‚ÄúMarlboro Spice‚Äù . 

The other issue we had was with the service. Our server (Jelena) was pleasant enough, but not as polished as one would expect from a restaurant at this level. She only brought one of our main entrees and never brought the other. When we were finally able to get her attention, she wanted to argue with us stating we had only ordered one main and that if we wanted a second, it would ‚Äúonly ‚Äú be an additional twenty-five minute wait. We received no apology and no attempt to correct the situation. At this point, it was late, we reeked of smoke and just wanted to remember the amazing food and not the poor service. 

Overall, the chef at Enso should be celebrated. The food is fantastic. Hopefully they can work on the ambience and service issues.

Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback. Your praise for the inventiveness and presentation means a lot to our team.

We sincerely apologize for the issues you faced with the smoke and service during your visit. We understand how important a comfortable dining atmosphere is, and we are actively working on solutions to improve this aspect for our guests. Your comments regarding the service are also noted, and we will address this with our staff to ensure better communication and attentiveness in the future.

Thank you again for your valuable insights. We hope to welcome you back soon for an even better experience.

Kind regards
Enso crew

A winner!
