This is a ‚Äúgrastronomic‚Äù address in Belgrade. Especially for sea food. The service is impeccable. A special mention for the shell-less scampi that were served raw with a delicate sauce. Absolutely exceptional. Worth the trip. The best scampi I ever tasted.

This was the third time we went to legat . We are from the Netherlands but every time we are in Serbia we just have to go to legat . It‚Äôs our favorite restaurant in this part or Europe. Great food great service really friendly staff.

We attended a wedding in Serbia and the restaurant was used both for the ceremony and the dinner.

The food was spectacular, and the ambiance exquisite.

We highly recommend the place as the service was superb and the chef created amazing combinations

Great food, excellent service. Nice atmosphere. The best staff in town.
My favourites - fish, octopus salad, foie gras
beautiful food and service, very pleasant space, you can feel at home because the service is very pleasant
beautiful food and service, very pleasant space, you can feel at home because the service is very pleasant

We booked for dinner. Service and dishes of excellent quality and above all very generous portions. We paid ‚Ç¨90 in total with two starters, a first course, a second course and two glasses of wine plus water

We found this restaurant on the Michelin list, and wanted to try it during our visit to Belgrade. We wanted to try a 7 cours experience for 5.500 dinars per pers. When we came and checked the menu, there was a complitely another menu for 8.500 dinars per pers. We were surprised and showed the waitress the home page menu. She said that it was the old one, and that we could talk with the restaurant Manager. He came with a shocking explanation that they havent the access to their home page, that tje reason was some external and internal factors (???), and that they cant do anything about it. He also said that they want us to be sutissfied, and that they will make some menu for the home page menu. I told him that we came for the experiance, which was already ruined by this surprise. He told me that I did not listened to him (??) about not having the access to their home page. I told him that it was a terrible excuse for the restaurant which is on Michellin list. We left the restaurant emediatelly. We hope that Michelin inspectors will remove this restaurant from their list, because it does not belong there.

It was a nice venue although lacking in atmosphere because it was largely empty. The tasting menu whilst nothing wrong with it was unimaginative and lacking in wow factor. The staff were pleasant and efficient. The wine pairing was good and well constructed. 
The bill was good value for a Michelin star restaurant but then I was slightly surprised it had one.

I‚Äôm fortunate to have eaten in a number of five star and Michelin restaurants around the world and whilst there was nothing wrong with our meal last night, there was nothing special about it either. The fact that the main course was roast chicken speaks volumes about the imagination and originality of the tasting menu. It was fine but nothing different or unusual.

The venue was lovely and the staff were very friendly but the fact that we only saw around 10 other diners during the whole time we were there suggests we are not alone in our view. For a Saturday night, that cannot be good news.

A great ambience, relaxing and friendly staff, and a great menu. We chose the tasting menu and were not disappointed. Whilst the dishes were both both regional and classical, Legat 1903 delivers. Well cooked food, nicely balanced and presented with an excellent wine pairing in a relaxed environment it‚Äôs definitely worth a visit. Highly recommended.

Interior is great and service is very professional. But! For the restaurant with the Michelin recommendation, food was not so good. It is on average level that you can meet in many 'ordinary' restaurants.

Overpriced for Serbia, rude parking attendant. Had eaten here before and food was good, but menu had changed, they discontinued everything on menu that was mid-range price. Everything is now extremely expensive. Due to this experience and the behavior of parking attendant we will not return. We were really surprised at his unprofessional and rude conduct.
What a restaurant . It‚Äôs fine dining at it‚Äôs best with a rich menu , nice location chic romantic business restaurant . Top Food with Top service in a Top Place . A big Applause Legat 1903

All praise, one of the best restaurants in Belgrade. Luxurious interior, quiet music, excellent service, perfect food and an excellent selection of wines. I would gladly recommend the restaurant "Legat 1903" to my friends. Thank you again for your excellent service!

I dined at Legat 1903 on a trip to Belgrade. The decor is very nice indeed and they had a singing pianist which really made the evening. A fabulous tasting menu with excellent service to go with it. Highly recommended.

A lovely place to unwind, have a cocktail or a coffee with a delicious slice of cake.

For the 7th time in Belgrade, we went to this place. We usually stay at the Moskva Hotel, so we have breakfast, always excellent to the sound of the piano. The restaurant in the evening is excellent it remains a must in Belgrade.
This year we were just passing through one day, we just wanted to have an aperitif around 5pm before returning, always nice, the setting did not move, we were even invited by the waiter to repatriate us inside because of the bad weather. So far everything is in line with the excellence of the place but when paying, for the first time, we were clearly asked "how much do you tip?" I find it rude, rude, vulgar and totally inappropriate for a place of such a high standing. Especially since we always leave something. So the Directorate please, if you read this notice, change this practice, give instructions to your staff
This place had excellent food and deserts. It is a little more expensive than a regular restaurant, but well-worth it. I would definitely eat here again.

We stayed at Hotel Moskva for 3 nights. Their buffet breakfast at this cafe was good with a variety of choices. However, dinner wasn‚Äôt that good. Yes, it was innovative and picture worthy but definitely lacking in flavor. Also, we had gone back on our last night to try their famous Schnitte cake. Not only were we disappointed with the taste, the service was appallingly disappointing! There were at least 4 waiters within our proximity and they simply ignored us. What‚Äôs with that? They are in the hospitality business and they didn‚Äôt bother to please their customers! I would never go back here.
This is a very upscale hotel with a lovely atmosphere. They have a nice area to enjoy coffee and delicious cakes and drinks. At times they have a pianist performing with lovely music.
"Tchaikovsky Hall" of Hotel Moskva - ideal space and unforgettable service

"Tchaikovsky Hall" of Hotel Moskva - ideal space and unforgettable service

After looking for a space (it took more than a month) in the wider part of the center of Belgrade where we would organize our son's wedding for about 20-30 guests, we were pleasantly surprised that the renowned Hotel Moskva has just such a space and service.

It is about the freshly restored "CHAIKOVSKY HALL WITH FIREPLACE ROOM", for guests who prefer intimate celebrations (weddings, baptisms, banquets, business events, etc.) and who require a separate space, a relaxed atmosphere similar to "home".
In contrast to the 8 spaces (renowned restaurants and hotels) we looked at, the concept provided by the "Tchaikovsky Hall" is incomparable: a separate space with "French Louis eneterier", natural ventilation and a toilet, allows complete intimacy and relaxation in the very center of Belgrade.

The food is high-quality, fresh, abundant enough, tasty and prepared according to the highest gastronomic standards (combination of local and French cuisine). Meat, fish and vegetarian menu sets without fail, so that even the biggest hedonists (and almost everyone present was that in their own way) could not find the slightest complaint. One guest, a well-known lawyer from London, summed up her impression as follows: "I have almost never seen such a symbiosis of interior, food and service".
At the same time, the "price of the service" is quite measured and acceptable, considering the overall quality of the service provided to us.

The waiters are rarely professional, decent, cultured, as if they were part of our family.

However, above all, we were surprised by the professionalism of Jovana Jovoviƒá (Sales Coordinator), who organized it all. I am almost 70 years old, I have stayed for business and privately in dozens of prestigious hotels around the world and in all renowned restaurants and hotels in Bosnia and Herzegovina, but I have not had the opportunity to meet such commitment to work and clients, decency, helpfulness and trust that radiates from Jovana Jovoviƒá.

All in all, respect for Hotel Moskva and its staff, with whom we spent time on January 29 of this year.
Fine dining, fine menu, nice location, piano live music, a fine atmosphere with good staff, I wooul like to come back

Dear P3664GRdanielm, 
Thank you for your review, we are glad to here you enjoyed our service and atmosphere. 
We are looking forward to host you again. 
Best regards, 
Hotel Moskva team

I went here with a friend during summer, and we ended up buying a late breakfast here. The food was great, and the atmosphere even greater. Even the decorations and the place itself was beautiful. The staff was very professional, and the food came rather quickly.

Dear Jecxax, 
Thank you so much for sharing your positive experience with others. We are very pleased you enjoyed our high quality dishes made by carefully chosen ingredients and convenient location. Once again thank you for your review and visiting us.
Many regards from all of us! 
Hotel Moskva Team

Went there with family and colleagues, service was extremely slow. Waiter approached us 20 minutes after we first sat. We ordered, waited 1 hour for drinks and another 30 minutes for our burgers to arrive (15e per burger), only to receive it cold. 15e for cold burger is a disgrace. I don‚Äôt blame the waiters tho, this place is horribly understaffed! Employe more people if you charge that much!
Never going there again.

Dear Safari57081952526,
Thank you for taking the time and effort to post your review.
From your feedback we realize that you did not enjoy fully your stay at our restaurant. As this is not what we strive to achieve, please accept our sincere apologies for the inconvenience we have caused you.
Rest assured that your comments have been brought to the attention of the concerned department head for necessary action to be carried out.
We hope that the misgiving experienced will not hinder you from considering visit us again as we look forward to welcoming you back to the Hotel Moskva and restauran Tchaikovsky in the nearest future, to regain your confidence in our service.
Sincerely yours,
Hotel Moskva team

This restaurant located Terazije square is at a prime location and the oldest operating hotel in city since 1906. Beautiful ambience and great food. We ordered vegan burger, risottoand grape wine. The food was great and vegetarian options were available.

I have been rather disappointed on the quality of the food. I had Beef tartare as cold starter and what was supposed to be Risotto with smoked duct breast.
I probably got food poisoning due to the beef tartare which was not served cold and fresh. 
The risotto was really not good. It was crispy - not cooked enough - and bot at all creamy! 

So disappointed

I often have my evening meal at the Hotel Moscow since the atmosphere and cuisine is unmatched in the city centre. I eat out every night, and this hotel has by far the most refined experience:

From 6 to 8pm there's a pianist playing really nice tunes and this really adds to the atmosphere. The waiters are top notch, and the wine selection is always excellent. So in this hotel they offer the best Serbian wines and they match the cuisine well. 

The kitchen has a new chef apparently, and the food is rich and tasty.

Nice place to have a glass of wine, champagne, afternoon tea....they have a big choice of cakes and sweets. 
I will say the prices for Serbia are not cheap but the location is worth it. 
The service was nice and polite. 

The service was nice and polite. 
I picked the cake made under the name of the hotel, according to the hotel
Is unique in the world.... not bad but not amazing.. must be because i‚Äôm chocoholic

We heard about the history of this hotel on a free walking tour and came back for the famous Moscow cake (and others) and coffee. It is a little more spendy then other cafes but surprisingly affordable. The quality of the coffee and cakes were great and the ambiance very special. Service was good. Lovely history/ A nice place to spend an hour.
Lovely coffe while listening piano play in background , had tastyest breakfast sandwich ever, traditional and well visited place by all generations

Great restaurant and great location. It was easy to find it since it is located in the city center. Delicious and tasty food, served by highly pleasant staff. I recommend this place to all who need a quiet and comfortable place for having lunch with your family.

It was pretty, we went family, we said tasting menu, the flavors were good, Turkish dish was perfectly suited to tasting menu, you can request your desired food again without any additional cost. The ambience is pretty friendly and they understand clean English and I think it‚Äôs a place to choose

A nice restaurant with good food, excellent service, and a warm, inviting atmosphere. 
It was a very nice stop on our walking tour around the river.
The place is very cosy and in good location The food was good with couple of tasty dishes the staff were friendly and attentive. recommended

We came to Ambar after reading countless glowing reviews, expecting a special dining experience with their ‚Äúall you can eat‚Äù menu. Unfortunately, it turned out to be one of the most disappointing meals of our trip.
The dishes arrived in a messy order, many of them were dry, poorly prepared, and simply not tasty. It felt as if the food was brought out just to tick a box, without any real care or attention.
Even after we told the waitress that we barely touched most of the dishes, no one tried to understand what went wrong or offer any kind of solution.
After seeing so many positive reviews, we expected something completely different. Sadly, it was far from it.
We won‚Äôt be coming back, and we definitely can‚Äôt recommend it.

Definitely the best place in town.
Excellent service, excellent food, and we will always be happy to return.
I would especially single out the location, with a beautiful view of the river.

Our Trafalgar group had its Farewell Dinner here on Oct 11. Beautiful setting on the river, an old warehouse refurbished into a wonderful restaurant. I had a delicious soup, lovely tomato and cucumber salad, amazing sausage and fries and then chocolate cake. Everything was great including the service and atmosphere.

Great waterfront restaurant, delicious food, great Service, important to reserve.. it was very busy.

We enjoyed different dishes... and all were very good.. partly reinterpreted like the well-known grilled peppers.. you also have the possibility to eat them at a great price through the menu (about 30 -35 euros p. P without drinks)

Poor Service,
The food worst we ate during our stay in Belgrade.
Arrogant staff
Small portions 
And not worth the money.
Had high expectations but unfortunately nothing I can recommend.
Very delicious and varied menu. We chose the unlimited menu and loved it. Somewhat expensive for Serbian standards but still absolutely top!

We arrive that the place was not at all crowded, very few presences. Let's order two seconds and a side dish.
One of the main courses, a fried chicken, arrives almost immediately. Time goes by and the rest of the food doesn't show. It is good practice for diners to eat together, I understand that it is difficult to deliver 10 courses together but there were two of us and we ordered three dishes. 
I wait more than 5 minutes, during which obviously the food was cooling, I look for the waiter but he was busy chatting in the kitchen (open kitchen, so all visible). Alche I get up and go to the register to report. He apologizes and goes to check. After several minutes the appetizer arrives and then others pass by to have the Third Party dish. Needless to say, in the meantime my chicken had totally cooled off. I report the discontent and the waiter tells me that the food comes out when it is ready. Okay, so make sure it's ready for everyone at the same time, not in stages. 
Good food, thankfully.
Let's order coffee. I have time to go to the bathroom, come back, wait, observe the staff who should make our coffee mind their business with their cellphone, and we decide to go and ask at the counter. The waiter had forgotten...I wonder what happens when the place is full. Of course I won't find out because they won't see me again.

Amazing experience. Small plates, big laughs. The food was amazing, really flavorful. A tad bit more expensive, but actually a very reasonable price for the quality. Would recommend all the way if you want a proper gastro experience of Serbian cousine.

Ambar

Weak expectations

He was a slave to our expectations. Very expensive for Serbia. Arrogant waiters. Do not specify small or big portion on the menu. Although we finished eating, it didn't even take our dirty plates from the front until we paid.

Not very busy for lunch, but had a great table outside (we were still cool). Service by Ivica was effortlessly, the (partly shared) food was fresh and very nice. Ivica's suggestion to try a local white wine: Blejk Chichateau was suprising. Good lunch had by all!
Nice food in very small portions The space outside full of insects on the ceiling

The ambiance, food, waitress , view all was excellent. Although little less options for Veggie persons but whatever they have were really good

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: Tripadvisor is not responsible for this summary or the opinions in it. For more information, please read the traveler reviews and learn more about how the site works.

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: The downside of this restaurant is that they smoke here. The main pros are great service, fast meals, live music, large portions and delicious food

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija:
Their food was excellent, but not perfect. The communications were very weak and not taken care of. The vibe is so beautifully self-sufficient. There were individual players on every floor and section. Music starts after 9 p.m. We had a Reservation for 8:00, but we thought we'd cancel until the music started. The gamers who came to our floor were friendly and entertained.
I don‚Äôt choose again because there was a non-cozy attitude.

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: Very large and a bit dark (you can hardly see the dishes). Service so fast and quick that they brought us appetizers and meat dishes all together. Already not hot we ate them almost cold. The equally cold crepe is undercooked. There are better restaurants

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: While in Belgrade it was almost compulsory to have a dinner in the Skardarlija Quarter at Dva Jelena (Two Deers, established in 1832) ‚Äì a HUGE multi level restaurant. ‚ÄòThey‚Äô say that the Serbian national salad is MEAT! We had plenty to eat, with a drink of ‚Äòrocket fuel‚Äô (Rakija) to start with. We were warned that it could be smoky ‚Äì the locals love to smoke, however we ended up down & around & down in a private dining room, (Flambe) with drinks, food & music ‚Äì and NO SMOKE. Good service, food, great music & singer.

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija:
This hostess is driving customers away and is a complete liability to the business. We traveled from Greece with a reservation made a week in advance, yet no one bothered to mention a "dress code." It‚Äôs honestly laughable; we have visited the most high-end restaurants across Europe and were always treated with respect, yet this outdated place in Belgrade had an issue with us being "well-dressed."
Even after we were seated, the hostess approached us with an incredibly aggressive and rude attitude. She showed zero respect for a member of our party recovering from surgery, staying hostile and dismissive. It‚Äôs a joke to judge guests so inconsistently when other people inside were poorly dressed. Her toxic behavior ruins the restaurant's reputation. Save yourself the trouble and go elsewhere.

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija:
The location and long-standing reputation of this restaurant are not in question. However, non-smokers should avoid it. Friendly staff and good food cannot compensate for the overwhelming cigarette smoke. I believe the experience is much more pleasant in the summer, when sitting outside in the garden.

The space is very small, and tables are simply declared as smoking or non-smoking, without any physical separation. In reality, the entire restaurant is filled with cigarette smoke.

For a non-smoker, having lunch or dinner here feels like inhaling the equivalent of a full pack of cigarettes per meal, making it impossible to enjoy the atmosphere of a traditional old Belgrade restaurant. This place is clearly suitable only for smokers.

It is especially not recommended for families or couples with children.

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: This used to be a bohemian restaurant, but now is a place of horror where several bands interfere each other, food is overpriced and at doors you have peasant girls with no manners. It's sad to see what DvaJelena became.

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija:
Very disappointing experience ‚≠ê
We arrived in two and were told that we could not sit at a table of four ‚Äúbecause it was reserved for 4 people‚Äù, even though there were many free tables. A few minutes later, however, the same table was given to a male-female couple.
We felt discriminated against and treated with little courtesy. In a self-respecting restaurant, all customers should be welcomed with equal regard, regardless of who they are or who they show up with. We were welcomed by a blonde girl who was completely unprofessional. A little respect and professionalism was enough to avoid a bad figure. The restaurant, gentlemen, is another story. Learn to hire the right people. I've been traveling for years something like this never happened anywhere in the world. A city like Belgrade cannot have this representation. SHAME ON YOU.

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija:
Not good! 
Slow service and the tasty not very good. The typical Pljeskavlca taste industrial meat. I had in anotehet place really good.

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: we arrived around 730 on a monday night, and it was already crowded, they stuck us in the far back with all the tourists at a table with absolutely no leg room whatsover. The ribs we ordered were luke warm to cold, ,, the service was terrible. Ive been to Dva jelena once before five years ago, during the day when there were no people and the service and food were good.. But this time, the food was absolutely terrible,, I paid $125 for a terrible dinner.. was a waste of money

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: Great location, great value, great food, great portions genuine and local. Really recommend this gem in Belgrade

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: Huge place with several levels; we were taken to a dark lower level. The food is traditional Serbian fare, with lots of meat. We had chicken, kebabs, burgers, potatoes, and cake. All too much!

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: As tourists we took a walk down the street and accidentally went into this restaurant, turned to the waiter asking for a table for 4 people she pointed to a certain table, we started to settle down, (I notice we don't know Serbian - communication in English) , another completely waiter comes up to us and asks us if we were spared the table, we said "no" as soon as we came in and he told us in reply that we can't sit at this table, but we tell him that it's our vessels directed by the waiters (he abruptly stopped speaking in English) and passed by that waiter and we spared him and he said that he directed us to this table, we sat down and opened the menu but the menu unfortunately in Serbian and it's hard for us, we decided to check if they had a menu in English, one of several old people (waiters) passed by we respectfully called him to ask a question to which he waved off and looked rudely at us, we said we only wanted to ask a question to which he rudely answered wait for his waiter and then we were carried, I was in many restaurants in Serbia but this one is not worth it!! Within 5 minutes I felt owed someone a favor to wait and beg....sorry ...but this isn't a restaurant this is a diner!!!!

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: We went as a family of four looking forward to a nice dinner based on reviews from previous visitors and from pictures from the website. Two family members ordered steaks which was highly recommended by the waiter. Another order chicken filet and lastly one ordered ox check with mashed potatoes. On the side we ordered two different salads and grilled vegetables. We waited for a while and seeing the food we realised why: the meat were grilled to more than well done. Like seriously well done! The steaks were completely grey, dry, and nearly impossibly to chew. The chicken filet was equally uneatable as it heavily overcooked and dry like cardboard! Salads looked like they had been chopped yesterday including a quarter of a lemon that was totally dried up on the outside. The potato was close to cold. All in all a really disappointing experience. On the plus side the waiter was very polite. We left 2/3 of our dishes and he apologised on behalf of the kitchen and came with cakes to share. We will NOT recommend the restaurant. At least not dishes with meat. If you decide to try it anyway - then make sure to be very specific about how you want your meat prepared.

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija:
Great choice 
In the center of Belgrade, in a characteristic area, a stop for a great typical lunch. 
Clean room, friendly and caring staff, generous portions and very good quality

We went to ƒÜiribu ƒÜiriba for lunch on my last day of this visit to Serbia. In fact we had intended to go to a different restaurant but found that it was closed on Mondays. ƒÜiribu ƒÜiriba was a lucky discovery! It is a fine restaurant in the centre of Zemun, in a splendid old building with old pictures of the town and artefacts to match. There was a very pleasant atmosphere about the place.

The menu offers a much eider range of traditional Serbian dishes than many other restaurants. As soon as we arrived we were offered a spoonful of slatko, a Serbian tradition that I have experienced in private homes before but not in a restaurant. For my main course I had sarma, meat wrapped in pickled cabbage leaves, which was delicious. We didn't have time for a dessert and didn't want rakija, wine or beer as we had some other things to do before my flight back to the UK later in the afternoon. However, we will certainly return for a fuller meal on my next visit which I hope will be next spring.

The waiter was very pleasant and helpful, and willing to engage with my limited knowledge of the Serbian language which I really appreciated. By the way, the curious name of the restaurant means something like "abracadabra". It was a truly magical experience!

Typical and picturesque restaurant at the same time. Very Good Welcoming. The restaurant room and its covered terrace charmed us. 
We feasted and at a more than reasonable price. The slatk spoon at the beginning of the meal as tradition and the very well dressed and charming waiters. 
Too bad we got mixed up with the smokers...
A really interesting restaurant with a super interesting menu, lots of local choices. I had a Serbian wine which was great and a stuffed chicken, the portion was certainly plentiful!

uring my visit to Belgrade, I had the pleasure of dining at Madera, one of the city‚Äôs most renowned restaurants. Located in the heart of the capital, near Ta≈°majdan Park, Madera offers a perfect blend of elegance, history, and exceptional cuisine.

Hello, is the price written next to the 7-course menu in your current menu the Serbian dinar price?
The environment is beautiful but is definitely not value for money place. I asked for the vegetarian 5 meal course and I was very disappointed. Out of the 5 plates in noted only the two.
A restaurant where every moment feels like a feast ‚Äî absolutely the best in its field!

I got proposed to here! Everything was unbelievably beautiful, thank you so, so much. The ambiance and the food were amazing! The staff's hospitality and warmth were beyond perfect! They had even closed the restaurant just for us. We had a tasting experience in our own language with the help of AI to better understand the dishes, which was such a thoughtful touch. Such sn amazing experience- elegant setting in a stunning building with beautiful background music playing. Service was outstanding- all the waiting staff highly professional & special praise for tye somelier too who was spot on with his recommendations 

The tasting menu was high quality. Interesting dishes that were a creative spark to traditional serbian cuisine - all really tasty & enjoyable.

Its expensive. But its not just a dinner, its an evening experience much like going to the theatre. Highly recommend this & it is worth paying the money for. Enjoy

My experience at Salon 1905 in Belgrade was disappointing. The service was slow, and the staff seemed unprofessional. The atmosphere didn‚Äôt live up to expectations, and overall, it was not worth the visit. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it. 1 star.

This is a unique place, and that is something we must always take into account. Since that way we can better understand the experience itself. What is the uniqueness of this place?, is to try to sell an elegance and exclusive treatment and from another period, although I do not think it will succeed. 

We will find different closed menu options, in our case it was a seven course menu with wine for 210‚Ç¨ per head. In the reservation you are told a small "dress code" that later seen is not fulfilled, and this would be the first hit, if you ask something enforce it, if not directly obvious the request. 

The salon is simply spectacular, the service very correct perhaps for my taste somewhat invasive, and within it The sommelier is perhaps his loosest point in this field, not so much for his knowledge, which I am sure are ample if not for the forms, slightly patronizing. 

The food being so wide menu becomes paused and elongated , without saturating the elaborations are well executed , with some that stand out over the others. But you will not find anything memorable, or that will make you come back when you return to Belgrade, once lived the experience has no hook to return to it. 

Whether you are thinking about coming or not, I recommend going is going to be a unique experience at a high but affordable cost. But I'm telling you there's nothing beyond that to make you come back or remember the visit. 

It takes the four stars although perhaps it is closer to three....

Fantastic feeling, we felt very special. Our children got an additional dessert with "children-friendly" mochito from the main chef. The stuff was very pleasant and well educated about all meals and wines. We got cards about every dish that we got served. The enviroment was beutiful and inspiring as well, but the best was the main chef's creativity. The food was delicious!

Very weird experience. Business dinner with customer, 6 people, we chose a course of 5 dishes + wine paring. Started at 6pm after intense working day and no food. Even with a compliment from the house - a tiny kebab, we stayed hungry. Portions over tiny, mixed tastes and colours and unclear choice of sequence. At the same time, too much cheap local wine (Aleksandrovic, Radovanovic, Kisch - easy find at any supermarket) - mixed sparkling, white and red and Bermet at the end. Bottom line - yes, fine dining, but they overdid it, too little food vs too much suspicious wine = stomach problems for most guests and terrible headache for alcohol. The bill was over 1000 EUR. We ended up at a hotel restaurant to fill ourselves in. 
One more thing - the place is tiny in fact, if most tables are occupied with guests, it is hard to imagine what it would feel like in terms of talking, and listening to each other.

Spectacular ambience, well-trained and attentive staff, interesting and artsy culinary, fine dining experience at a most reasonable price (compared to other establishments in Europe and the US). If there‚Äôs something to point out would be the attire of the sommelier (I believe it would be best to put on a more appropriate suit so as to be in harmony with the general atmosphere of the surroundings).

We had the 5 course menu:
- portions too small, we were still hungry after the 5 courses
- Almost nothing crunchy or hot, in all the dishes we find emulsions and espuma..
- 70 euros more for the food and wine assortment, the sommelier does not provide any explanation on the wines. Besides, the glasses are only half full, even though we pay full price
- The waiters speak quickly like robots, we don't understand the explanations

Way too expensive, tasteless, portions too small

My partner and I are living on a vegan diet but didn't wan't to miss the opportunity to dine at this beautiful location. 
Within minutes after sending the restaurant a request per mail, I received a reply that they are happy to create a vegan menu for us!

The location was beautiful and the service outstanding! There was a 3 man live band playing great jazz and setting the right vibe.
We got offered a 3 or a 5 course vegan menu.
After a beautiful dinner the chef came to check on us and we had a nice little chat about his teams effort to create a outstanding vegan menu.

This was the best part of out weekend visit of Belgrade! Highly recommended!

We visited this restaurant with a couple of friends and we are all fully satisfied. The place is very nice and elegant, the food is fantastic and the staff are deeply professional. Our seven course menu lasted for three hours and all dishes were carefully presented also on a card which accompanied each course. It is definitely worth the visit. We all had a really good experience here.

A very beautiful building with a spectacular staircase that takes you into an impressive room, a little baroque but quite majestic
The dishes are delicate and good. Excellent carpaccio, fantastic parmesan risotto and very good veal fillet. Some Serbian wines are up to standard, notably whites and roses
Small downside with a rigid waiter who thinks he is a schoolmaster and takes the guests for kids.

Overall very dissapointing. 

Firstly inside felt cold and the atmosphere was more like a funeral rather than a restaurant. The energy from front of house was pretentious.

The food was abysmal as well as the presentation. Meat overcooked and everything tasted bland.

Dear Mark,

Thank you for your review and the effort you put into pointing out our possible shortcomings to us. However, I must say that your assessments are either vague or uncertain.

Regarding the building exterior you mentioned, it is almost 120 years old, dating back to a time when the edifice had a profoundly different purpose. Since then, it has become a significant cultural monument, well before we established our business inside it. In other words, we had nothing to do with its design or historical significance.

As for the atmosphere, our guests usually find it relaxing and welcoming. Perhaps you are simply not accustomed to a more solemn and toned-down mood, similar to that of a funeral.

When you complain about the food, we would greatly appreciate it if you could provide more details about the issue. Knowing which dish or course you had a problem with would enable us to pay closer attention and avoid similar mistakes in the future.

With all due respect, your review, regarding both the food and the atmosphere, comes across as generic, hasty, and arbitrary. If you could be more specific with your feedback, we might all find more value in it.

Kind regards,

Salon 1905
My first real gourmet experience in Serbia. Top location, stylishly furnished, attentive staff, wine accompaniment perfectly matched to the food. You have to try it at least once.

I should not have given this restaurant another chance. 

After my first disappointment in 2021 I decided to give 1905 another chance. Any restaurant can have a bad day, and I normally trust Michelin rating/mentions. This years visit started like last visit, the beautiful restaurant is inviting and creates expectations. But like last year the positive experience stopped there. Regular service that you don‚Äôt expect on a restaurant at this price range in combination with pretentiously presented but badly executed food. This restaurant is for show off but not for foodies/gourmands. Belgrade has many good restaurants - but this one isn‚Äôt.

Be prepared for some service disappointments so that they do not spoil the enjoyment of food

If you‚Äôre in Belgrade and craving a polished fine‚Äëdining experience with a quietly confident kitchen, Langouste‚Äôs 8‚Äëcourse tasting menu delivers a thoughtful arc of flavors, precise technique, and genuinely warm service. Expect elegant plating, clean flavors, and a few playful nods to regional ingredients‚Äîcapped by a standout roasted duck and a whimsical ‚ÄúSave the Bees‚Äù dessert. My favorite foie gras course was silky, cool, and impeccably seasoned‚Äîpaired with toasted brioche and a gently sweet fruit element (think quince or fig). The balance between richness, sweetness, and a touch of acidity is spot‚Äëon. 
My second best was roasted duck which was 24 hours cooked - if i remeber well. The skin is glass‚Äëcrisp with a lacquered sheen; the meat remains undeniably rosy and tender. Accents lean savory‚Äëfruity.

Wonderful dinner, the tasting menu shows the whole palette of the chef‚Äôs art, in the dishes we find a subtle mix of European and Serbian cuisine with a Japanese touch. The Serbian wines offered with the food and wine pairing are a great discovery, especially the whites and this muscat ros√© for dessert.  A thank you to our waiter who was able to bring the extra touch to enhance this meal.

A beautiful setting with food that I ran out of superlatives to describe half way through. My amazing waiter made the experience even more unforgettable. Cannot recommend highly enough. Highest praises to everyone involved. Just stunning

It is amazing that Belgrade and Serbia now have their first star restaurant. But it actually holds a goal. Had an eight-day menu that was simply hard to remember when one had eaten it. Most of it was good but not more than that, it lacked the Wow factor simply. The meal composite was in quantity large enough for most. There was emphasis on some local raw materials and that was good. But one can question the fact that serving a 15 days old diadem is sustainable. The locks are fine, the service pleasant and attentive. But price and quality are in my head not star quality. Compared to restuaranties with one star in Norway, a country with much higher costs than in Serbia, the price level is not very different. It may differ 30-40 euros on a menu. The number of bits, servings in Norway is also much higher and the quality and creativity correspond. For its own sake it was worth the money and the visit alone to be at the first star restaurant in Serbia. But the experience was well like buying and trying one of the world‚Äôs most expensive cheeses made of donkey milk and produced in Serbia. So the recommendation must be that you rather go to one of the many other excellent restaurants in Belgrade where you get more value for money. That being said, I wish Langouste luck with the further development of the restaurant and hope there will be more restaurants in Belgrade coming after. One must be the first and it was Langouste who won that award.

We had the chance to dine in this restaurant a few weeks after getting their 1st*Michelin. We were a great table of 6 people and we all dined "√† la carte". Meals excellent classic cuisine but extremely well executed. Perfect service and excellent wine list. The star is well deserved and the team will not stop there. The only cultural remark the room is smoking and I must say that it is very embarrassing for a meal of such quality.

It gives me no pleasure to rate it just 2 stars, because the food is actually quite good, but certain faux pas are just inexcusable for even a regular upscale restaurant, let alone a Michelin-starred one. I hope the mgmt. corrects these mistakes. First, they do not have any bubbly by the glass and push customers towards a demi-bottle for $55. They do have kir royale on the menu, but we were informed that "it was not available", and neither was any cocktail with champagne, prosecco, or any other bubbly! It was only after my strenuous objection and plain explanation that they could simply open a bottle and make the drink that they relented. The second foul was the fact that they only allow prix fixe (fine), the cheapest is just over 100eur (fine), but the bill added measly 500din (<$5) cover charge pp! How ridiculous! Guys, this is for cheap restaurants, so that people do not order a plate of french fries and sit there for 2 hrs, not when you already get 25x that much! If you must, charge 500din more for the prix fixe! Finally, they do not allow BYOB even with a corkage fee, which I also find in bad taste. The explanation was even worse: "the previous chef was entertaining his buddies and they would bring tons of wine and drink for free, hence the new policy..." Guys, charge even 50-100eur corkage fee, one bottle max pp, no wines from your own list, but allow customers who might celebrate a special moment to bring their special bottle that they have been saving for years for such an occasion!

Great view overlooking the Sava River. Definitely a special occasion place, with visitors dressed up and probably on dates. Michelin recommended (not starred). Fish and seafood focused. Option for tasting menu or a la carte. Expensive for Serbia but a good deal relative to comparable places elsewhere in Europe. They allow indoor smoking, but have a designated nonsmoking section and thankfully, no one was smoking the night we went.
Impeccable service, but on other hand rather empty. Perfect for formal meetings. Was seated near window so had opportunity to enjoy the perfect view of Danub and Sava river

We ate 2 times in Langouste during our week-long stay in Belgrade. At first, we came just with my wife and we ordered lobster menu. The lobster was prepared in 2 ways: with pasta and grilled with a bit of sauce and vegetables and we really enjoyed it. Introduction to the meal were 3 small and very interesting appetizers. Combined with uninterrupted views of Sava River, it was absolutely 5-stars, if I was making a review just based on the visit. But in 2 days we came back being 4 people already. We chose fish menu (which to my uneducated eye should be easier to perfect compared to lobster one), the restaurant agreed to adapt it a bit to our tastes and food preferences (my wife doesn‚Äôt eat dishes from raw fish) and we definitely appreciated the flexibility. But for the main course we got John Dory ‚Äì tasteless, hard and a bit over-burned. Again, to be fair, the restaurant charged us for 2 John Dory only ‚Äì this is again appreciated, but I would have preferred to pay for all 4 dishes subject to everyone enjoying them. All in all, not a bad place, if you are up to Michelin restaurant style and prices. But afterwards we found a much better fish restaurant in Belgrade.

As a passionate visitor to the beautiful city of Belgrade, I have had Langouste on my "to go" list for a long time.

Now I have finally found my way there. Beautiful location with a wonderful view of the Sava River. The atmosphere in the restaurant is pleasant, but still has some potential. Sometimes it gives a somewhat sterile or empty impression.

I received four different amuse bouches, from a cornet with shiitake mushrooms to a puff pastry filled with Serbian cream cheese to a mushroom ragout to a brioche with truffle butter. The best brioche I have ever eaten. Excellent. And I was almost no longer hungry afterwards. :-)

For the starter there was fish carpaccio with thinly sliced beetroot, chestnuts, horseradish foam and an orange sauce. Very tasty and recommended.

For the main course I chose the beef fillet, which was also good. I have very high standards when it comes to meat, so unfortunately it doesn't come close to an excellent rating. The sauce and especially the side dish, a kind of creamy wheat peppered with fried duck liver, were top class.

All in all, a very tasty dinner with a wonderful view and excellent and friendly service.

Fantastic restaurant! A unique experience if you like culinary indulgence. A three-star chef originally from Paris, who came to Belgrade. Beautiful decor, wonderful views over the Danube and delicious, refined, tasty dishes matched with sublime matched local wines.

Our first time in Belgrade with my friend and we were recommended to visit Langouste restaurant, I have to say this place deserves all Michelin stars and our server name was Marco, he went above and beyond to make our first dinner in Belgrade so memorable! We were given the best table with a view and Marco surprised us with a few complimentary dishes and an amazing desert! Atmosphere is very private and super attentive staff. Marco made sure we had the best time and explained every dish so well, one of the most tasteful dishes we had was Rooster cooked in red wine sauce, fish carpaccio and lemon tart desert all recommended by Marco. Thanks for such an amazing evening we will remember this place and come back on our next visit to Belgrade.

Best restaurant we have been to in Serbia. Quality tasting menu with wine flight. Waiter provided excellent service and was culturally interesting to talk to. Based on UK prices fantastic value as well.
Top view and good service. The food preparation was great but the taste for a star restaurant was not meeting our expectations.

Excellent experience in Langouste Restaurant. High level in the cuisine was matched by excellent service. The selection of local products, the innovative cuisine and the and the relaxed atmosphere contributed to a memorable and enjoyable lunch. I inhibited a chef who works in a one star Michelin in France and he was impressed. Congrats to the team and to the Chef.

Great food it's the basic of a restaurant, but if staff is not polite, well prepared and without the basic manners, there is no way that I will go back......

The service, the food, the paella, the cheese cake everything was perfect I recommend, it is a wonder.

Broad, tree-lined avenues with pretty streetlights frame the neighborhood of Barrio Salamanca. With beautiful condominium buildings that make up most blocks in this area, this part of town is refined and quiet. It is also host to a few of the city's large shopping avenues, including Calle Serrano and Calle Jose Ortega y Gasset. A walk down these streets will reveal upscale chains, small boutiques, and plenty of opportunities for shopping or checking out the stylish displays. The locals here are polished and fashionable, the atmosphere is leisurely, and the lush Retiro Park on the southern border is yet another opportunity to enjoy the outdoors. A stroll through Barrio Salamanca is all about admiring the beautiful architecture, window-shopping, and people-watching in this upper-crust corner of Madrid.

With beautiful condominium buildings that make up most blocks in this area, this part of town is refined and quiet. It is also host to a few of the city's large shopping avenues, including Calle Serrano and Calle Jose Ortega y Gasset. A walk down these streets will reveal upscale chains, small boutiques, and plenty of opportunities for shopping or checking out the stylish displays. The locals here are polished and fashionable, the atmosphere is leisurely, and the lush Retiro Park on the southern border is yet another opportunity to enjoy the outdoors. Expansive plazas, local and foreign crowds, street performers, colorful lights, window shopping, restaurant signs promising the best paella, ham, and churros con chocolate- this is downtown Madrid, a collection of plazas interconnected by a network of side streets. Some of these side streets are wide pedestrian shopping routes, and some are hidden, so it's possible to duck in and out of the bustle as desired. The iconic Puerta del Sol is the giant crossroads of the city and a must-see attraction at any time of the day. The nearby Plaza Mayor, completely enclosed by historic red buildings, is an ideal place to grab a bite to eat outside, amidst scores of tables and people out for a stroll. Plaza Isabel II (also known as ‚ÄúOpera‚Äù) is smaller and a good meeting spot, and the stately Plaza del Oriente is the front yard of the Royal Palace. Centro can be touristy (pickpockets are unfortuately not unheard-of here), crowded, and sometimes gimmicky, but it is also the place to experience classic Madrid.

Restoran: La Taberna De Pe√±alver Cava Baja
Recenzija:
The restaurant should be called Galactic!! The exceptional seafood paella, the living room downstairs is very romantic. Great wine, good price.
Highly recommended in the area of Cava Baja , Barrio La Latina Madrid.

Restoran: La Taberna De Pe√±alver Cava Baja
Recenzija: Great, we have eaten fabulous grilled octopus the veiras and that sea bass and for those who like Austrian holiday loin meat, dessert Great and the attention of the waiters very well, especially Macarena Great, their attention Great

Restoran: La Taberna De Pe√±alver Cava Baja
Recenzija: There's not too much to write about: one of the best paellas ever eaten! We are passing through Madrid and near our accommodation we found this restaurant, a wonderful discovery, we waited for the paella with ham and bread very good... Highly recommended

Restoran: La Taberna De Pe√±alver Cava Baja
Recenzija:
We chose to eat lobster rice and a helping of chistorra to start with.
It was good, the food was good, the service was good, reasonable price

Restoran: La Taberna De Pe√±alver Cava Baja
Recenzija:
Unfortunately, my experience at this restaurant was disappointing. While the food itself was acceptable, the service was poorly organized.

Our dishes arrived separately, and the timing made no sense‚Äîmy main course was served before the starter, which arrived much later. This completely disrupted the meal and took away from the dining experience.

Dining out should feel relaxed and enjoyable, not confusing and rushed. For the prices charged, I expected much better coordination from the kitchen and service staff.

Sadly, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place based on this experience.

Restoran: La Taberna De Pe√±alver Cava Baja
Recenzija:
We stayed here for dinner by reservation, really nice restaurant and in a nice and quiet area. 
We had a really good and plentiful mixed paella, although the pieces of meat had lost a bit of flavor apart from that nothing to say, the price was right.
Croquettes (given the long wait for paella that we had been warned about) and really good vegetables but with an exaggerated price, 16 ‚Ç¨ for 4 croquettes is excessive, they cost twice as much as the average of restaurants of their same level, the same goes for grilled vegetables that cost 16 ‚Ç¨.
The staff was really friendly and helpful and also the service is very well taken care of, it deserves 5 out of 5 but for fairness I put 4 for the quality / price ratio that should be improved on certain courses, since competitors are there and have much fairer prices on certain dishes, the exception is the paella which had a more than reasonable price.

Restoran: La Taberna De Pe√±alver Cava Baja
Recenzija: We ordered the paella, but did not realize you have to order for 2 person. The waiter did not say anything to us, but instead tried to upsell more food. When we realized the paella was for 2 person, a couple minutes later, we tried to change the order, but the waiter would not let us change the order. The paella came and it was terrible.. the taste was blah and the seafood was stale and not fresh. The octopus was good though.

Restoran: La Taberna De Pe√±alver Cava Baja
Recenzija:
We found this restaurant through TripAdvisor.
The restaurant's standards were not met at all.
Upon entering, the music was very loud, and the staff did not appear very cheerful.
The service was provided by only young individuals, and while there is no issue with that, it seemed there was no experienced figure to organize the service.
In my opinion, the food was very average.
I definitely would not recommend this place to anyone.
Even the interior decoration appeared poorly maintained.
I suggest considering other options as you can find much better in Madrid.
This establishment is completely overrated.

Restoran: La Taberna De Pe√±alver Cava Baja
Recenzija: The place isn't worth its money, paelle regular, the price is on the menu for 1, but you can't order a portion like that, for at least two. 55‚Ç¨ is expensive for a dish like this. No sangria, don't order unless you want to be disappointed. They barely understand English. Anyway, no more than yes.

Restoran: La Taberna De Pe√±alver Cava Baja
Recenzija:
Delicious paella. And sweet, attentive service from a lady (Yadira).
It is located in a cozy neighborhood, just outside the worst crowds. Beautiful decor vh restaurant - white linen and warm colors vh interior.

Restoran: La Taberna De Pe√±alver Cava Baja
Recenzija:
Small room with outdoor veranda , very kind and professional the Honduran girl who serves our table.
A thousand and one nights fish paella

Restoran: La Taberna De Pe√±alver Cava Baja
Recenzija: A spectacular experience, all very delicious, in case you have a cut with the bottle of water helen cures you, very good home remedies

Restoran: La Taberna De Pe√±alver Cava Baja
Recenzija: My wife and I were in Madrid and visited this restaurant. We received excellent service from Carlos, a very friendly young man who knew very well the dishes, and wines they offer. The starter was a dish called blizzard peppers, exquisite. Then a Paella Se√±orat, very rich and abundant. The atmosphere, from a prime restaurant. Anyway, I can say it was the best dinner of our trip.

Restoran: La Taberna De Pe√±alver Cava Baja
Recenzija:
Very nice place in the Latina district, excellent food and above all very good paella. They have about fifteen different types, we chose the seafood one, tasty and abundant, one of the best ever tasted.
The potato tortilla is also good, perhaps a little too drooling for our taste.
Fair wine list, good prices.
We spent about 55‚Ç¨ per person, correct price.

Restoran: La Taberna De Pe√±alver Cava Baja
Recenzija:
Nice place. Fast service. The only drawback they push to make you take more courses and not just paella saying it takes a long time. 
We had a tortilla that was good but in the end it overfilled us and we left a bit of both. 
If you are not a big eater I recommend ordering only paella.

Plaza de las Cortes, 7 The Palace, A Luxury Collection Hotel, Madrid, 28014 Madrid Spain
The lovely place, but the service improveable, the service is sometimes slow is why 4 stars, everything else great

The elaborate La Rotonda is under reconstruction. The restaurant is operating in a very fine setting in the room next door. The menu is unchanged from the grand facility. The service and food were excellent. The wine list did not show the vintage of the bottles offered. This shows the establishment is not serious about wine as did the small number of selections offered. With this caveat, dinner was fine in all respects.

The Palace Hotel has a filter: Miss Giulia.

We ordered two glasses of the budget champagne. She served us, with that superior smile, the most expensive glasses on the menu.

Your message, clear and loud: "They either have status, or they don't come back here."

It was not a mistake, it was a class certification of economic status. Excellent Service for those seeking exclusivity by exclusion.

Giulia and Palace: A deal as high as its price.

Gracias por compartir su experiencia con nosotros. Lamentamos sinceramente la percepci√≥n que se llev√≥ durante su visita. En The Palace Hotel, Madrid, el trato respetuoso y equitativo hacia todos nuestros hu√©spedes es un principio fundamental, por lo que queremos asegurarle que no existe ning√∫n tipo de filtro, preferencia o conducta basada en estatus econ√≥mico.

En relaci√≥n con el servicio ofrecido, revisaremos lo ocurrido con Giulia para comprender mejor la situaci√≥n y evitar cualquier confusi√≥n con las recomendaciones o sugerencias de productos. Nuestro objetivo es siempre ofrecer opciones de manera transparente, nunca imponer elecciones ni transmitir incomodidad.

Agradecemos que nos haya se√±alado este punto, pues nos ayuda a seguir mejorando. Nos gustar√≠a tener la oportunidad de recibirle nuevamente y brindarle una experiencia acorde con los est√°ndares de hospitalidad que representamos.
In the dome of the palace, excellent place, spacious and comfortable, menu "the dome" at 42 euros, to choose 3 first, second and pole , with a drink included.

Awful experience, Voluntary but ruthless Service, and an unacceptable dish that did not respond at all to what I had ordered and that smelled frighteningly rotten, as the waiters themselves recognized and that you asked to remove before returning at the same table for the stench it gave off. Expensive and worse than bad. Very sad in what has become the old and wonderful Palace roundabout. If you met her, don't come back, if you don't already know her, dispense with being crunched and given suspicious food.

We went to enjoy brunch and the experience far exceeded our expectations. From the start, the treatment was impeccable, with attentive and professional Service in a serene and elegantly designed environment. The musical accompaniment, with piano and opera duet, was simply masterful.

It is clear that, after the recent renovation, the hotel is committed to excellence and works hard to achieve the level of the best luxury establishments in the city.

Special mention is made of Pedro Fonseca, head of the Food and Beverage department, for his impeccable management, and Gustavo Garc√≠a, the hotel‚Äôs sommelier, for his kindness and deep knowledge. An outstanding experience that we will certainly repeat.

This appears to be a lovely and an attractive dining option if you are a local. Although we ordered a full meal with an expensive bottle of wine, we waited endlessly for service and continued to have to ask for wine pours and additional needs. All the while, the servers provided excellent service enjoyed lengthy conversations with the obviously local residents. We understand that they realize we are unlikely to return, but this is not treatment you expect for an upscale restaurant. The food is above average but not exceptional. Sides and salad were good. Fish was undercooked, with one portion being nearly raw. Sorry to give a poor review for any restaurant in a city we love. We may go back for drinks in the lovely bar someday, but not to dine.

Good afternoon..actually if we ate at their restaurant but the staff did not check if we had or not reservation..it was a bittersweet experience because I made the reservation with a lot of enthusiasm and high expectations and it was an absolute disappointment..the staff was polite but they absolutely passed us..we had to call them for everything and considering the prices they have I think the attention should be more careful. We thought that in a restaurant of this category at least they should put a tablecloth .. it did not look like a restaurant but a cafeteria .. I thought that was not the case but I saw that I was wrong although the price of the drink is of michelin star. I can't say anything outstanding about the food either because it was rather mediocre for what they charge..on one of the plates they put a bowl of undressed lettuce and didn't even ask if I wanted to do it...anyway a nonsense for what we pay
Madrid cuisine reinvented in a historic space of exceptional elegance and flavor. Flavors of Madrid with a modern twist under an iconic dome

Disappointing, absolutely disappointing. Waiters waste your time waiting until they attend to you without knowing that "time is gold", especially in a place like this. I do not recommend it, unless you want to waste the afternoon.üá™üá∏

NEFARIOUS experience.
We had a Reservation for 3 months in the restaurant LA ROTONDA of the WESTIN PALACE hotel with the offer of 30% "THE FORK" and the truth that our experience could not be worse...

As soon as we arrive, we say that we have a Reservation in the ROUNDABOUT to celebrate our anniversary (I indicated this at the time of Reservation) and we are passed to a dining room unworthy of a 5-star hotel like the WESTIN PALACE. We say that this is not the place where we have booked and we are told that they are in the works and that the restaurant is closed that now the dinners are there... we started badly but decided to stay to eat (we were surprised that it had only occupied a table of 5 people...)

We ordered wine, foie and steak tartare. They bring us the foie and it was a dish of very poor quality. The hard foie, very hard (you can tell they just took it out of the cold room because there were parts that were freezing). We talk to the waiter who tells us that he has "transmitted it to the kitchen so that the next time he gets heat stroke and the frozen dish does not come out". I don't know if by the dates they are and the works if the head chef was on vacation because you can't bring out a dish like that. You had to eat the foie in tacos as it was impossible to spread it over the muffins. The steak tartare very good and so we told the waiter.

The food was being cold, the dining room thawed, ugly and empty and regular food so we decided to pay and leave as it was not at all what we expected.

They bring us the account and we see that they have not applied the discount of 30% with which we made the Reservation and the waiter replies that "for some time they have not worked with the fork" to which I indicate that I have the Reservation so made, that I have 3 emails remembering said Reservation to confirm it and that at no time I have other information. At that moment the one who seems to be in charge arrives and tells us that it must be a problem of "THE FORK", that they now work with "SEVEN ROOMS" and that they cannot apply me the offer with which I booked, that I have to pay the full bill and that I claim to the fork, which is not their problem, that they thought that there were no outstanding reservations with this platform. 

Seriously, can a room manager give this answer to clients? At that time we asked for the claim sheet and that we do not agree at all with this, that the problem is yours for not having cancelled reservations. For more indignation I get into the application of the fork and check that the offer is still valid and that it can be reserved for the month of September and October with -30% which makes everything more subreal. 

After 5 minutes he brings the claim sheet and tells me to show him the Reservation Mail (it seems that he doesn't believe us...) and tells me again that he can't apply the offer and that he doesn't know what to do to discount that 30% to which my wife tells him to "take a plate and it's done even if it's less than that 30% and we get hurt" and to her it seems a magnificent solution for what we paid and we left with very bad taste in our mouths and with the certainty that we won't go again. 

If you presume to be a 5-star restaurant you have to prove it both in the food, in the place and in the service and this time none of this was so and showed us that they are not able to give solutions to the problems that have arisen. 

If you have the restaurant closed and you are going to relocate the diners in "a room" you must inform them (for that they have the customers' mail and phone), the food must leave in kitchen conditions (from a plate of 30 ‚Ç¨ is the minimum expected) and if you have reservations with conditions that you have not canceled you must meet them.

Very good if not excellent service, old school, good food with classic dishes but also more modern dishes (e.g. the wellness menu), good selection of wines although not very extensive, fascinating surroundings as always, calm atmosphere and for what they offer, a good value for money.

We stayed a week at this hotel and ate here everyday for breakfast. The restaurant itself is gorgeous! The stained glass ceiling is amazing. The service was excellent. The food, each day, was great! A wide range of items on the buffet.
Spectacular place and incredible and varied buffet. Opera is always a plus. The variety and quality of the food is impressive.

Eating in the hotel rotunda, under that wonderful glass dome, is a pleasure that can be found in few places. The food was splendid, highlighting some wonderful Iberian ham croquettes and some very delicious candied artichokes. For the main course I would highlight some really good grilled scallops with venere rice. For dessert, the cheesecake was good but nothing to write home about. The unbeatable service, very attentive and friendly.

The ham platter and chicken curry small plates were a great meal after spending the day in the rain! Alberto and Stephen were very friendly and made sure I was ordering what I wanted!
Excellent food and a charming place to sit. The squid was outstanding and the grilled vegetables prepared beautifully. Our waiter Alberto was a delight.
We went to a show and looked for a place with good recommendations. It has not disappointed us, very nice service, good food and value for money online. Recommended

We went for a dinner with the family to enjoy our last evening in Madrid. We tried local delicacies like octopus, prawns, paella and scallops. My son wanted to try homemade ravioli. Amazing food. We also tried local tempranillo red wine from Valladolid. Alberto who served us was very kind as well as he knew to respond quickly to our questions. Definitely you have to visit if you are in Madrid.

Alberto top, very nice local and with very good food at a great price. 
I recommend coming for a dinner with friends.
.
Excellent service!!!! Delicious food, I've never eaten a potato omelet so good! And let alone the paella!! I highly recommend!!
Delicious food, shrimp risotto , excellent red wine and very friendly staff üëçüèª I will come back again and try some other food‚Ä¶.

Excellent 
5 stars for food, service and kindness.
Also recommended if you want to eat and then go to the prado museum

Superb address, warm decor, service from Roger and Steven 5 stars of a great kindness and the dishes just as succulent as each other, and a top value for money, a must if you are looking for tapas in the center of Madrid
Excellent bar, very good atmosphere and especially the variety of dishes like paella, old clothes, and cake uff all very way I will repeat.

Very nice decor, excellent treatment and service. Good value for money. Better the rissoto than the paella, it was a little overcooked. Excellent salmon tartare.
Don't stop trying some dessert.

I want to keep this place to myself, but the word is already out. Easily my favorite place I ate at this weekend. The music is upbeat, and the food is solid. Paella + cheesecake = cannot go wrong. Steven was behind the bar pouring wine and limoncellos. He‚Äôs so friendly and checks in regularly to ensure you‚Äôre doing okay! I will certainly be back.
Steven was amazing, very professional and helpful. The food was really good and good prices. Definitely will be back!!
Restaurant in the neighborhood of letters with excellent food and service. Quiet atmosphere and very attentive and friendly staff. Surely recommended!
The food and ambiance were amazing! We tried the empanadas, risotto, ravioli, and lomo bajo. All were delicious! The staff were very nice.

Excellent food in a quiet unpretentious restaurant. All the dishes we had including octopus were perfectly cooked. Service was very good and the prices reasonable. The only slight criticism which prevented a 5 star from us was the limited selection of wines. Would definitely visit again.

Muchas gracias por su rese√±a y por sus amables palabras sobre la comida y la cena; nos alegra enormemente saber que su experiencia fue tan positiva. En cuanto a la carta de vinos, agradecemos su comentario. Actualmente trabajamos con vinos de 14 variedades de uva distintas, seleccionadas con mucho cuidado. No obstante, debido al espacio del que disponemos en el restaurante, la ampliaci√≥n de la bodega es algo que en parte se nos escapa de las manos. Aun as√≠, seguimos esforz√°ndonos por ofrecer opciones de calidad y un buen asesoramiento. Esperamos volver a recibirle muy pronto.

Thank you very much for your review and for your kind words about both the food and dinner; we are truly delighted to know that your experience was so positive. Regarding our wine list, we appreciate your feedback. We currently work with wines made from 14 different grape varieties, all carefully selected. However, due to the limited space available in our restaurant, expanding the wine cellar is something that is partly beyond our control. Even so, we continue to strive to offer quality options and provide good advice. We hope to welcome you back very soon.

Great spot for a quality meal a little outside the touristy areas, that is near parque Rio Madrid, another must see. Work up and appetite and walk from the Royal Palace to Puente Monumental De Arganzuela stopping here along the way. Great food, and friendly service!

Delicious food, very good service, always clean. 

Gabriel is a sweetheart. He always pampers my little ones and makes us feel like we are home! Andrea is also divine! It really is a very friendly team!!!

All very rich and the waiters very friendly. 
100% recommended prawn risoto
Outside the town, you‚Äôll go by taxi, but everything is fresh and beautiful, especially the seafood was very good

Intrigued by the reviews, I had booked a dinner with my wife at this atypical restaurant. Atypical because it is completely decentralized and placed at an anonymous intersection. You have to go there specially since there is nothing around at all. The restaurant externally is a bit anonymous, there is only a sheltered terrace for those who want to eat out. We had booked inside but it was also December. The manager, immediately very kind and with whom we immediately got in tune, advised and briefed us on the different dishes. We also asked for a local white wine. I wanted something different than usual and it succeeded.
What about, it was all really delicious, with dishes prepared with great care and really good. I took some pictures but they don't give the idea of our excellent gastronomic evening. Also the wine recommended to me was very good. The service was nice and fast and throughout the dinner, despite the place was full, we were several faces questioned to our liking.
If I had only one night available in Madrid, I would return to this informal and surprising place. Not to be missed.
Quality food and great service. To repeat. Varied menu and all very good. You can tell it's cooked all with quality products

Booked here as it was close to our hotel on busy New Years Eve. Lovely welcome by fab lady who was host, bar lady, waitress & server all in one. Not sure how she did everything whilst she kept smilling. We asked if we could move tables. The very pleasant man (manager? ) obliged. Food lovely. Garlic prawns, octopus mushroom risotto all good. Restaurant bit cold but then its winter! All in all we had a lovely evening. The staff made it!

We went there as a group following positive reviews.
After the first resistances for the not very inviting external appearance,
we had a great time both for the praiseworthy welcome and for the quality of the food. 
Too nice and courteous the owner who helped us in the choice of dishes.
Paya jambas is so delicious :) The gut is properly tasty and there is a re-entered doctor üòÄ Re-entered doctor is enoughüëçüëç
I came by accident on a honeymoon trip, and it was Korean-flavoured flavoured flavoured flavoured flavoured flavoured flavoured flavoured flavoured. It's quiet. It's good to go in a couple.
Four of us came with the family. Everything on the menu was delicious. I was impressed by the octopus and shrimp dishes. It was a very satisfying lunch. I'd love to have dinner here again.

I don't know how this restaurant got 4.9 stars, nor 4 $$$$. This is a hole-in-the-wall on a side street that serves ok food for fairly low prices. If you need dinner fast and cheap, and you aren't picky, it will do that. Service is friendly and prompt. 
We had mushroom croquettes, paella mariscos, and huevos con patatas y pisto. Definitely none of these were freshly made from raw ingredients. It's worth the effort to find an alternative dining option.

Family kitchen, generous quantity, Price quality ratio very well in a quiet place. 
Service with smile and kindness!
The place is very nice. The waiters very nice and helpful. I ordered patatas bravas and paella, all very good.
The place is nice, the waiters very nice and helpful. I ordered the bravas potatoes and the paella is I liked both dishes. Positive value for money!
A very very good restaurant. Very well prepared and very flavorful food. The staff treats you well and quickly. To come back!!

Restaurant pyramids we prepared an excellent dinner, I likerom all dishes, but especially my
Favorite dish was Alexandria

We read all the excellent reviews of this restaurant and thought we would try it.
 Very glad we did, there was nothing to disappoint.
The service was attentive,kind ,welcoming and friendly.
The food was delicious,tasty and served straight from the oven.
If you are in Madrid, make this restaurant one of your places to visit.
They have the best food, the best cocktails and the best care. We enjoyed a delicious pineapple colada and ate super recommended and of course we will be back.

Great food, great price and fantastic people.
We had the salad, octopus and artichokes. 
Service was fantastic with reasonable price.
Great atmosphere.. great food. Great sangria. Overall it was a amazing experience. Can't wait to come back. Definitely Recommend

Went to
This great tapas bar. We had Risotto mushrooms, scallops and a ham platter. Good and reasonably priced Rioja wine. Great place

Everything great, both the food and the attention received! a pleasure to always come here! The value for money is excellent, I have been coming to this place for many years!

When I got back to Hotel Exe Moncloa which is 4-5 minutes walk, the burger itself is not warm, the burger felt soggy as well as the buns. The sauces does taste nice. The french fries was salty, very disappointed.
