This was the best meal i have had in agenda werkers were super kind and nice the food waa unbelievable i wil be dressing about this for ages
Entre Santos is not just a restaurant ‚Äî it‚Äôs a love letter to gastronomy.

Every time we visit Madrid, it‚Äôs the one place we cannot resist. The food is nothing short of extraordinary ‚Äî not a single dish is ever ‚Äòordinary‚Äô or predictable. Each plate carries a story, a twist, a spark of creativity, and is built from ingredients that are clearly of the highest quality.

The dedication and passion of the kitchen can be tasted in every bite, and the warmth of the staff is felt the moment you walk through the door. They are not only professional but genuinely lovely, making every guest feel special and at home.

And then, the cocktails ‚Äî perfection in a glass, crafted with the same care and imagination as the dishes.

In our eyes, Entre Santos is the embodiment of what dining should be: creativity without pretension, excellence without compromise, and hospitality that comes from the heart. It is a rare gem that, without question, deserves a Michelin star. Until that day comes, it will remain our star in Madrid.

Went in with high expectations and left just a little disappointed. On the whole, good, interesting food but not great food. Example: the shrimp ceviche, which I‚Äôve eaten all over the world. Interesting presentation, but the shrimp just tasted off. The beef tenderloin bites proved tasty, but were overwhelmed by the potato chip flavor of the frites. The Chicken Mohammed, on the other hand, was interesting, innovative, and delicious. Same with the Entre Santos mocktail. Fun, but often distracted servers made for a bit disjointed meal.
Service was amazing!!! I love all the waiters they made this experience amazing! Ask for Charlie and Kevin. Food amazing, drinks amazing, love it all.
I loved it. It was really good food and it looks like the staff really had fun and a good working environment so I really recommend this place.

Very nice tapas address, superb and warm decor, delicious tapas, only flat the service, surely victim of its success, the service is very minimalist, bordering on sufficiency, shame but delicious food...
Great food, spectacular cocktails and Caesar with all his equipment, a luxury! It's the fifth time we've come and come back.
Food is very tasty, especially the piece of meat is recommended. The cheeses are also very tasty in between. Cocktails in many variations go well with the food

Fantastic tapas and cocktail bar. Staff are brilliant and the tapas are the tastiest I‚Äôve ever had. Amazing flavours and textures, with generous portion size. Really creative dishes, served in a vibrant and buzzing environment. Would happily recommend and look forward to a return visit.
Top tasty tapas‚Ä¶laid back and unassuming back street bar that delivered on every front. From tasty tapas dishes to friendly bar staff with a cool local vibe!

I think this was unexpectedly the best food ever!
In my opinion, really stars level, we didn't expect at all when we came into this, actually inconspicuous, store. There was really nothing wrong, the waiters were also very friendly and attentive. If I could I would come back regularly. Value for money really hammer.

Comments aren‚Äôt stolen at all ... I think it‚Äôs one of the best dining experiences of my life at equivalent prices. Everything is delectable, atmosphere, service (effective without being oppressive)
The dishes are fantastic, we are not at all in a classic taverna. It is worked. Acid-grad balances are perfect. The creamy-melting-crunchy scales are present. Typically hibernate raised/spicy touches are subtle. Even the cutlery and dishes are unique. 
I could not make you want more but rush with your eyes closed and let you guide!!
After a few exchanges with the hyper friendly staff, the chef travelled around the world before putting his bags here and it feels on the plate
Great food, but the waiters beautiful and very nice. I would come back for sure!!!!!! Alejandro, a sweetheart.

LOVED everything about this place!! The staff was so much fun and welcoming. The drinks were cheap &amazing and the food was to die for!! My favorite was the ceviche and chimichurri steak (not picture) but would order the croquetas again.

Expansive plazas, local and foreign crowds, street performers, colorful lights, window shopping, restaurant signs promising the best paella, ham, and churros con chocolate- this is downtown Madrid, a collection of plazas interconnected by a network of side streets. Some of these side streets are wide pedestrian shopping routes, and some are hidden, so it's possible to duck in and out of the bustle as desired. The iconic Puerta del Sol is the giant crossroads of the city and a must-see attraction at any time of the day. The nearby Plaza Mayor, completely enclosed by historic red buildings, is an ideal place to grab a bite to eat outside, amidst scores of tables and people out for a stroll. Plaza Isabel II (also known as ‚ÄúOpera‚Äù) is smaller and a good meeting spot, and the stately Plaza del Oriente is the front yard of the Royal Palace. Centro can be touristy (pickpockets are unfortuately not unheard-of here), crowded, and sometimes gimmicky, but it is also the place to experience classic Madrid.

No alcohol free beers though

It was good. Cannot complain on the service or the quality of the food. The wagyu and black angus were truly fresh and juicy. The ambiance was clean, chic and serene. 

It is suitable for groups. But also, for couples. One thing to know is - they don't serve coffee. That's all.

So all in all, good place.

The food was great and the staff was fantastic! 
My girlfriend loved the blue lychee drink, and we had to buy some extra of the dipping sauce to bring home because it was simply that good.

Appears like an authentic Japanese BBQ. The room and the seats are somewhat sterile and therefore do not become a place you might sit longer than you have to.

Good selection of meat.
We chose mixed menu for 53 ‚Ç¨ per person, then you get with rice and a very small portion of vegetables on sharing. The meat was fantastic, but there was too little food in general and at that price. Accessories of sides cost 6 ‚Ç¨ and are also small portions.
Good food experience, but price and total experience make us probably not coming back.

amazing in every aspect: food, service, interior. excellent. recommend to everyone. Had a delightful dinner with my family at this place. We tried wagyu, seafood and most of the american meat as well as pork belly and different salads. Every single thing was absolutely delicious. And I think this sums up this restaurant pretty well.

We ate well even though we did not have high expectations. The place is not particularly welcoming. The Owner is in the kitchen and takes the utmost care in preparing the dishes. All good and freshly cooked.

The place is black! Ceiling, walls, floor - I don't like it at all - like in a tomb.
The meat is grilled at the table, which makes it very hot.
Prices are excessive !!! A kilo of Waguy is charged about 900‚Ç¨, which is a bad joke. The meat is quite tender because it is marbled with fat.
We paid 300‚Ç¨ for two, which was 150‚Ç¨ too much. Cardy rice costs 4,50‚Ç¨ extra, each dip or vegetable is charged separately, a glass of Primitivo 0,2 l hits with 14‚Ç¨. For me, the place is incomprehensible and not a place to draw me again !

We have been here a few times now and we like it again and again. It is a bit annoying to reserve a table as it is not a real booking system. On site the service is always great. I recommend ordering food for larger groups, because everything is not always there in the desired quantity. 

Priced rather higher, but the quality is usually really good. Once we had the garlic marinated meat in the pot so greasy that none of us could eat it.

Overpriced for the quality. Side dishes poorly prepared and inadequate. For three people, a total of 3 mushrooms, 3 slices of zucchini and 3 small pieces of pumpkin. Insufficient amount of sauces. We cannot recommend a visit.
An experience you absolutely must try if you are a meat lover. Very helpful and friendly staff. High prices but proportionate to the food you are tasting.üîù

We were told everything on the menu, how to grill the food, the accompanying dips, and the homemade soy sauce was very tasty. It was a relaxed evening. A little more expensive, but we're happy to pay more for the good quality.

Worst service ever starting from the booking on the website where it at the end of the ‚Äúacceptance of my request‚Äù mail states a standard talk/talk about they will get back to the customer in 48h‚Ä¶.. where other restaurants have their booking online, Ushido may benefit from moving into the 21st century on this point.

So I can‚Äôt comment on the food but only hope service in the restaurant is more professional. 
No I won‚Äôt bother to book this restaurant again BERLIN is full of nice restaurants with the service in top.

go there hungry otherwise you will not cope with the amount of food you will served

This restaurant is incredible; the vibe, the service and the food of course, see other reviews for the food reviews as I'd just repeat them. I'm not at all adventurous in my food choices and so this really stressed my brain/pallet but all for no reason. 10/10; incredible

Went here in a group of 7 and it was great. Very helpful staff suggesting how many dishes to order and friendly throughout. Food and venue were great and drinks good. 
We booked and suggest you do too if you want to guarantee table

Visited this restaurant on our first night in Berlin. We made a reservation as the reviews were great and we didn‚Äôt want to miss out by not getting a table! We weren‚Äôt disappointed. The concept of German food served tapas style was brilliant and the food was amazing. Our server was Jonas: he was really helpful and his recommendations for both the food and wine were spot on. He‚Äôs a real credit to the restaurant and really made our evening. Would definitely recommend a meal here.
An outstanding evening. The software phenomenal and service was superb. I would hire recommend to anyone who wants to have German cuisine in a different style on their trip to Berlin
Friendly and helpful from the start. The German tapas offering was varied, interesting and flavoursome. Great wine too. Helpful, personal and friendly service.

An atmospheric German restaurant near Alexanderplatz.Decor superb.Staff extremely attentive and take a long time going through the menu with us.Traditional German food served tapas style.As an example choose say cheese filled dumpling with slow cooked beef.Then do the same with other choices.Great experience,lovely staff great atmosphere and not expensive.hard was staggering back to underground one stop from Alexanderplatz.

We've come on our honeymoon to Berlin and wanted to have a really nice dining experience whilst out, dressed up and wanting to try something unique- after researching we decided on PeterPaul, for the really interesting menu and fine dining small plates concept on traditional German cuisine. We didn't quite know what to expect but wanted something different. I'm so glad we decided on this place- the staff were absolutely brilliant, so attentive, personable and you can tell they really have a passion for what they do and take great pride in what they have going at the restaurant. The venue itself was very cool- in an effortless, inner city style, gave an exclusive and sexy feel but not in a pretentious way. We were recommended a few dishes as we wanted to try as many different flavour profiles and we weren't pushed to have too many- just recommended the perfect amount. Absolutely divine food. So many interesting flavours, textures and combinations. We also enjoyed a really nice bottle of Reisling - great wine menu for those who enjoy a glass. Thanks for making our evening so enjoyable PeterPaul team! Will recommend to any friends next coming to Berlin. X
Nice restaurant Good food! We ate currywurst, sild, Roastbiff and chicken. German food in Tapas format Very goodüòäRecommended at the hottest

This is an absolute Hidden Gem in Berlin- 2nd Visit and it was even better
The Ambience, Buzz, Decor and Staff are all superb
The food is simply sensational
Nice Wines
Clemens the Maitre D' was very attentive and really made our visit special
Excellent Value for money- especially if you live in Dublin!

Have a nice evening during a long weekend in Berlin. Absolutely recommended. Delicious dishes, fine portions and beautiful matching wines. More than excellent value for money. Funny that the co-pilot of the restaurant turned out to speak Dutch.
I can only agree with the positive reviews before me: very nice, attentive Service and very delicious food!

Absolutely not to be missed, if you come to Berlin you absolutely must try this place, it is the best we have eaten in! Dishes are carefully curated with balanced flavors, I absolutely recommend the cheesy dumings, potato salad and Berlin-style meatballs, all really delicious. We also had a bottle of local Pinot Noir. The staff is really genital, helpful and courteous. We spent about ‚Ç¨ 50 per person with a total of about 8/9 dishes and a bottle of wine, the price is absolutely worth it and reflects the quality of the restaurant, three dishes we took twice from how delicious they were! The cuisine is traditional German but reinterpreted in a modern key, the portions are a middle ground between tapas and normal dish, so you can taste and share with friends or family more dishes and try new tastes!
Really highly recommended, go there!!!
Nice place, friendly staff but too expensive for what you get. ‚Ç¨ 11 for a curry sausage üôà or ‚Ç¨ 18 for 2 pieces of meat

Overall, the experience was fairly good. The service was friendly, and the atmosphere was pleasant. However, there were a few aspects that could be improved ‚Äî some details felt a bit overlooked, and the quality didn‚Äôt fully meet expectations. Still, it was enjoyable enough, and with a few adjustments, it could easily be great. Worth a try!

Classic German food served elegantly as a sharing menu. The food is tasty, with small interpretations and still true to the German origin. 
The fifth star is for truly carried out and attentive service, with great love for the food, the wine, the place and the guest.
Here I will come back the next time I visit Berlin.

Was sie aber richtig verstanden haben ist, das wir das besondere im Produkt suchen, das Huhn von einem Z√ºchter aus unserer Region stammt und dieses von so au√üer gew√∂hnlich guter Qualit√§t ist, das man damit keinen Schnick Schnack betreiben muss. Des Weiteren sollten sie verstehen, dass wir unsere Fische, unser Fleisch fast ausschlie√ülich bei 60¬∞C garen und servieren, was ein wirkliches hei√ü und sehr warm generell ausschlie√üt, aber ein saftiges, butterzartes und glasiges St√ºck hervor bringt, die Produkte nicht trocken auslaufen und damit z√§h macht, sondern den Eigenegeschmack bewahrt. Wir k√∂nnen uns auch sehr gut an ihren Tisch erinnern, da es von 400 servierten Men√ºs nur eine derartige Reklamation gab. Was den halbgefrorene Cheese Cake angeht liegen sie leider falsch, was sie beschreiben war in der Tat ein Halbgefrorenes, aber kein Cheese Cake sondern ein Parfait von der L√§rche, was schon sehr au√üergew√∂hnlich ist, finden sie nicht auch. Der Cheese Cake an sich war eine Interpretation als Creme aufgespritzt & Amarettini Br√∂seln, kam √ºbrigens sehr gut an. Also das Ganze hat also nichts mit Landeiern oder arroganten Berlinern zu tun, sondern schlicht weg mit Uninformiertheit ihrer Seits und mir scheint sie m√∂gen unsere Art der Weinbark√ºche nicht und ok, man merkt auch einwenig ihre Unkenntnis in h√∂heren Geschmacksfragen... was auch aus unserer Sicht vollkommen legitim ist. Vllt. kommen sie uns doch einmal in unserem Restaurant besuchen, wann sie interessiert was Herr M√ºller und sein Team zubereiten. Mit freundlichen Gr√º√üen, ihr Rutz Team

No cuteness: this is not allowed in a three Michelin macarons (especially after technical desserts more than gourmet)

We visited Rutz in Berlin (3 Michelin stars) during the Easter weekend 2025. The reception and service were good, the atmosphere okay, although the overall look felt somewhat businesslike and distant.

As for the food: disappointing for a three-star establishment. The balance of flavours was often not right ‚Äì several dishes were far too salty, while others were far too acidic. In terms of structure and presentation, there was no excitement or innovation. Each dish consisted of one element with a sauce served separately. Compared to other star-studded stores we visited earlier, this was clearly lagging behind.

The price is exceptionally high. We knew this beforehand, but it is precisely because of this that the bar is also considerably higher. At this price range you expect special ingredients or pronounced techniques, but they were largely lacking.

In a city like Berlin, there are plenty of alternatives where you will be surprised more culinary for less money.

Money may govern many things, but it buys neither style nor decency. A 3-star restaurant stands for the highest culinary art, first-class service and a special atmosphere. Anyone who goes there should have respect not only for the food but also for the work of the cooks and staff.

Short trousers and bathing slippers destroy this very atmosphere. Fine dining is not only a matter of taste, but also of experience. Anyone who shows up in sweatpants or beach outfit shows that they don‚Äôt care about this experience ‚Äì and that‚Äôs disrespectful to all other guests who have deliberately chosen this ambience.

Style and decency do not mean you have to dine in a suit, but a certain level of care should be taken for granted. Money alone doesn‚Äôt make a gentleman ‚Äì it shows in attitude, respect and behaviour.
Mr M√ºller doesn‚Äôt care, everyone is welcome , there could be a potential CIO or higher behind every ‚Äúcasual outfit‚Äù. Money rules the world!

The disappointment began with the entree, with the music. Annoyingly South American, irritatingly close to the threshold of hearing. Mood killer. The ambience careless and very boring. Bald and matter-of-fact can be good, see Cookies Cream, but at Rutz it looks more like a canteen. You'd need a good interior designer. The fuller the store, the louder it got, which sometimes made a conversation exhausting. We like star restaurants with more distance to the neighboring tables, because space also means luxury. Clearly listening to the conversations of the businessmen next door is not.

We had chosen the 8-course veggie menu, without wine accompaniment, which already raised eyebrows. Greetings from the kitchen were exciting and promised excellent. Then, however, things continued rather less spectacularly. The kitchen is undoubtedly creative. Something is on offer to the eye, kitchen with tweezers. But we missed the special, extraordinary taste. We found the ‚Äútruffle‚Äù upgrade of an aisle particularly annoying. A dish with a few slices of black winter truffles that had little of their own taste ‚Äì for an extra 49 euros. 
The ‚ÄúPlum & Kern√∂l‚Äù dessert was one of the highlights, as was the final greeting from the ‚ÄúAutumn Prince & Green Juniper‚Äù kitchen.
The service was attentive from the beginning and quite professional. We wanted two particularly interesting glasses of wine from the sommelier. One was indeed, the other somehow arbitrary.
On our way home, we discussed whether we were simply too untrained in rating a 3-star kitchen (Das Rutz was only our 2. Experience), but in the end it matters whether you come out of a restaurant enthusiastically. The 2-star restaurant of the week before had set a benchmark for us that the Rutz clearly did not reach (anymore?). Our bill amounted to ‚Ç¨890 ‚Äì excluding tips.

The best we've ever experienced. Sustainable cuisine, local ingredients, taste variations never heard before, let alone tasted, embedded in perfect service around host Falco mills and perfectly coordinated wine recommendations.

I was bringing my mom to celebrate her retirement - her first three Michelin Star restaurant experience. The food is spectacular. The taste and dish presentation were on the nose. The problems I faced were with the service - things I have never experienced in other top-tier, three star restaurants. Some of these are inexcusable errors. I left highly disappointed.

First, we were told by our server that we get a taste before the pour so we thought this applied to all of our drinks rather than only the wines. When we were given our first non-alcoholic pairing, there was no instruction that this is the actual pair and not a taste, also the dish came about 10-15 minutes later so we drank it. The server who brought over the dish was confused because she did not see the pairing at our table and had to ask us whether we had already tried the catfish. We told her that we thought it was a tasting to see if we liked the drink so she had graciously gone to ask the somm whether we can have a refill with our dish. The somm had instructed our server that we could get a refill only if we wanted to pay extra. Granted it tasted great, the cost of making the vegetable juice is insignificant compared to wine.

Second, when we wanted to use the restroom, we were asked to wait until after the main course as it was coming soon. The service should be working around the guest, not the other way around.

Third, I noticed that I received the WRONG bill - it was more than what I am supposed to pay.

I've given this exact feedback to the restaurant when they emailed me for it. It's been over a week and have yet to receive any responses. This is yet another example of how service is lacking.

The visit to the Rutz (***) was absolutely extraordinary in every respect. Extraordinarily exciting because I have probably never eaten in such a high-class restaurant that has such a strong philosophy and lives. Exceptionally delicious, because nevertheless each dish simply tastes extremely good and often provides memories of tastes from childhood, for example. And exceptionally sympathetic, because you feel right in good hands in this beautiful restaurant, with chef Marco M√ºller, who presented and explained a course directly at the kitchen, and with the service team around restaurant manager Falco. Thank you for this fantastic evening!

Our expectations of the restaurant were high, especially because we wanted to celebrate our anniversary there. Unfortunately, the evening turned out to be the only disappointment.
Starting with a chaotic reservation process to a disastrous service.

Even the reservation was difficult. After booking online, we called for confirmation and found that the reservation was not noted. We had to make reservations again by phone. But even upon our arrival there was again no reservation and we were put without comment at a tiny table next to the wine cabinets. I was also forced to first clear away several champagne stands stored under the table by myself in order to be able to sit at all.

The service continued the disappointing experience. While pouring the water, I discovered a deep red lipstick print on my glass. A clear sign of a lack of hygiene. But it got worse... When the wine was served, my partner was injured by a sharp-edged splinter on the wine glass. This was the point for me where I would have liked to end the evening. But in order not to ruin the anniversary completely, I decided to stay because my partner was very much looking forward to the truffle pasta.

Unfortunately, even the food could not save our mood. The truffle paste was completely cooked and only the sauce met expectations. Even the previously served white bread was rock hard and stale.

During the evening, we realized that we were not the only ones suffering from the poor service. At the next table we discovered another wine glass with a striking jump during the evening. When we pointed this out to the waitress, she reacted annoyed and replaced the glass with another DIRTY glass.

Conclusion: In a restaurant of this standard, cleanliness, professionalism and hospitality should come first. The many shortcomings and indifference of the staff made this evening a decidedly negative experience. In the face of all these grievances, all I have left is to award a star.

Es tut mir leid zu h√∂ren, dass Ihr Abend so entt√§uschend war. Es ist besonders frustrierend, wenn man sich auf einen besonderen Anlass wie einen Jahrestag freut und dann mit solch schlechten Erfahrungen konfrontiert wird. Die Probleme, die Sie beschrieben haben ‚Äì von der chaotischen Reservierung √ºber die hygienischen M√§ngel bis hin zum unprofessionellen Service ‚Äì sind in der Tat inakzeptabel, besonders in einem Restaurant, das einen h√∂heren Anspruch erhebt.

Eine solche Erfahrung kann nicht nur den Abend ruinieren, sondern auch das gesamte Erlebnis eines Restaurants in Frage stellen. Es ist wichtig, dass Restaurants nicht nur auf das Essen, sondern auch auf den Service und die Atmosph√§re achten, um den G√§sten ein rundum positives Erlebnis zu bieten. Ihre R√ºckmeldung ist wertvoll und k√∂nnte dem Restaurant helfen, die notwendigen Verbesserungen vorzunehmen.

Ich hoffe, dass Sie in Zukunft bessere Restaurant-Erlebnisse haben werden und dass Ihr n√§chster Jahrestag unvergesslich wird ‚Äì im positiven Sinne!

I attended a birthday celebration at Mjalt Presents and had a great time. The food was genuinely good and very enjoyable, with everyone at the table happy with what was served. It was a warm and pleasant experience, and I would happily return again.

Waited 30 min to be seated. Food and service was terrible. We left before the dessert but was offered no payment. 
Never never never again.

Ristorante Mjalt offers a wonderful dining experience with delicious, well-prepared dishes and great presentation. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, perfect for both casual meals and special occasions. Service was friendly and attentive throughout our visit. Highly recommend for anyone looking for quality food and a pleasant experience.
This place consistently delivers excellence. Authentic Italian recipes with modern technique, attentive staff, fresh ingredients, and a classy yet relaxed atmosphere make it worth every visit.
Amazing service and truly authentic Italian taste! The staff‚Äôs warmth and the inviting atmosphere make every visit memorable. The pasta dishes are especially outstanding.
The restaurant is very popular, so there was a wait ‚Äî but the excellent service, perfectly cooked pasta, and beautiful setting made it worth it.

My visit to Ristorante Mjalt in Berlin was an absolute delight. From the warm ambiance to the fresh, well-crafted dishes, everything impressed. The octopus starter, porcini risotto, Barolo pairing, and tiramisu created a perfect dining experience.

What an extraordinary evening! The atmosphere was warm and sophisticated, service impeccable, and every dish beautifully prepared with rich, layered flavors. Fresh pasta and perfect wine pairings made the experience unforgettable.
A modern twist on authentic Italian flavors. The homemade pasta was delicious, the service warm and professional, and the setting perfect for a date night.
We had an amazing time; great food, fab wine, wonderful service. Highly recommend! Around the corner from the Kultur Brauerei so perfect for dinner followed by culture

This restaurant has become our go-to spot for celebrations. The quality and service are consistently outstanding, and the staff always make us feel remembered. The food is exceptional and beautifully served, with an elegant yet comfortable atmosphere.
Known for warm hospitality and genuinely Italian cuisine, this place has a cozy charm that‚Äôs perfect for quiet, romantic dinners. A wonderful experience from start to finish.
An extraordinary experience at ‚ÄúMjalt‚Äù ‚Äì authentic cuisine and a warm atmosphere in Berlin Prenzlauer Berg

My visit to Restaurant Mjalt in Berlin was one of the best culinary experiences I have had in recent times. I felt welcome as soon as I entered. The ambience is warm, modern and lovingly designed ‚Äì a place that immediately conveys a cosy and personal atmosphere.

The service was excellent. The staff were friendly, attentive and always helpful without ever seeming intrusive. The staff explained the menu with patience and gave very good recommendations if you could not decide immediately when choosing.

The food was just great. Every meal was freshly prepared, tastefully balanced and beautifully arranged. You immediately notice that a lot of attention to detail and high-quality ingredients are used here. Especially the main course was a real highlight ‚Äì perfectly prepared and taste unforgettable. The desserts were also a pleasant surprise: light, aromatic and with a modern touch.

The value for money is also absolutely fair, especially for the quality you get here. Mjalt is definitely a place you like to return to ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs for a relaxed dinner, a special get-together or simply to enjoy good cuisine in a pleasant atmosphere.

I can highly recommend Mjalt to anyone looking for a special culinary experience in Berlin. Looking forward to my next visit!

A nice dinner, a stylish restaurant and good service.

1A. Toller Service. Excellent food. Fully recommended. When I get back to Berlin, I will come back here.

 ‚Ç¨ 150,00 and this I could not redeem , because I did not have the checkout slip with me. ( A GIFT ! NO CHECKOUT NOTE )

The restaurant concept seemed very special (like an event) and the prices were auspiciously high. Unfortunately, you felt like a guest in a train station restaurant. No real hospitality was felt. Amazing place, under the subway tracks, fantastic food very charming environment, almost exclusively frequented by Berliners.
Absolutely recommended
Beautiful German gem, see for your German brown cafe with traditional food. Food arrived quickly but very tasty! Great portions and friendly staff. Assortment of beers also huge.

We wanted to eat inside but we weren't allowed to. Everyone had to eat in the beer garden across the road. Smoking is allowed at all tables there. It is next to the railway and a busy road. So you can't eat outside nice and quiet. 
We didn't love the food. The salad was very bad. Dehydrated and brown edges on the lettuce. The pepper was very weak and you could bend it without it breaking.
I would not recommend this restaurant.

We stopped here after a beer at the beer garden where it was too late for food. I‚Äôm so glad we did. The food was fabulous, the portions huge and prices reasonable. They had great microbrew beers too. We may come come back to try the pork knuckles - they looked so meaty and the meat just fell from the bone. We had the spaetzle with bacon and the chicken cordon blue. Both great choices. I highly recommend!

Charming local, carved under the railway near the Tiergarden stop. Few places available, better to book. Typical German pub setting, with shared tables. Maybe a little noisy but it's part of the local type. The staff was very friendly and efficient. Traditional dishes are served in some cases slightly revisited (usually presented as proposals of the day). Excellent quality and monstrous quantities. We tried duck, cheese spatzel and boulette. Great choice of beers. Prices below the city average: 62‚Ç¨ (tip excluded) for 3 large dishes (you ate at least four), 2 beers and water.

Great place 
Excellent food at a good price
Letter in Spanish 
Live music 
I ended up dancing on the track
Very funny 
If you don't want to wait too long for the food to be brought to you don't go to rush hour
I would certainly repeat
Local beer and Schnitsell , very good, a traditional restaurant in Berlin for traditional German food

If you take the northern exit from the platform, you land right next to the entrance to the spring. The ambience is quaint, the staff friendly and prudent. The local beer and food are delicious. In addition to the menu, there are also changing dishes. The portions are sufficient for normal hunger. A timely reservation is recommended. We will definitely come back.
Really lovely cosy restaurant. We had the Berlin Meatballs and the Game Goulash. Both were really tasty. Beers and service were also great. Traditional music was played for a donation.

A restaurant that doesn‚Äôt pay for a mine from outside but once you walk through the door. We discover a typical German tavern , very rustic , very warm welcome , simple cuisine but on homemade and gargantuan quantities a big thank you

Very authentic atmosphere. We were made to feel very welcome and the children were even given a lollipop at the end. The food tastes good and the portions are massive! I‚Äôd definitely recommend pre-booking as it is very popular and difficult to find space in. Definitely worth the visit!

Cool pub/restaurant under the train tracks. Weather was not so great, so they were seating indoors. We were in the front room. The back room appeared to be a private party. Very crowded, communal tables. Popular with the locals. Lots of drink options, including extensive bottle beer options. Draft beer was from a local brewery, Lemke. This was fun because I have a friend named Lemke, took some coasters for him. I had the goulash with red cabbage and boiled potatoes. Wife had the meatballs with potato salad and a big pickle. Both were nice but my wife preferred to add my leftover sauce to her meatballs. The pickle was very good, especially with the meatball or with the potato salad. We finished with a brownie in vanilla sauce, served warm and quite tasty. Staff spoke English, and was helpful, despite the crowds. Service was reasonably quick. Menu had a nice selection, as well as a handful of specials. To drink I had a one of the standard Lemke beers, but I also tried a Berliner Weisse beer as well. This is Germany‚Äôs answer to the Belgian Lambic. The beer is naturally sour, so they temper that by adding fruit syrup, like raspberry or cherry. Another options is a herbal mixture, Woodruff. Hard to describe the last one, to me it is kind of minty. All are sweet. The sweet addition rounds out the sourness. Probably not for everyone, but if you like sour beers, I suggest you try it sometime. . While it may be ‚Äúdiscovered‚Äù it is first a neighborhood place. Love that about it.

Not a good meal 
Unfortunately the schnitzel was terrible and the food took more than forever 
Very disappointing 
Also too expensive
Great food and service. It was very busy, we had to wait a while for a table to become available. Tasty food, not expensive and large portions. Highly recommended.

I can recommend this pub to all travelers to Berlin. The interior is old and worn out, which has a special charm. In addition, there is a very good menu with solid home cooking or bourgeois cuisine. From the Wiener Schnitzel to the Haxe you get everything you imagine under German cuisine. I always liked it and the portions are very large.

We were really looking forward to our visit. Service was good but food was disappointingly bland and sadly a bit meh.
Great restaurant! The service is very friendly and the atmosphere is very pleasant. The food was delicious too. Definitely a place worth coming back to.

Today I visited an Indian restaurant for the first time and I really liked it.

My first contact with Indian cuisine was all-round positive.
I will gladly come back and recommend it to others.
The food is good, service is good, and the atmosphere is good. It is a little expensive though and the size of the portions could be bigger for that price.

Great and very tasty food with a wide selection, there is something for everyone. The staff was very attentive and friendly, we will definitely come back!
Thank you for everything! I would recommend your restaurant to anyone! The waiters were very nice! The price was amazingly very cheap! The food tasted very good!

Phenomenal experience from start to finish. The waiting staff were lovely and the food was outstanding. We will definitely return on our next trip to berlin üòÅ. Keep up the great work Aapka team üíú
Fantastic food and great service and value for money awesome. That's all Indian can do. The Naan is like original. Highly recommended

Very complete menu of dishes, servers of extreme sympathy, it was a really pleasant evening with six of our children.
Everything we chose in dishes was really delicious. We recommend for the quality of meals, quantity also.
Go ahead, you won't be disappointed!

We ordered drinks, starters, and main courses, and in under 5 minutes our mains appeared which suggests to me that the curries are not freshly prepared. While the food itself was average, we never received our starters & dips. When a server asked if we had enjoyed our meal, the missing starters still had not been addressed. We were charged for all the food and when I pointed out that we had not received items, the server looked confused instead of apologetic!!
The service is disorganised and rushed, with too many tables crammed into the space. The experience felt more like buffet-style dining; eat quickly and move on, lacking attention to detail. In my view this restaurant is highly overrated.

Great Indian food. We both chose for a change to vegetarians option with Channa and Jalfrezi vegetables curry, massive flavour from each. The chick peas in the Channa worked so well. Very impressed with the before and after flavours tasted. Each dish came with a steaming hot basmati rice. Very well recommended, to visit this restaurant.
Tasteful, authentic Indian food. The above average good service stayed with me especially well. Very happy to come back.

My name is Juan Sanint, I'm from Colombia and I am arriving in Berlin this afternoon from Prague with my wife and a couple of friends, today is my wife's birthdate and I would like to celebrate her and make some thing a little special for her, let me know if it is possible to do it and book it for four people. My number in what's app is 573104626797 Thanks in advance.

A really fun and delicious restaurant with an interesting menu that will not disappoint, great ambience . We unfortunately had eaten a very large brunch that day but we pushed through ‚Ä¶. Wine was also very good.

Dear Pantry team, I want to thank you again for the warm welcome, great service, yummy menu and lovely atmosphere in your restaurant for the occasion of my husband's birthday. My husband was blown away and you really made us happy. If we come back to Berlin, we will definately visit your restaurant again and for sure we will recommand this to our friends and family whenever they will visit Berlin. My warmest and deepest THANK YOU !!! Take care, love Mieke

We were on a Sunday night there not many guests understandable. The choice of food very good, we found the food very good and the portions were rather large 
We came to this place based on a recommendation and will come back (are we in Berlin again...)
We were a small group and came on recommendation. Great atmosphere, stylishly decorated, good menu/dishes, great Service (competent, humorous, devoted): we felt very comfortable. Thank you.

Elegant restaurant with ethnic grafts to Teutonic cuisine. Despite the ambition, the meat is not exceptional or served in an original way. Potatoes tasteless enough. Good chocolate dessert without overdoing it. In general a bit of a disappointment.

Good energy, excellent food, good drinks, what‚Äôs not to like. We were surprised how good the food actually were. When ordering a good steak, and you concentrate more on the side dishes, you know it‚Äôs all good.

We had a great time in Berlin and I was so glad that a friend gave me the name of Pantry. This is a great restaurant to have a nice eventing with friends of family. The food was delicious, the wine tasted great and the service was very nice with a big smile. We had the beef tataki (I love ponzu), salmon tataki, risotto and the burgers and the were yummy!

Pantry was a delight from start to finish. The food was absolutely delicious, and the staff were wonderfully friendly and full of positive energy. The atmosphere is stunning, especially in the backyard seating area which feels like a hidden oasis in the city. Highly recommend for a relaxed and memorable meal.

Due to the good weather, the catering took place in the attractively designed backyard. Apart from the fact that there was nothing wrong with the choice of food and the quality and the spicy homemade bread gave an idea of the successful evening in front, it must be emphasized that the service and hospitality were absolutely exceptional. We have not experienced such attentive service and friendly and humorous service for a long time, apart from visits to the absolute top gastronomy, as we did during our visit to the Pantry. We had the feeling of being welcomed to friends. Too bad we don't live in Berlin. We would definitely be regulars here. Thanks again for the wonderful evening. Next time we are in Berlin, we will see you again!
We had reserved and got a nice quiet table. The food was fancy and good. The service, too. However, a Coke 0.2 for 5 EUR is really a proud price.
nice place, super food, price quality very good. am fan who 2 gay garcon's:-) hilarious to see those busy. wide choice for who wants what

We were already in the pantry for the second time and were thrilled again. Very friendly reception with removal of the wardrobe and that accompany to the nicely laid table. The pantry really has its own flair, very warm and with a feel-good character. The whole staff very friendly and also equipped with a decent dose of humor. The food very fine and perfectly arranged and also brought to the guest. The Patntry stands for perfect gastronomy from food to service and always a recommendation. On leaving the location we were accompanied to the exit which confirmed the positive overall picture again. Thank you for a great time. Axel Strothmann & family

I was with friends yesterday at Panty Restaurant in Mitte.
First: pleasant atmosphere, first-class service, a culinary highlight that delights

We enjoyed the following:

Turbot
Steak Florentine
the digestif of espresso and and and I forgot, but was super
Dinner accompanied by a
excellent Pinot Blanc

I will gladly come back and can recommend the ‚Äúpub‚Äù.

What a find! Happened upon this restaurant and lucky to get a table on a Friday night. Great food and service. Loved the ambiance. Very friendly staff. We had fillet steak and tuna steak. Both superb as were the veg. We‚Äôll be back if possible.

Addendanace at arrival was excellent and also service during the dinner.
Starters with Chardonnay White wine were good.
Not happy at all with the steak filet, which was the most expencive main disc, not tender and lots of fat.
We could eat only half of the steak.

In 1963, Sch√∂neberg was the center of the political west, inspiring John F. Kennedy to choose this area to famously announce, "Ich bin ein Berliner." Times may have changed, but modern-day Sch√∂neberg still pays tribute to its historical legacies. Once the richest city outside of Berlin proper, the area's affluent past is still visible in ornate housing facades dating back to the Gr√ºnderzeit of the 19th century, while residents in fur coats walking their dogs or shopping in high-end KaDeWe continue the tradition with a modern flair. Sch√∂neberg was also once the center of the decadent and burlesque nightlife of the 1920s. It was here that Marlene Dietrich partied with Christopher Isherwood and the first gay bar in Germany was founded. Today, the gay community still revolves around Nollendorfplatz. The overground Ubahn station is even illuminated in rainbow colors, paying tribute to Sch√∂neberg's progressive past.

This time much better experience, because by experience better ordered (last visit 2024 was rather a disappointing dry aged for an exaggerated price with rather (then) mediocrity...) ...this time the flamb√©ed chorizo - a must - the entrecote very well fried - not top of the line, but good steakhouse - gladly again

What an amazing restaurant the food is fantastic and the service is brilliant. We visited for my mums birthday today and they made such a fuss of her even bringing out a desert with a sparkler in. You really made her day thank you. We are visiting from the UK and will definitely recommend to our friends if they are ever visiting Berlin.

Amazing steak and great service. Had filet, sirloin and rib eye all amazing. I am fussy around steak and it was one of the best. Burger was fantastic too. Staff are so accommodating. Bread and garlic butter was to die for. Wine was great too. A must try.

We went to Asador for my partners birthday, whilst on a trip to Berlin from the UK. I had booked Asador purely on the reviews on trip advisor and I‚Äôm so glad I trusted those reviews and great trip advisor score! 

We go out for steak for pretty much every birthday, and I booked Asador months ago when I booked the trip to Berlin.

When we got to Asador, we were greeted by friendly staff and were immediately offered drinks and bread with a lovely garlic butter. 

We both had ribeye steaks that were cooked to absolute perfection (medium rare) as well as grilled vegetables, my partner had fries and I had rosemary potatoes and we both had bearnaise sauce. I couldn‚Äôt fault one single thing about the meal, it was delicious! 

When I made the booking, I‚Äôd added a note to say it was my partners birthday, sometimes when you go to places and they‚Äôre busy, these notes tend to get missed but not at Asador, they had seen the note, and when my partner asked for the dessert menu, a lovely and attentive member of staff (who‚Äôs name I‚Äôm sorry we didn‚Äôt ask for!) went off and came back with dessert and a sparkler. He sung happy birthday to my partner and showed us that he cared and wanted to make the effort. 

To end our meal, he gave us some limoncello, and then asked if we wanted more, as I don‚Äôt really drink, I said no and then he asked if we‚Äôd tried Berliner luft (a popular peppermint liqueur in Germany we‚Äôre told) and brought some over for us to try (this is so nice if you are reading and haven‚Äôt tried!) 

As I said, I really can‚Äôt fault our experience at Asador and would recommend to anyone looking for a lovely restaurant for any occasion! (Even just for a weekday dinner). We even said if this was a local restaurant to us at home, we‚Äôd regularly return. 

Thank you so much to the kind member of staff this evening and to all the other staff for making it an all round perfect evening.
The food here is ok. My pork was overcooked and therefore dry. The service was ok and pleasant. The wine and beer were ok. Not a five star restaurant.

Great steaks, food was amazing. Beer was good too. Only thing that we didnt like was the waiter/server had already added 10% to the bill. Not sure if this is because we where tourists or is the normal thing restaurants do in Berlin.

Cute little and loving shop whose name is program. The food is impeccable, makes you happy because fluffy and delicious. The care is wonderful, very attentive-it doesn't get better. Come back. Thanks for the wonderful lunch.

Happened by this restaurant and decided to give dumplings a try. These are stuffed with various veggy concotions and nicely served up with an accompanying sauce - so nicely presented. We three had different dishes and tasted each other's meal and declared all to be delicious. A must when we're back in Berlin.

Like many others who've written reviews, we were surprised to find that steamed buns (bao) are very tasty. We guzzled savory buns with walnut and with chipotle filling, followed by a honey bun with poppy seeds (we shared). The dressings were excellent and despite the smallish size, we were happily filled up. The two young women serving seemed to do an excellent job. There's lots of light and space in the resto, which also has a wall decorated with buns. Get happy!

As not a big fan of dumplings- i was a bit scared going to have a meal here. But- when i saw the place, big smiles, nice flowers- all was good. And then- the menu!!! So small, but also- enough for everyone. Drinks, sweet and salty versions of dumplings. Awesome experience and nice lunch.

H√§ppies is a restaurant in Berlin that serves steamed buns with unique fillings, both savory and sweet. Reviewers rave about the food and service, especially recommending the dumplings with blue cheese and pear or lentils.

Spacious new location where it is now a little easier to get a seat and only a stone's throw away from the old shop :) 
H√§ppies are and will remain the best yeast dumplings I have ever eaten in my life. Made with passion and you can taste it.

So nice that H√§ppies is finally back. 2023 was just missing something without you.

We were introduced to Happies by a food tour guide. Wonderfully unique, like nothing we‚Äôve ever eaten before. Add to the quality of the food the love and attention of the staff and owner. This place is simply brilliant, and ‚ÄúHappy‚Äù

We absolutely love H√§ppies.
This was our 4th visit at this tiny little place - and a "must-visit" whenever we are i Berlin.
The germkn√∂dels are just perfect, tasty and beautiful - and the owner and her staff are so friendly and altogether lovely people.
A trip to berlin without a H√§ppies is just not right - so we will se you again somewhere in Berlin

Denoted in Prenzlauer Berg by a couple outside tables and their Zoloft-reminiscent mascot h√§ppies exudes joy in the form of creative globally-inspired Dumplings served at fair prices from a gracious staff.

Not the Germkn√∂deln of old, though a Dessert Bun named ‚ÄúNetti‚Äù puts Spiced Plum and Austrian Poppyseeds front and center in Brown Butter, h√§ppies offerings are all Vegetarian and served with Salad with one enough for a snack and two plenty for most as a meal.

Prone to weekend sell-outs of top items, though pre-orders and take-out are available, it is amidst clean white surroundings that diners huddle over Coffee or Housemade Lemonade while digging into flavors like ‚ÄúMathias‚Äù Soy, Figs and Chilies or the Lentil-loaded ‚ÄúKrische‚Äù served with Chutney, Yogurt and Papadam.

‚Ç¨7,00 to ‚Ç¨8,50 apiece, not ‚Äúcheap‚Äù but quite affordable considering portions and products involved, youngsters are invited to indulge in Pizza-riffing Julia that can be upgraded by Pesto while everyone would be wise to order one of owner Uli Marschner‚Äôs ‚ÄúDani‚Äù that dazzles like Strawberry Shortcake infused with Peppercorns and a hint of acidity from aged Balsamic.

We were part of a well known food tour and had reserved a full table. My wife speaks no German but all the staff could communicate in English and were attentive. Our dumplings arrived fast and we loved the blue cheese dumplings. Reasonably priced and highly recommended.

1 kind of dish... infinite possibilities, very unique combinations from cuisines all around the world, super sweet service and please don't pass on the funky lemonade... it will get you somewhat happy and high ;))

What a find - thanks to TripAdvisor for the recommendation. A bit of a walk from the centre but a very pleasant one taking you through the lovely Prenzlauer Berg. 

It's a tiny cafe with a very warm welcome, lovely flowers and fun cartoons on the walls, serving variations on the same theme - Austrian yeast dumplings, with different savoury and sweet fillings. We had one with kimchi and another with spicy lentils and chutney, and had to leave room for the sweet ones - the Netti, with stewed plums, poppy seeds and brown butter was one of the nicest things I have ever eaten. 

Drinks were also lovely and staff could not have been lovelier.b

I celebrated my birthday with a group of friends and relatives at Restaurant Ebert on January 20, 2026. 

The four-course menu was excellent. Everyone was thrilled. The service was perfect, especially Mrs. Ebert was a very nice hostess and responded to all wishes. Even the normal opening hours were exceeded, because on January 21st it was my sister's birthday.

I can only recommend the restaurant. The next time we visit Berlin we will be happy to come back.
What a great place! Super nice and attentive staff, great food and excellent atmosphere in a quiet suburb of Berlin. Do not miss out if you are in Berlin.

here everything is just right - the food a revelation, the ambience just pleasant and the service as always great - today was my birthday dinner here once again and I couldn't ask for a nicer gift. thanks to the Ebert with his entire crew :-) Christine

I come to the Ebert very often with business partners, friends and family and everyone is enthusiastic - it's just a safe address for best food and good service - here the price-performance quality is right - not so often found in Berlin at the moment!

Thanks to the Ebert team!

Like every year, I went out to eat gas with a friend. Due to positive reviews we ended up in the Ebert. The corner restaurant is "neat" with adequate table linen. The placement took despite reservation. The service is superficially friendly. Now to the goose. The roast goose is no bargain at 44 euros. You get asked chest or club. A table must share half a goose. I had helped decide for the club. A leg smaller than a chicken leg was then served. I'd never seen anything like it. Next to it was a rag with skin. The meat was moderate. Due to the small club tough, the flesh of the rag difficult. When roasting goose, you look forward to crispy skin. That's what we searched for in vain. The announced apple with cranberries was cold and hard. Then it became unfortunate. Contact with service. He told us that the apple was just decoration and had always been served cold for 37 years. Aha, how the restaurant then makes it into the recommendations is unclear. The service had further denied that the club was unusually small. Otherwise they wouldn't have been extradited, Aha. The customer is presented as a moron, you shouldn't do that. The side dishes clove and herb were ok. Overall, we will visit another restaurant next year. I wonder what happened to top-class gastronomy. Unfortunately, only the price is right.
Service and food were not special and too expensive what was offered. Tortellini tasted of garlic and portion was moderate. Zurich squirreled was nothing special either. R√∂stli wasn't fried through.

We were again in the restaurant Ebert. While previous visits did not give rise to complaints, this time it was the opposite.
We had plaice with fried potatoes and veal schnitzel with asparagus.The fried potatoes soft and cardboard the plaice very thin, consisted mainly of breadcrumbs.
The asparagus should have been in the boiling water for a few minutes longer, so the asparagus was still too hard, could hardly be cut with the blunt knife. It also lacked the pinch of sugar; which is actually added to the boiling water. The two small, thin veal chips lacked the spice, tasted bland. Cranberries would have done the meat good. To mention the price of veal cutlets with Beelitzer asparagus: 41,00 Euro !
We haven't eaten so badly in a long time.

Attractive atmosphere, nice service. Starter: Potato soup, totally in the style of homemaker kind. So far ok, but the price of 10 euros is more spiced than the soup and lacks a little taste kick.
The starter "Bried Blood Sausage" is spiced up to the main course for a fair 25 euros. My question about mustard darkens the face of the waitress. "Good sauce," she says, "just try it like that." Yes, sir. Mustard is not necessary. I would have brought it anyway.
A disappointment the marzipan cream brul√©e. A little blob of cold cream. My objection, that it is precisely the combination of warm caramel layer and unheated cream that makes the appeal, is blown away: The chef would go over the shift with the Bunsen burner before it was sent. This shift here has never seen a burner! However, the sour cherries, whose raison d‚Äô√™tre is not completely obvious to me, are boiling hot. Maybe the chef just slipped?
Bottom line: good. Good enough to come back? I don't know yet.
What a find. Family owned and run. Very friendly with great food. We went Sunday night which was a special Italian night alongside the usual menu. Excellent value. Would definitely go again.

Situated a bit away from the hustle and bustle of a residential district, our discovery of the day is ‚Äúhiding‚Äù: 
very nice and attentive staff, a small, fine menu that was supplemented by an Austrian special menu and a kitchen that knows how to do it! 
Ebert‚Äôs is on our favourites list for Berlin!
For a tourist, it might be an upscale German restaurant, but we were disappointed by the not outstanding food nor service. Look further, you will find better places elsewhere.
One of the best Culinary evenings ever! Go to Ebert‚Äôs family run for 40 years and totally amazing!

Just home from an absolutely fantastic evening. The food, recipes from Mr Wannermacher ( had a michelin star for many years) was beautifully prepared, cooked, presented and served. The Salmon in the Starter had a consistence I have never had before, it was delicious. The Lobster Bisque was the best I have ever had, I could have bathed in it! Flank steak excellent and the desert was a mixture of the best chocolate moise and passion fruit gel and semi fredo, a perfect balance of two tastes. Thank you for this wonderful experience!

A great restaurant, very cozy, great dishes, great quality.
I highly recommend it. We will definitely come back!

This is what you expect from a contemporary German food.

Food is very nice, service is flawless, atmosphere very familiar.

Pan fried pikeperch with pan fried potatoes was just too much fried combination. 

Otherwise only recommendation!

The service was nice and accommodating, especially given the restaurant staffed to the last table. Unfortunately, the quality of the food dropped significantly. We ate martinsgans menu. The foie gras pie was very tasty, the vegetable broth that followed unfortunately only lukewarm. The goose was very bad, because of the sauce already prepared on the plate it was not very crusty, the knives were unfortunately not sharp enough, so the division was very difficult. Red cabbage and kale were acceptable, so were dumplings. All in all acceptable, but not a great experience, which hurts in the face of great demand. In addition, the noise level was very high, so talking about the table was almost impossible, but we were there for dinner as wellüòÑ. Perhaps our expectations were too high, as we had assumed the Other level of the restaurant.

Excellent value for money. Great atmosphere. Good standard of typical Berlin cuisine - even German-. Excellent deal. Very good ambient music. The crook and the Wiener Schnitzel really excellent. The best I've ever tasted in Germany.

What a quaint pub!
The staff with heart in the right place, plus the typical ‚ÄúBerlin muzzle‚Äù. 
The food was delicious, who likes it hearty, is absolutely right here!

A nice Welcoming and a good table for a small and atypical establishment in this very impersonal neighborhood. At the hotel right next door, I enjoyed being able to find a personal place and away from "groups".

Visited on our first evening after a seven hour train journey from Gdansk.

Arrived at 7pm and the few tables outside were taken but we had a table inside next to the open window looking onto the street.

For our first visit to Germany what else could we try but currywurst - and it was really enjoyable.

Very good restaurant with German cuisine. The dishes are excellent and very hearty. It offers a wide range of German beers.

We were looking for traditional german restaurant and we found this. It is a german pub that served authentic german food and alcohol. We had a Berliner pilsner beer and a currywurst to eat. The place seems pretty touristic but food seems authentic.

Hubby had the schnitzel (it was better than it looked) with creamed mushrooms, fried potatoes and sauerkraut. I had the bratwurst with mashed potatoes, gravy and sauerkraut. The schnitzel was crispy on the outside and oh so tender on the inside. The creamed mushrooms and fried potatoes were good I‚Äôm assuming (I didn‚Äôt have a bite). The brats were amazing‚Äî-and considering I was raised in them in WI that compliment is hard to give. They were juicy and sliced just right. The mashed potatoes and gravy were out of this world‚ÄîI don‚Äôt eat them often but I almost cleaned the plate (and portions were ample)

I‚Äôm devoting an entire paragraph to the sauerkraut. I love the stuff we get in the US‚Äîusually I buy a high end German specialty brand in a jar. HOWEVER‚Ä¶the Poles and Germans do something different (and very special) with their sauerkraut here in Eastern Europe. First of all it has carrots in it. Secondly it isn‚Äôt as tangy as what we get in the states. It‚Äôs almost creamy. The Poles put very finely minced sausage in theirs. Those who like solid home cooking and a well-kept Pilsener on tap are in good hands here and will not be disappointed. The host is friendly. International audience due to the central location.

The Berlin meeting point is a recommendation.

Very friendly welcome, the room is nice and you can also eat out. The menu offers various meat, poultry, fish, vegetarian dishes. Order taking and service are fast. The staff is very attentive. Plates are hearty, good and well presented. The wine is good. Beers, too. I recommend currywurst and herring fillets. Vegetables are delicious and potatoes are very well cooked. Delicious food and great beer in a cozy setting. The schnitzel (fried pork cutlet with corn flakes) is highly recommended, and the apple strudel is outstanding.
